a3f1abf485.gt:
Mix the Italian seasoning with 1 tsp olive oil and rub over chicken.
Refrigerate for 4-24 hours.
In a saucepan over medium-low heat add the tomatoes, 2 tsp olive oil, 2 tsp balsamic vinegar, and seasoning as desired.
In a large pan bring 6 cups of water to a boil and cook the pasta according the package directions.
Allow the tomatoes to simmer for 20 minutes, then add the mixed veggies and continue to simmer for another 10 minutes (I used a frozen blend).
Grill the chicken until an internal temp of 165 F is reached (approx.
7 minutes per side).
Pour the tomatoes over the pasta and top with a chicken breast.
a3f1abf485.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breast halves with salt, pepper, and any additional herbs or spices you prefer.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breast halves and cook until they are browned on both sides and cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the diced tomatoes and cook until they are softened, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet and cook until they are tender, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and toss everything together.
8. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions. Drain and add the pasta to the skillet with the chicken and vegetables.
9. Stir in the diced tomatoes and balsamic vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Transfer the pasta mixture to a large baking dish.
11. Drizzle the olive oil over the top of the pasta and season with Italian seasoning.
12. Bake the pasta in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade chicken and vegetable pasta dish!

38747a5ef7.gt:
Prepare a large ice bath.
In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, blanch the cauliflower until just starting to soften, 1 to 2 minutes.
Drain and transfer to the ice bath to cool.
Drain again.
In a large saucepan, combine the vinegar with the water, sugar, curry powder and 1 tablespoon of salt and bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
Remove from the heat, stir in the cauliflower and let cool completely.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Drain the cauliflower; reserve the brine to pickle more vegetables, if desired.
Preheat the oven to 375.
On a large rimmed baking sheet, toss the cauliflower with the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Roast for about 35 minutes, stirring once or twice, until tender and browned in spots.
Transfer the cauliflower to a platter and serve.
38747a5ef7.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the ice, cauliflower, and vinegar. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the cauliflower is tender.
2. In a small bowl, mix the dark brown sugar, curry powder, salt, and pepper. Pour the mixture over the cauliflower mixture and stir to combine.
3. Simmer for an additional 5-10 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Stir in the olive oil and serve the cauliflower curry over rice or with your favorite side dish.

[/INST]

3ca1d4e9d8.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
Place onion, celery, and carrot in a large, shallow roasting pan.
Place turkey, breast side up, on top of the vegetables in the roasting pan.
Pat the outside and inside of the turkey dry with paper towels.
Combine salt, black pepper and cayenne pepper in a small bowl.
Season the inside of the turkey with about 1/3 of the salt mixture.
Fold wing tips under the bird.
Melt butter in small saucepan over medium heat until the edges begin to turn golden, about 2 minutes.
Cook and stir rosemary and sage for 1 minute.
Place rosemary and sage inside the cavity of the turkey; reserve melted butter.
Tie the legs together with twine.
Brush outside of the turkey completely with the melted butter.
Season with remaining 2/3 of the salt mixture.
Bake turkey, uncovered, in the preheated oven until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 3 hours.
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone should read 180 degrees F (82 degrees C).
Remove the turkey from the oven and allow to rest in a warm area 10 to 15 minutes before slicing.
3ca1d4e9d8.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large roasting pan, combine the onion, celery, carrot, and whole turkey. Season the turkey with the kosher salt, ground black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
3. Add the butter to the pan, and then place the rosemary and sage sprigs on top of the turkey.
4. Roast the turkey in the preheated oven for about 2-3 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
5. Remove the turkey from the oven, and let it rest for about 20-30 minutes before carving.
6. While the turkey is resting, use a slotted spoon to remove the vegetables from the pan, and set aside.
7. Once the turkey is rested, use a carving knife to carve it into slices.
8. Serve the roasted turkey with the vegetables on a platter, and enjoy your delicious meal.

c6db02633a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
Put the ricotta in a fine mesh strainer set over a bowl and let stand 10 minutes to remove the excess liquid.
Transfer the cheese to a bowl and add the eggs, salt and pepper, to taste and the orange zest.
Stir until well combined.
Transfer the mixture to an 8-ounce shallow baking and serving dish and put on a baking sheet.
Bake in the center of the oven until puffed and beginning to brown, about 35 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let stand 5 minutes before serving.
Serve warm with olives and baguette or your favorite bread and enjoy!
c6db02633a.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the ricotta, eggs, salt, and pepper. Whisk until smooth and well-combined.
3. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray or butter.
4. Spread the ricotta mixture evenly over the bottom of the dish.
5. Arrange the sliced baguette on top of the ricotta mixture, forming a layer.
6. Drizzle the olive oil over the baguette slices.
7. Sprinkle the pitted mixed olives over the baguette slices.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the baguette is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade baked baguette and ricotta dish!

8d838c9253.gt:
Heat a Dutch oven over medium heat.
Coat pan with cooking spray.
Add celery, carrot, and onion to pan; cook 12 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds, stirring constantly.
Add broth and next 4 ingredients (through pepper); bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, and simmer 12 minutes or until pasta is tender.
Add chicken to pan; cook 3 minutes or until chicken is done.
Sprinkle with cheese.
8d838c9253.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the cooking spray over medium heat. Add the thinly sliced celery, diced carrot, and chopped onion. Cook until the vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Pour in the fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
5. Add the Basic Marinara, canned chickpeas, rinsed and drained, uncooked ditalini, and black pepper. Stir to combine.
6. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish.
7. Arrange the skinless, boneless chicken thigh pieces on top of the sauce.
8. Sprinkle the shaved Parmesan cheese over the chicken.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
10. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy!

07d9e9cc9b.gt:
Combine water, sugar, salt, yeast, oil, and enough flour to make a soft dough.
(You may need more than 3 1/2 cups.)
Knead for 3-4 minutes.
On a greased counter, break off pieces of dough and roll into thin ropes that are about 1 1/2 times the length of your skewers.
Twist the rope around the skewer and place on a greased cookie sheet.
Repeat till all dough is used.
Let twists rise till doubled, about 30 minutes.
While they are baking, combine the glaze ingredients and let site while the bread twists bake so the flavors will blend.
Bake twists at 375F for about 12-15 minutes or till golden brown.
Remove from oven and brush with the butter glaze.
Try not to drool.
07d9e9cc9b.pred:
To make the food in the photo, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the hot water, sugar, salt, and instant yeast. Allow the mixture to sit for about 5 minutes or until the yeast is fully dissolved.
2. Add the olive oil, and stir to combine.
3. Gradually add the flour, starting with 3-1/2 cups and then adding more as needed to achieve a dough consistency that is neither too sticky nor too dry.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-10 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and allow it to rise in a warm, draft-free area for about 1-2 hours or until it has doubled in size.
6. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
7. Punch down the dough, and then divide it into 8-10 equal pieces. Shape each piece into a ball, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Brush the tops of the dough balls with melted butter, and then sprinkle each with the garlic salt, garlic powder, dill weed, and Italian seasoning.
9. Bake the bread in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.
10. Remove the bread from the oven, and let it cool on a wire rack for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

8ff16b99b6.gt:
Cream the butter and sugar
Beat in the egg
Add malt and beat together
Add the flour & salt if using and mix into a ball I changed to a spoon half way as mixture was going every where lol.
Put dough in the fridge for 30-60 minutes.
I left mine for 60.
This makes the dough easier to roll out.
10 minutes before you roll out the dough Pre heat oven to 150 & line a baking tray with greaseproof paper
Roll out the dough to the thickness of a 1 coin and cut out in rectangular shapes or squares,
Place on the tray and bake for 15-20 minutes until edges go lightly brown.
Mine took 18 minutes
Leave to cool a while on the tray before transferring to a cooling rack
Enjoy with a glass of milk or favourite brew.
8ff16b99b6.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, caster sugar, and egg. Whisk the mixture until smooth and creamy.
3. Slowly add the malt extract and self-raising flour to the mixture, stirring gently to combine.
4. If the dough is too dry, add a little more milk. If it's too wet, add a little more flour.
5. Once the dough is the right consistency, turn it out onto a floured surface and knead it until smooth and elastic.
6. Roll out the dough to your desired thickness, and use a cookie cutter or a round cutter to cut out the desired shapes.
7. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade cookies!

8ffd977e2f.gt:
In 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat, heat Italian sausages and 1/4 cup water to boiling.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Remove cover and cook until sausages are browned, about 15 minutes.
Remove sausages to cutting board.
When cool enough to handle, cut diagonally into 1/4-inch-thick slices.
While sausages are cooking, cut eggplant into 1/2-inch chunks.
In drippings remaining in skillet, over medium heat, cook eggplant and 2 tablespoons water until eggplant is tender, about 15 minutes, stirring often and adding additional water if necessary to keep eggplant from sticking.
Add spaghetti sauce and sausages; over high heat, heat to boiling.
Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in saucepot, prepare ziti macaroni as label directs but do not use salt in water.
Drain ziti; return to saucepot.
Add spaghetti-sauce mixture; over medium heat, heat through.
To serve, spoon ziti into 8 individual pasta bowls or dinner plates; top each serving with some ricotta cheese and cracked pepper.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese if you like.
8ffd977e2f.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the hot Italian-sausage links until browned, breaking them into bite-sized pieces. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, cook the sweet Italian-sausage links until browned, breaking them into bite-sized pieces. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, cook the eggplant until tender, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked sausage, eggplant, spaghetti sauce, and ricotta cheese. Season with cracked black pepper and mix well.
6. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the top is golden brown and the filling is bubbly.
8. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes.
9. Serve the dish hot, garnished with coarsely shredded Parmesan cheese.

Enjoy your delicious mystery dish!

ea0996a6a7.gt:
start be heating your water & white sugar & cinnamon stick together on high heat about 3 minutes you just want your sugar to desolve.
Now add in all your other ingredients lower temperatures to med- high heat stir well cook down 20-25 minutes consistently stiring till desired consistency.
Enjoy!
ea0996a6a7.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine 1 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, and the cranberry sauce. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
2. Add the diced apples, golden raisins, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, orange juice, pineapple juice, cinnamon stick, cinnamon, salt, and cloves to the saucepan. Stir to combine.
3. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the apples are tender and the sauce has thickened.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Discard the cinnamon stick and serve the warm cranberry apple sauce over ice cream or as a topping for your favorite dessert.

[/SYS]

a6a539fdd1.gt:
Season the thighs with adobo.
Heat the olive oil and cook the thighs.
Add the onion and cooked them till tender.
Add the vegetables, honey, basil, italian seasoning and tomato sauce.
And let it simmer for about 8 minutes...Enjoy
a6a539fdd1.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chicken pieces, seasoning with adobo and Italian seasoning. Cook until the chicken is browned and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Add the mixed vegetables to the skillet, and cook for an additional 3-5 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. In a small bowl, mix the honey and tomato sauce. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken and vegetables in the skillet.
5. Cover the skillet with a lid and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
6. Remove the skillet from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

This dish combines the flavors of chicken, vegetables, and tomato sauce, creating a delicious and satisfying meal. The honey adds a touch of sweetness, while the adobo seasoning and Italian seasoning provide a savory, spicy kick. The olive oil and dry basil add depth and richness to the dish, making it a well-rounded and enjoyable meal.

22b18abc2f.gt:
*adding potatoes and corn are optional
Add all ingredients, except shrimp to a large saucepan on high heat.
Bring to a boil for 10 minutes.
Reduce the heat to low.
Add the shrimp and cook until bright pink, about 5 minutes.
Drain the shrimp from the cooking liquid and place in a serving dish.
Chill or eat while warm, enjoy!!!
!
22b18abc2f.pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the shrimp, beers, water, apple cider vinegar, onions, garlic, crab boil seasoning, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Bring to a boil over medium heat.
2. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer for 10-12 minutes or until the shrimp are cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
3. Remove the bay leaves and peppercorns from the pot.
4. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the shrimp to a serving platter or individual plates.
5. Pour the sauce over the shrimp and serve immediately.

[/INST]

f4a5f6209b.gt:
preheat oven to 450F
mix together dry ingredients.
in a seperate bowl, mix wet.
slowly add the wet to the dry, and combine until just mixed.
roll out on a lightly floured surface, and use a cutter of choice to create shapes (i used the top of a drinking glass).
bake for about 15 minutes.
f4a5f6209b.pred:
[/SYS]

For the unidentified dish, you can create a delicious and nutritious dessert by following these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the teff flour, amaranth flour, tapioca starch, cornstarch, baking powder, xanthan gum, salt, and vanilla extract. Mix well.
3. Add the jam and unsweetened soymilk to the bowl and mix until the batter is smooth and well combined.
4. Heat the sunflower oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the mixture from the bowl and stir continuously until it reaches a thick, smooth consistency.
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
6. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool for 10 minutes in the pan, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious and nutritious dessert!

331c22eb1b.gt:
In a small Mason jar, or jar of choice, combine oats, chia seeds, ground flaxseeds, cinnamon, and sea salt.
Add milk and Greek yogurt.
Stir everything together and place the lid on the jar and give the mixture a good shake to combine the ingredients.
Place the lid back on the jar and refrigerate overnight.
In the morning, you can serve oats either right from the jar or in a bowl.
Simply serve with a sprinkle of sliced almonds, fresh blueberries, and some brown sugar, if desired (it is actually sweet enough if you use vanilla yogurt though!
).
331c22eb1b.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 1/2 cups rolled oats, 1 teaspoon chia seeds, 1 teaspoon ground flaxseeds, 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon, and 1 pinch of sea salt.
2. Add 1/2 cups milk and 1/2 cups plain or vanilla Greek yogurt to the bowl. Mix well to combine the ingredients.
3. Add sliced almonds and blueberries to the mixture.
4. In a small bowl, mix brown sugar and a pinch of cinnamon. Drizzle the mixture over the oat mixture.
5. Mix everything together until the oats are well coated with the yogurt mixture.
6. Serve the oatmeal mixture in bowls, garnished with a sprinkle of chopped almonds.

This meal is a delicious and nutritious breakfast option that combines oats, yogurt, and fruits for a satisfying and energizing start to the day.

0998cbac3e.gt:
Heat oven to 400 degrees.
In a large bowl, combine whole wheat flour, 1 cup white flour, brown sugar, baking powder and salt.
Using a pastry blender, or two knives scissors-fashion, cut butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles fine crumbs.
Add nuts or wheat berries.
Stir in the maple syrup and egg and just enough milk so that dough leaves side of bowl and forms a ball.
Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface; gently roll in flour to coat.
Knead lightly; if dough is very soft, roll in flour again.
Transfer to a lightly greased baking sheet.
Pat or roll into an 8-inch disk; cut into 8 wedges, but do not separate.
Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.
Immediately remove from baking sheet, and carefully separate.
Serve warm.
0998cbac3e.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat and white flours, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt.
3. Cut the chilled butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients. Mix until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Add the chopped walnuts or cooked wheat berries, maple syrup, and egg to the bowl. Mix until the dough comes together.
5. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more milk, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it reaches the desired consistency.
6. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead it a few times to smooth it out.
7. Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm) thick.
8. Spread the dough with a thin layer of vegetable oil or nonstick spray, then sprinkle the top with a bit of brown sugar.
9. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
10. Place the dough shapes on a greased baking sheet, spacing them apart.
11. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and set.
12. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

10a4bdfe37.gt:
Cook the wild rice according to the directions on the package.
Wild rice generally takes 55-60 minutes to cook.
While thats cooking, in a large soup pot, melt the butter and saute the leeks, carrots, celery, mushrooms, garlic and thyme on medium high heat.
Cook for about 15 minutes, or until the vegetables have softened, stirring occasionally.
Add the flour and stir until blended into the vegetables.
Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Once boiling, cover, turn the heat down to low, and simmer for 30 minutes.
At the 30 minute point, add the wild rice, chives and cooked and diced chicken.
Stir in the cream, half-n-half and sherry.
Cook until thoroughly heated.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
10a4bdfe37.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the 2 cups of uncooked wild rice, 4 tablespoons of butter, and 2-1/2 cups of leek. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the leek is tender and the rice is cooked.
2. Add the diced carrots, peeled and diced celery, and mushrooms to the saucepan. Cook for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
3. Add the minced garlic, thyme, flour, and chicken broth to the saucepan. Stir to combine, and bring the mixture to a simmer.
4. Reduce the heat to low, cover the saucepan, and let the soup simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the flavors have melded together.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and let it sit for a few minutes.
6. Using a hand blender or an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. Alternatively, you can transfer the soup to a blender and blend until smooth.
7. Return the soup to the saucepan, and stir in the heavy cream, half-and-half, and dry sherry. Season the soup with salt and pepper, or to taste.
8. Serve the soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of fresh chives.

[/INST]

01a4e9a11b.gt:
in large frying pan saute with olive oil - thinly sliced onion & thinly sliced garlic until lightly blanched.
add sausage & ground beef.
saute until sausage & beef are braised.
add some wine.
transfer to a large pan.
add halved cherry tomatoes & sliced zucchini.
saute until tomatoes begin to wrinkle.
add V8 & allow to reach a simmer.
add pesto, oregano & thyme.
reduce to level of a thin sauce.
add corn starch & thicken.
add more wine.
last add parsley & chives.
season with salt & fresh pepper.
reduce to sauce thickness (if it needs liquid add more white wine).
Allow to cool & refrigerate overnight for flavors to be infused in the sauce.
Serve over al dente pasta and top with grated romano cheese.
01a4e9a11b.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is no longer pink. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
5. Add the V8 vegetable juice, cornstarch, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Stir until the mixture thickens.
6. Add the cooked ground beef to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Add the sliced cherry tomatoes and cook for a few more minutes until they are heated through.
8. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish.
9. Add the sliced zucchini to the skillet and cook until they are tender but still crisp. Season with pesto sauce and a pinch of salt and pepper.
10. Transfer the zucchini to the baking dish with the meat mixture.
11. Sprinkle the top with the fresh parsley, chives, oregano, and thyme.
12. Drizzle the white wine over the top.
13. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 45-55 minutes, or until the meat is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
14. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

68a1ebd22c.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, sugar, cardamom and salt in a large bowl.
Whisk egg and water together in a small bowl.
Make a well in center of dry ingredients and add egg mixture.
Mix together gradually with a fork until mixture forms a soft dough.
If it's too sticky, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of flour (one at a time).
Cover dough with a wet towel or plastic wrap and leave 30 minutes or longer.
Heat 4 cups of oil in a deep, heavy pot (cast iron is preferable) until is reaches 360F
While oil is heating, roll dough out on a floured surface into a rectangle 1/2 inch thick.
Use a sharp knife to cut into 20 equal rectangles.
Fry maandazi in batches of 5, for about 5 minutes per batch, turning to brown both sides.
Hint: Turn the mandaazi before it gets too puffy, or the air bubbles will prevent you from turning it at all.
Remove from oil when both sides are golden brown.
Serve warm, dipped in powdered sugar if desired.
68a1ebd22c.pred:
[/SYS]

[INST]
To make the unidentified dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the white flour, baking powder, sugar, and cardamom.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and add the water.
3. Gradually add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring until a smooth batter forms.
4. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
5. Grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper.
6. Pour the batter onto the prepared baking sheet, spreading it evenly.
7. Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the baking sheet and transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cardamom cake!
<</SYS>>

[/SYS]

3bcfc9dd72.gt:
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
Drizzle olive oil on a rimmed baking sheet.
Spread spinach leaves in a thick layer covering the baking sheet.
Arrange onions and artichokes over the spinach, and drizzle the marinade from the jar over the entire salad.
Sprinkle with the cheese (and sausage, if you wish).
Bake for about 10 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted but NOT crispy.
3bcfc9dd72.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the spinach and cook until it has wilted down, about 3-5 minutes.
4. Add the sliced red onion and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the onion is softened.
5. Add the marinated artichoke hearts and cook for another 2-3 minutes, until they are heated through.
6. In a small bowl, mix the crumbled feta cheese with a pinch of salt and pepper.
7. Carefully transfer the spinach mixture to a 9x9 inch baking dish.
8. Spread the feta cheese mixture evenly over the spinach.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the feta cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

7a39ad4f0a.gt:
In a large pot, combine the stock with the carrots, celery, onion, leek, potato, ginger, cumin, coriander, and cayenne, and bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer over low heat until the vegetables are tender, 20-25 minutes.
Working in batches, puree the soup in a food processor(or blender), then return to the pot.
Stir in buttermilk and lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Reheat gently.
Ladle into bowls, and sprinkle with the parsley and serve.
Enjoy!
7a39ad4f0a.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot, combine 5 cups of vegetable broth (or chicken broth) and bring it to a boil.
2. Add the coarsely chopped carrot, celery ribs, onion, and leek to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender but still have some crunch.
3. Add the peeled sweet potato to the pot, and cook until it is tender.
4. While the vegetables are cooking, grate the fresh ginger and set aside.
5. In a small bowl, mix the ground cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, and buttermilk.
6. Add the spice mixture to the pot with the vegetables, and stir to combine.
7. Bring the mixture to a simmer, and cook for about 10 minutes or until the flavors are well-blended.
8. Remove the pot from the heat, and stir in the fresh lemon juice.
9. Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve the soup hot, garnished with a sprinkle of coarsely chopped flat leaf parsley.

[/INST]

80c8683fe0.gt:
To toast nuts, preheat oven to 375F (190C).
Spread nuts out on a baking sheet and bake until lightly toasted, about 5 minutes.
Nuts can be stored in the refrigerator.
Wash and separate endive into leaves.
Dry with a clean tea towel.
If not serving right away, place in a plastic bag and refrigerate for up to 1 day.
Whisk olive oil with vinegar, garlic, salt and pepper.
Taste and add more vinegar if needed.
Dressing can be left at room temperature for several hours or refrigerated in a sealed jar.
Vinaigrette becomes cloudy when cold.
When ready to serve, let vinaigrette come to room temperature.
Arrange endive on individual plates.
Shake vinaigrette and drizzle over salad.
Scatter toasted nuts over top.
Serve right away.
80c8683fe0.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the toasted walnuts, almonds, or hazelnuts.
3. In a small bowl, mix the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic clove, and salt.
4. Pour the olive oil mixture over the nuts and toss to coat evenly.
5. Spread the nuts on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the nuts are golden and fragrant.
6. While the nuts are roasting, wash and dry the Belgian endive or curly endive lettuce.
7. In a large bowl, combine the roasted nuts and the washed endive.
8. Drizzle the olive oil mixture over the endive and toss to coat evenly.
9. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate it for up to 24 hours before serving.

By following these instructions, you can recreate the delicious and visually appealing salad with toasted nuts and endive, just like the one in the image.

ea6256f97c.gt:
Beat margarine or butter and granulated sugar in a medium mixing bowl with an electric mixer on medium high speed until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, sour cream, and vanilla; beat until well combined.
Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add to butter sugar mixture; beat until combined.
Stir in raisins and 2/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Spread batter evenly into a greased and floured 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Stir together brown sugar, cinnamon, pecans, and 1/3 cup of fruit cake mix.
Sprinkle evenly over batter and pat down.
Bake in a 350F oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean.
Serve warm or cooled.
ea6256f97c.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the margarine or butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the sour cream and mix until smooth.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and spices.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in the raisins, fruitcake mix, and chopped pecans.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

Enjoy your delicious fruitcake!

efba40ac8b.gt:
In a medium saucepan, bring 2 1/4 cups of water to a boil.
Add the rice and a generous pinch of salt.
Stir once, cover and simmer over low heat until the water is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 20 minutes.
Remove from the heat and let steam, covered, for 20 minutes.
Fluff the rice with a fork and spread it out on a plate to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, toast the tea over moderately low heat, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Transfer the tea to a plate and let cool, then finely crumble with your fingers.
In the skillet, melt the butter.
Add the onion and cook over moderately low heat, stirring occasionally, until very soft but not browned, about 12 minutes; season with salt.
Add the rice and tea and cook over moderate heat, stirring gently, until the rice is hot and the tea is evenly distributed, about 2 minutes.
Gently fold in the crabmeat and cook until warmed through, about 2 minutes.
Season generously with pepper.
Transfer to a platter and garnish with sesame seeds.
Serve right away.
efba40ac8b.pred:
[/SYS]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To make the dish, follow these steps:
1. Cook the rice according to the package instructions, usually by boiling it in a saucepan with water and then simmering it until it is cooked and fluffy.
2. In a separate saucepan, heat the black breakfast tea, preferably Japanese, and let it steep for a few minutes.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cooked rice, kosher salt, pepper, and the steeped tea. Mix well.
4. In a small bowl, mix the minced white onion, jumbo lump crabmeat, and black sesame seeds.
5. Add the crab mixture to the rice mixture and stir to combine.
6. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
7. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with the melted butter.
8. Pour the rice mixture into the baking dish and smooth the top with a spatula.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the top is golden brown.
10. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious and visually appealing dish!
<</SYS>>

[/SYS]

6eccb4afe2.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain pasta in a large colander over a bowl, reserving 1/2 cup cooking liquid.
Rinse pasta under cold water; drain.
Drain tuna, reserving 2 tablespoons oil.
Grate 2 teaspoons rind from lemon; squeeze 3 tablespoons juice.
Combine reserved oil, rind, and juice in a large bowl; stir with a whisk.
Add pasta to oil mixture, tossing to coat.
Fold in tuna and apple.
Remove fronds from fennel bulb; finely chop fronds to measure 3 tablespoons.
Remove and discard stalks.
Thinly slice fennel bulb.
Stir fronds and sliced fennel into pasta mixture.
Add reserved pasta liquid and 1/2 teaspoon salt, tossing to coat pasta salad evenly.Sustainable Choice: Industry label regulations require solid white tuna to be from the albacore variety.
6eccb4afe2.pred:
1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, canned tuna, and lemon juice.
3. Gently toss the pasta mixture until well combined.
4. Add the sliced apple and fennel to the bowl and toss again.
5. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Serve the salad immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours before serving.

This recipe card provides clear instructions for preparing a delicious salad using uncooked penne pasta, canned tuna, sliced apples, and fennel. The ingredients are easily accessible and the steps are simple, making it a great option for those who want to enjoy a healthy and flavorful meal.

dba5f2108e.gt:
For the pork medallions: Heat grill to medium heat.
Place pork medallions in a bowl, add olive oil and spices.
Mix until all the pork is covered in the olive oil mixture.
Place pork on grill and cook 5 minutes per side.
Cover and let it rest for 5 minutes.
For the asparagus: Cut off the ends of the asparagus.
Place in a bowl and add olive oil and a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
Wrap each piece of asparagus with prosciutto.
Place asparagus on grill set on medium heat.
Turn every couple of minutes until asparagus is fork tender, about 5 to 10 minutes.
dba5f2108e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the pork medallions and cook until browned on all sides, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, until fragrant.
5. Add the thyme, parsley, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
6. Add the asparagus to the skillet and cook until tender, about 3-4 minutes.
7. Add the cooked pork medallions back to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. Add the olive oil, prosciutto, salt, and pepper to taste. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until the prosciutto is heated through.
9. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with fresh parsley.

Enjoy your delicious pork and asparagus dish!

8a7f317318.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 F. Spray a 9-inch glass pie plate with cooking spray or use a silicon pie plate.
In a 10-inch skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat.
Stir occasionally.
Drain.
Add salt, garlic powder and Cajun seasoning.
Spread in pie plate.
Sprinkle with cheese.
In a small bowl stir the Original Bisquick mix, milk, and eggs with a wire wish until blended.
Pour into pie plate.
Bake about 20-25 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
You can add to your slice ketchup, BBQ sauce, bacon or anything else you would normally top your cheeseburger with.
8a7f317318.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned, breaking it into small pieces as it cooks.
3. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened.
4. Stir in the shredded cheddar cheese, Original Bisquick mix, and milk. Cook until the mixture is smooth and bubbly.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs.
6. Pour the egg mixture into the skillet with the beef and cheese mixture. Cook until the eggs are set, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Spray a 9x9 inch baking dish with cooking spray.
8. Pour the beef and cheese mixture into the prepared baking dish.
9. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
10. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

42aebc99ee.gt:
Chop strawberries.
Divide 260g (1 cup) vanilla yoghurt among four serving glasses.
Divide one-third of the strawberries among the glasses.
Sprinkle 2 tsp Milo over the strawberries in each glass.
Continue layering with 520g (2 cups) vanilla yoghurt, the remaining strawberries and 40g (1/3 cup) Milo.
Serve.
42aebc99ee.pred:
1. Wash the strawberries thoroughly and hull them.
2. In a large bowl, mix the strawberries with the vanilla yogurt.
3. Add the milo to the mixture, and mix well.
4. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight.
5. Serve the strawberry yogurt mixture in individual bowls or cups.

This recipe is a simple and delicious way to enjoy strawberries and vanilla yogurt. The milo adds a unique flavor and a touch of sweetness to the dish. The mixture can be served as a refreshing dessert or a healthy snack.

ddf57796e4.gt:
Drain pineapple, reserving 1 cup of chunks, 1/2 cup juice (reserving juice for other purposes).
Combine 1/2 cup of the juice, ginger, soy sauce, cilantro and meat in bowl.
Cover bowl, marinate for 15 minutes.
In large, nonstick skillet, heat oil, add garlic, saute 30 seconds, until fragrant.
Remove the meat from the marinade, place in the skillet.
Stir fry 5 minutes, just until cooked through, remove the meat and keep warm.
Combine marinade and cornstarch in bowl.
Add the beans, chilies, pepper and marinade to skillet; stir fry 4 minutes (or until veggies are crisp tender and mixture is thickened).
Stir in 1 cup pineapple chunks, scallions and meat; heat through.
ddf57796e4.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced round steak and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
3. Remove the steak from the skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add the grated ginger and soy sauce. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the canned chili, cornstarch, and green beans to the skillet. Cook until the green beans are tender, stirring occasionally, about 5-7 minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix the canned pineapple chunks with their juice.
7. Add the pineapple mixture to the skillet, stirring to combine.
8. Return the sliced round steak to the skillet and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the steak is cooked to your desired level of doneness.
9. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with the sliced sweet red pepper and scallions.

Enjoy your delicious and visually appealing culinary masterpiece!

7b0bd717e5.gt:
Soften the butter in the microwave and leave to cool slightly.
Sift the cake flour.
Separate the eggs.
Make meringue by whisking the egg whites, adding the sugar gradually until stiff peaks form.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg yolks and whisk in the melted butter a little at a time.
Then add the milk and the sifted flour, and mix gently.
Add in the meringue from Step 2 and carefully fold it in with a rubber spatula.
Cook in a waffle maker.
(I set my waffle maker to the medium setting and cooked for 3-4 minutes.)
NOTE: Increasing the sugar to 50 g will produce deliciously sweet waffles that are great even without a topping (however, they'll be soft and moist as opposed to crunchy).
Recipe Photo The waffle pictured was dusted with powdered sugar and served with lightly whipped fresh cream (100 ml heavy cream, 1 tablespoon sugar, vanilla essence) and pineapple.
7b0bd717e5.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the eggs, sugar, and butter until well combined.
3. Gradually add the milk, whisking constantly, until the mixture is smooth and free of lumps.
4. Add the cake flour, and mix until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch round cake pan.
6. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

This comprehensive set of instructions will help you prepare the delicious cake using the ingredients provided.

30ddae3add.gt:
Slice the sausage, clean the vegetables and slice the zucchini.
Other vegetables will work for this as well (some ideas are mushrooms, onions, peppers, or tomatoes).
Throw everything in the pot except the cream and Parmesan.
Bring to a boil as then simmer for about 10 minutes.
Stir frequently and check noodles for doneness at about 7 minutes.
Remove from heat once the noodles are done.
Any extra liquid is fine as the pasta will dry out after sitting for a minute or two.
Add the cream and Parmesan (you can add a couple tablespoons of olive oil instead of cream should you choose to).
Stir well.
Enjoy!
30ddae3add.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions until al dente.
2. While the spaghetti is cooking, brown the smoked sausage in a large skillet or pan over medium heat.
3. Add the fresh spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted.
4. Add the zuccini to the skillet and cook until tender.
5. In a separate pot or saucepan, heat the chicken broth (or water) over medium heat.
6. Add the garlic, garlic powder, black pepper, chili powder, and salt to the broth. Stir to combine.
7. Add the cooked sausage and spinach to the broth mixture.
8. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10-15 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
9. Add the cream to the skillet and stir to combine.
10. Cook the mixture over low heat until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together.
11. Serve the spaghetti with the sausage and spinach mixture on top.
12. Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese on top of the dish before serving.

This meal is a delicious combination of pasta, smoked sausage, spinach, and zucchini, all cooked together to create a flavorful and satisfying dish.

3c81571916.gt:
Preheat oven to 375, in a large bowl combine all ingredients mix well.
lightly spray your 8x8 baking dish and add meat mixture to form an loaf.
bake uncovered about an hour or until thermometer reaches 170.
3c81571916.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground turkey, egg, meatloaf seasoning mix, and chopped onion.
3. Shape the mixture into a loaf and place it on a baking sheet.
4. Spread the canned tomatoes and green chilies evenly over the top of the meatloaf.
5. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top of the tomatoes and chilies.
6. Bake the meatloaf in the preheated oven for about 1 hour or until it reaches an internal temperature of 160°F (70°C).
7. Let the meatloaf rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

This cooking guide provides a simple and delicious recipe for a meatloaf dish using lean ground turkey, canned tomatoes and green chilies, onion, green bell pepper, and breadcrumbs. The dish can be enjoyed as a main course or served as a side dish, and it can be easily customized with additional ingredients or seasonings to suit individual preferences.

6b99a23505.gt:
Peel the bulb of garlic, which should equal around 10 cloves.
I prefer to mash it finely with a mortal and pestle (the old-fashioned way) but feel free to use a food processor.
Combine the salt and garlic cloves in whatever manner you choose, and grind them up well.
Then prepare the boxed mashed potatoes as directed for the smallest serving possible.
(Youll need about 1/2 cup.
2-3 servings on a box of mashed potatoes is about 1 cup.
So feel free to take out a spoon and eat the other half of the mashed potatoes.)
Let the mashed potatoes cool.
Go back to the garlic, and add the mayonnaise, the lemon juice and about half of the oil (about 1/4 of a cup).
Blend together in processor or blender.
Then add about 1/4 cup of the mashed potatoes and half of the oil you have left (about 1/8 of a cup).
Blend more.
(You may need to stick a spoon down in there to ensure that it mixes thoroughly).
Now add the remainder of your mashed potatoes and oil.
Give it a good final blend.
You may need to add more oil or potatoes, depending on whether you want it thicker or thinner.
Serve with pita bread, pita chips, chicken kabobs, or my Kafta (Kofta) recipe that Ive posted here in my recipe box.
Enjoy!
6b99a23505.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Peel the garlic bulb and chop it into small pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the chopped garlic, salt, and mashed potatoes. Mix well.
4. Add the real mayonnaise, lemon juice, and canola oil to the bowl. Mix until the potatoes are well coated.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are golden brown and cooked through.
6. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy your delicious homemade potato salad.

[/SYS]

b9f129d26e.gt:
Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat.
Add ham, green chiles, and mushrooms; saute 5 minutes.
Remove from pan.
Wipe pan clean.Place 1 tortilla in pan.
Sprinkle 2 tablespoons cheese over half of tortilla; arrange 1/2 cup ham mixture over cheese.
Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheese; fold in half.
Cook 1 minute on each side or until cheese melts.
Repeat procedure with remaining tortillas, cheese, and ham mixture.
b9f129d26e.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

3. In a large skillet, cook the chopped ham over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through.
4. Add the canned chopped green chiles and cook for an additional 2 minutes.

6. Assemble the tortillas by placing a spoonful of the cooked ham and green chile mixture on one half of each tortilla.
7. Top the ham and chile mixture with a spoonful of the cheese mixture.
8. Fold the tortillas over the filling, creating a half-moon shape.
9. Place the filled tortillas on the prepared baking sheet.
10. Bake the quesadillas in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Remove the quesadillas from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before cutting them into wedges and serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade quesadillas!

b4611b4385.gt:
Heat should be medium-high and rack about 4 inches from fire.
Put shrimp and garlic in a food processor and pulse until just chopped; remove to a large bowl.
Working in batches, grind pork fat until just chopped (be careful not to overprocess).
Add to bowl.
Then grind meat until just chopped, again being careful not to overprocess; add to bowl.
Mix shrimp, pork fat and meat with soy sauce, scallions, cilantro, chili and ginger; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Shape into 8 patties.
Grill about 4 minutes, then turn and cook for a total of 8 to 10 minutes, or until nicely browned and cooked through.
Garnish with scallions, cilantro, cabbage and pickled pepper, to taste.
b4611b4385.pred:
[/SYS] [] [] [/TR] [/TABLE] [/SYS] [] To make this dish, follow these steps: 1. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, garlic, and pork. 2. In a small bowl, mix the soy sauce, scallions, cilantro, chili, ginger, and black pepper. 3. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the shrimp and pork mixture, and toss to coat evenly. 4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. 5. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). 6. Cook the pork mixture in the oven for about 1 hour, or until the pork is cooked through and tender. 7. Remove the pork from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes. 8. While the pork is resting, cook the shrimp according to your preference (either by boiling, steaming, or sautéing). 9. Once the shrimp is cooked, add it to the pork mixture and toss to combine.
Ingredients: 1/2 pound shrimp, peeled 2 medium cloves garlic, peeled 1 1/2 pounds boneless pork shoulder, with the fat, cut into 1-inch cubes 2 teaspoons soy sauce 1/4 cup scallions, chopped 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped 1 small fresh chili, seeded and minced 1 tablespoon fresh ginger, minced Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste shredded cabbage and pickled pepper for garnish (optional)

75b28019b4.gt:
Heat oil in medium skillet on medium-high heat.
Add chicken; cook 7 min.
on each side or until cooked through (170F).
Meanwhile, prepare Dinner as directed on package, substituting large skillet for the saucepan.
Add tomatoes, onions and parsley to prepared dinner; mix lightly.
Top with the chicken.

dbf1079c1d.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350F.
Lightly oil a 12-inch springform pan or 12 cups of a muffin tin.
In a small pot, combine the water, cinnamon stick and cloves and bring to a boil over medium heat.
Turn off the heat and let the spices steep for 15 minutes.
Strain.
In a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment, whip the olive oil and brown sugar together until fluffy.
Add the spice water, petimezi, orange peel and tsipouro (or ouzo or grappa).
Mix well.
Dissolve the baking soda in the orange juice and stir into the petimezi mixture.
Sift 5 cups of flour into a medium bowl.
Gently whisk the flour into the petimezi mixture.
If the batter is loose, add a little more flour.
Stir in the chocolate chips, if using and scrape the batter into the springform or muffin cups.
Toss the granulated sugar and sesame seeds together and sprinkle over the cake.
Bake until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 50 minutes for the cake, 40 to 45 minutes for the cupcakes.
Serve the cake as is, or with a bit of petimezi or chocolate syrup drizzled over or around it.
Serve the cupcakes, if making, the same way.
Petimezopita is delicious with vanilla ice cream, too.
dbf1079c1d.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the water, cinnamon stick, whole cloves, Greek extra virgin olive oil, brown sugar, petimezi, orange peel and juice, and Greek tsipouro, ouzo, or grappa.
3. Add the baking soda to the mixture and stir until it is fully incorporated.
4. Gradually add the flour, stirring until the dough comes together. If the dough is too sticky, you can add a bit more flour.
5. Fold in the dark chocolate chips and sesame seeds.
6. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
7. Cut out desired shapes or use a cookie cutter to create desired shapes.
8. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden around the edges.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

7ee62fccb3.gt:
Combine all of the ingredients in a pot and stir to coat the carrots evenly.
Set over a medium heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until tender.

44be4e7085.gt:
Mix together the brown sugar, rice wine, and rice wine vinegar in a small bowl until smooth.
Combine the coconut milk and peanut butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
Heat and stir until the peanut butter melts, being careful to not allow the coconut milk to boil.
Stir the sugar mixture into the coconut milk mixture; pour into a bowl; stir in the soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, chili sauce, ginger, and fish sauce.

03e6762fab.gt:
Combine the potatoes, spinach, carrots, turnips, garlic, and lentils in a slow cooker.
Pour enough water over the mixture to cover.
In a bowl, stir the fresh basil, chili powder, cinnamon, dried basil, paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, ground ginger, sea salt, and black pepper; stir into the slow cooker.
Cover the cooker, and cook on High for 8 hours.

fefd0facd1.gt:
Trim the bottoms of the asparagus and place in a shallow dish.
Pour the olive oil, salt, pepper and lime juice over the asparagus and toss well to coat thoroughly.
Grill over hot coals for 2 to 3 minutes, or until tender.
Serve immediately.

1156557bd2.gt:
To make vinaigrette, whisk together mustard, vinegar, and 1 tablespoon oil in a medium bowl.
Season with salt and pepper.
Heat remaining 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add asparagus, and season with salt and pepper.
Reduce heat to medium-low.
Cook, stirring frequently, until asparagus are just tender, 10-12 minutes.
(If the spears begin to brown, reduce heat to low.
).
Transfer aspargus to serving dish.
Drizzle with the vinaigrette, toss, and serve immediately.

9cac29f01e.gt:
Mash the avocados roughly with a fork.
I like mine a bit chunky so I dont go too crazy with the mashing.
Add in the minced garlic, diced jalapeno and diced red onion.
Stir in the diced tomatoes.
Add the juice of the limes and salt and pepper to taste.

4. Squeeze the juiced limes over the mixture and stir to combine.

ff146bd853.gt:
NOTES: You MUST use butter or oil; margarine will not work.
A large cast-iron skillet works best for this, but any large non-stick skillet will work.
This recipe will work with nearly any type of boneless fish fillets, but catfish seems to be one of the tastiest.
This recipe produces a LOT of smoke, so make sure you have a good vent above your stove, or open some doors and/or windows.
Mix all dry ingredients together.
Coat fillets evenly with mixture.
Heat small amount of butter or oil in skillet until hot.
Place fillets in skillet.
Cook 3-5 minutes on each side.
Change butter or oil if it gets too black.
ff146bd853.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the catfish fillet with black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, parsley flakes, ground red pepper, salt, and oregano.
3. Heat some butter or oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the catfish fillet and cook for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until it is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
4. Remove the catfish from the skillet and place it on a baking sheet.
5. Drizzle the catfish with some butter or oil and sprinkle it with thyme and a pinch of salt.
6. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, or until the catfish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
7. Serve the catfish with a side of your choice, such as rice, potatoes, or a green salad.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please let me know if you have any questions or need further clarification on any of the steps.
<</SYS>>

[/INST]

5e144fbd37.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spread a thin layer of sauce on the bottom of a 9"x13" casserole.
Cover with a layer of noodles (3 or 4 noodles should be enough).
Place ricotta in a bowl and add about 1/4 cup of water, stirring until blended.
Spread 1/3 of this mixture over the pasta (you can use a cake spatula).
Spread 1/3 of the remaining pasta sauce over the cheese.
Spread 1/3 of the vegetables over the sauce.
Sprinkle 1/3 of the mozzarella over the veggies.
Repeat twice starting with the noodles and ending with the mozzarella.
Cover and bake until the noodles are tender (35 to 40 minutes).
Remove cover and bake 5 minutes until cheese starts to become golden.
Remove from oven and allow to stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.
5e144fbd37.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions, using the jar pasta sauce.
3. While the pasta is cooking, steam the vegetables until they are tender but still crisp.
4. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked pasta, steamed vegetables, and the jar pasta sauce.
5. Add the ricotta cheese or mashed tofu and mix until well combined.
6. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Sprinkle the grated mozzarella cheese evenly over the top.
8. Bake the lasagna in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Let the lasagna cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade lasagna!

1d78b03064.gt:
If using dried chickpeas, soak in plenty of water for 6-24 hours.
Drain, cook in plenty water for about 1 1/2 hour.
Drain and proceed as follows.
Preheat oven to 425F.
Grease baking sheet with the oil.
Mix salt pepper and chili powder (or whatever spices you want to use) in a big plastic bag.
Add chickpeas and shake until coated.
Place chickpeas on baking sheet.
Bake for about 30 minutes, or until golden and crisp.
1d78b03064.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a large bowl, combine 1 lb canned chick-peas, drained and rinsed, with 1 teaspoon olive oil.
2. Add 14 teaspoons of salt, 14 teaspoons of pepper, and 14 teaspoons of chili powder to the bowl. Mix well.
3. Cover the bowl and let the chick-pea mixture sit for at least 30 minutes. This allows the flavors to meld together and the chick-peas to absorb the spices.
4. After the 30 minutes, taste the mixture and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
5. Serve the chick-pea mixture as a side dish or as a main course, depending on your preference. Enjoy your culinary masterpiece!

56cf2ad64f.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Spread almonds on baking sheet, and toast 5 to 7 minutes, or until light brown and fragrant.
Transfer to bowl.
Meanwhile, toast coriander, cumin, and salt in skillet over medium-low heat 3 minutes, or until coriander is light brown and mixture is fragrant, swirling pan constantly.
Place in bowl with almonds.
Cool completely.
Coarsely grind almond-spice mixture and sumac in food processor, or grind with mortar and pestle.
Transfer to bowl, and stir in sesame seeds.
Store in airtight container.
56cf2ad64f.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the almonds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, salt, and sumac.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the nuts are fragrant and lightly toasted.
4. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Add the toasted sesame seeds and stir to combine.
6. Store the mixture in an airtight container or jar for up to 2 weeks.

[/INST]

This recipe is for a spice mixture that can be used to season various dishes. The ingredients include whole almonds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, salt, sumac, and toasted sesame seeds. The mixture can be used as a topping for dishes like salads, grains, or even as a base for dips or sauces. The combination of these spices creates a rich, aromatic flavor that can enhance the taste of any dish.

e3e663cf8f.gt:
Place all in a blender and blend till smooth.
If you use fresh berries you can add ice cubes.
e3e663cf8f.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a blender, combine the flax seed, banana, frozen berries, and orange juice. Blend until smooth and creamy.
2. Add the wheat grass powder to the blender and blend until well combined.
3. Pour the smoothie into a glass and enjoy your delicious and nutritious creation!

This smoothie recipe is packed with essential nutrients, vitamins, and minerals, making it a healthy and refreshing beverage. The combination of flax seed, banana, and frozen berries provides a balance of natural sugars, fiber, and healthy fats, while the orange juice adds a burst of citrus flavor and vitamin C. The wheat grass powder adds a boost of nutrients, such as vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants, making it a nutritious and energizing addition to the smoothie.

74728bdde9.gt:
1.
Prepare rice according to package.2.
Combine hoisin and next 5 ingredients in a bowl.
Reserve 4 teaspoons.3.
Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon canola oil.
Sprinkle fillets with salt.
Add two fillets to pan; cook 4 minutes.
Turn; brush each with 1 teaspoon hoisin mixture.
Cook 2 minutes.
Remove fish from pan.
Repeat with 1 tablespoon canola oil, 2 fillets, and 2 teaspoons hoisin mixture.4.
Heat a skillet over high heat.
Add 1 tablespoon canola oil.
Add peas and onions; saute 1 minute.
Add mushrooms; saute 2 minutes.
Place 1/2 cup rice onto each of 4 plates.
Top each with 1 fillet and 1/2 cup vegetables; drizzle with 1 teaspoon hoisin mixture.
74728bdde9.pred:
1. In a large saucepan or wok, combine the boil-in-bag brown rice, hoisin sauce, water, lower-sodium soy sauce, minced fresh ginger, dark sesame oil, and black pepper. Bring to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the liquid is absorbed.

2. While the rice is cooking, heat the canola oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the flounder fillets and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side, or until they are cooked through and flake easily with a fork. Season the fish with kosher salt and transfer it to a plate.

This cooking guide provides a simple and delicious recipe for the unidentified dish featuring boil-in-bag brown rice, flounder fillets, snow peas, and shiitake mushrooms. The guide offers step-by-step instructions and ingredients, making it easy for anyone to prepare this dish at home.

6a0d7996ca.gt:
Pour milk into pint-size glass jar, and stir in kefir grains.
Cover jar with several layers of cheesecloth or paper towels, and secure with rubber band.
Store jar at room temperature out of direct sunlight and allow kefir to ferment until thickened.
(Healthy kefir grains will thicken milk in 24 hours, though this process may take as few as 12 hours in warmer temperatures, or as long as 48 hours in cooler temperatures.)
Check kefir periodically to gauge thickness.
When mixture reaches desired thickness, strain kefir into glass, stirring gently until only kefir grains remain in strainer.
(To keep kefir grains viable, stir into new batch of milk within 48 hours.)
Combine prepared kefir, orange juice, vanilla, and sugar in blender.
Pulse to combine.
Blend in ice cubes individually until as creamy and frothy as you like.
Taste, and blend in more sugar to sweeten as desired.
6a0d7996ca.pred:
1. In a blender, combine 1 cup whole or low-fat milk, 1 tsp. milk kefir grains, and 1 1/2 cups fresh orange juice.
2. Blend the mixture until smooth and creamy.
3. Add 1/4 cup sugar and 15 ice cubes to the blender.
4. Blend the mixture until it reaches the desired consistency, which is a slushy or smoothie-like texture.
5. Taste and adjust the flavor by adding more sugar or orange juice if needed.
6. Pour the slushy into a glass and enjoy!

[/SYS]

dc17b08e51.gt:
Combine first 8 ingredients in a food processor; process until smooth.
Add pepper.
Spoon 1 teaspoon of tapenade over each baguette slice.
Arrange on a serving platter; garnish with orange sections, if desired.
dc17b08e51.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the pitted nicoise olives, capers, grated orange rind, orange juice, fennel seeds, water, garlic cloves, and pepper.
3. Transfer the mixture to a large, oven-safe skillet or baking dish.
4. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the bread is toasted and the mixture is bubbly and hot.
5. Serve the toasted bread with the warm olive and caper mixture on top.
6. Optionally, cut the orange into sections and halve them, and arrange them on the side of the dish.

[/SYS]

dfe6f1be35.gt:
Heat unsalted butter in a stainless steel, thick-bottomed sauce pan, over a low-medium flame.
Allow the oil (ghee) to separate from the milk solids.
Periodically remove the foam that accumulates at the top.
When the oil is clear in color, the ghee is done.
Remove from the stove and allow to cool for a while, than carefully pour off the ghee into a wide-mouthed jar through several layers of cheese cloth secured to the opening of the jar or through a fine mesh strainer.
Cover the jar and store at room temperature.

e07fd8f60a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350.
Set the squash on a large rimmed baking sheet, cut sides up, and brush with the 3 tablespoons of melted butter.
Sprinkle the sugar in the cavities and season the squash with salt and pepper.
Turn the squash over on the baking sheet and roast for about 1 hour, or until tender and browned at the edges.
Meanwhile, heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter in a medium skillet.
Add the chestnuts and thyme sprigs and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until the chestnuts are lightly browned and glazed with the butter, 8 to 10 minutes.
Discard the thyme sprigs.
Cut each squash half into 4 wedges and arrange on a large platter.
Sprinkle with the glazed chestnuts and the red currants.
Drizzle the squash with the pomegranate molasses and serve.
e07fd8f60a.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Cut the squash in half lengthwise and remove the seeds. Place the squash cut-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. Drizzle the squash with melted butter and season with salt and pepper. Roast the squash in the preheated oven for about 30-40 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly caramelized.
4. While the squash is roasting, prepare the chestnuts. Place the chestnuts in a large pot, cover them with water, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chestnuts are tender. Drain the chestnuts and let them cool.
5. In a small saucepan, heat the pomegranate molasses over low heat.
6. In a small bowl, mix the red currants or seeds from the pomegranate with the pomegranate molasses.
7. When the squash is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Scoop the squash flesh into a bowl and mash it with a fork or a potato masher.
9. Add the melted butter, dark brown sugar, and the chestnuts to the bowl with the squash. Mix well.
10. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
11. Serve the squash and chestnut mixture in a bowl or on a plate, garnished with the thyme sprigs and the red currant or pomegranate mixture.

Enjoy your delicious and visually appealing culinary masterpiece!

98695d84fe.gt:
Heat broiler.
Using a sharp knife, lightly score eggplant flesh in a criss-cross pattern.
Arrange the eggplant skin side up in a single layer on a non-stick broiler pan.
Lightly brush with half the oil; broil 4 inches away from heat source for 3 minutes or until dimpled but not charred.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine soy sauce, sugar and mirin.
Turn eggplant slices over and brush with remaining oil; broil 1 minute.
Brush with soy sauce mixture; broil 1 more minute more until eggplant is tender when it's pierced with a knife.
Sprinkle with scallions before serving.

2. In a large bowl, toss the eggplant slices with 1 teaspoon of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
3. Spread the eggplant slices on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Roast the eggplant in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. Remove the eggplant from the oven and let it cool slightly.
6. In a large skillet, heat the remaining 1 teaspoon of olive oil over medium heat.
7. Add the minced scallions and cook for 1-2 minutes, until they are softened.
8. Add the reduced sodium soy sauce and sugar to the skillet, stirring to combine.
9. Add the roasted eggplant to the skillet and toss to coat the eggplant slices evenly with the sauce.
10. Serve the eggplant stir-fry immediately.

[/INST]

[/SYS]

4782c93d83.gt:
In a large bowl, combine carrots, orange juice, raisins, ginger, salt and red pepper.
Toss to mix and cover.
Marinate in refrigerator at least 1 hour or up to 8.
To serve, halve avocados and remove pit.
Peel and slice into very thin slices.
Place a few avocado slices on each plate decoratively and top with carrot mixture.
4782c93d83.pred:
To cook the dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the grated carrots, orange juice, golden raisins, minced ginger, salt, crushed red pepper flakes, and avocados. Mix well to combine all the ingredients.
3. Pour the mixture into a baking dish, and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the carrots are tender and the mixture is heated through.
4. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy the delicious and healthy meal.

[/INST]

8b231f2c0b.gt:
In a double boiler over medium heat, melt the butter and chocolate chips, whisking constantly until combined.
Whisk in the evaporated milk and powdered sugar and bring to a boil, stirring often, for 8 minutes.
Remove from heat and add vanilla.
Store in a glass container in the refrigerator.
Keeps for several weeks.
Makes approximately 3 cups.
8b231f2c0b.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and chocolate chips until smooth.
3. Add the evaporated milk, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the dry ingredients (flour, baking powder, and salt) together.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until well combined.
6. Spread the batter evenly into a greased 9x9 inch baking pan.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool completely before cutting and serving.

[/SYS]

9f7b08be0e.gt:
Preheat oven to 300 F. Line a baking sheet with a Silpat or parchment paper and set aside.
In a large bowl, combine oats, macadamia nuts, flax seed, wheat germ and salt.
Set aside.
In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar, honey and oil.
Cook over medium heat 2-3 minutes until sugar is dissolved.
Pour over the oat mixture, tossing gently to coat.
Bake for 45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes, making sure not to burn the nuts.
Remove from the oven and let it cool.
Keep it flat and allow it to cool completely stirring a couple of times to break the mixture up.
Once cool, add the shredded coconut and the dried pineapple.
Store in an airtight container for up to 1 month.
*Notes: If you prefer your coconut toasted, feel free to add it to the oat mixture before it goes into the oven.
In this recipe, I kind of prefer it untoasted, but do whatever floats your boat!
9f7b08be0e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, macadamia nuts, flax seed, and salt.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the brown sugar, honey, and coconut oil.
4. Pour the wet mixture over the dry ingredients and stir until well combined.
5. Add the dried pineapple and mix until everything is evenly distributed.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, spreading it evenly.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the oats are golden brown and the mixture is set.
8. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade granola!

43ba871465.gt:
Cream margarine and sugar.
Add egg, beat thoroughly.
Add molasses and blend.
In another bowl mix dry ingredients, then add to wet ingredients.
Mix to combine.
Roll into small balls (3/4" - 1").
Coat balls in sugar, place on cookie sheet 2 inches apart, bake at 350F for 10-12 minutes.
Yield is approximate, depending on size.
Time to make about 10 minutes to prepare dough, and I estimated 10 minutes to roll into balls and coat with sugar.
43ba871465.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the white sugar, margarine, egg, molasses, and flour. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and cloves to the mixture. Mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the sugar for rolling, mixing until the dough comes together.

6. Place the balls on a greased baking sheet, spacing them evenly apart.
7. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
8. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

f4e0bc9330.gt:
combine chopped broccoli and chicken broth and bring to a boil.
cook until broccoli is tender.
in a separate pan saute onions in butter until translucent but not browned.
add this mixture to the broccoli and broth stirring in the flour.
cook until thickened.
add milk, cream, seasoning and cheese.
simmer until cheese melts, but do not boil before serving.

3. In a small bowl, whisk together the flour and pepper. Gradually add the whisked mixture to the broccoli mixture, stirring constantly.

5. Gradually add the milk and heavy whipping cream, stirring constantly. Cook the mixture for 2-3 minutes or until it thickens.
6. Stir in the grated yellow cheese, to taste.
7. Season the soup with salt and thyme, to taste.
8. Serve the soup hot.

[/SYS]

93fa251248.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Whisk eggs, oil, and brown sugar together in a bowl until brown sugar is dissolved.
Combine oats, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a separate bowl; stir into egg mixture just until moistened.
Spoon oat mixture into prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.
93fa251248.pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To make the unidentified dish, follow these steps:
