3b92f8e755.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees.
Place a ridged cast-iron skillet or other heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Working in batches, brush eggplant slices on both sides with olive oil and cook, turning, until soft and (if using a ridged pan) crisscrossed with grid marks.
Set aside and allow to cool.
In a large bowl, combine feta, pine nuts, raisins, 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, bread crumbs, garlic, lemon zest, mint and parsley.
Mix in egg, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Spread eggplant slices on a surface, and divide stuffing evenly among them, placing 1 to 2 tablespoons at one end of each slice.
Roll up slices tightly to secure filling, and place in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish (or other shallow baking pan in which rolls fit snugly in a single layer).
Pour crushed tomatoes on top of eggplant rolls.
Arrange mozzarella slices in a line lengthwise down center of pan.
Drizzle olive oil evenly over pan, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
Bake until cheese has melted and eggplant is bubbling and fragrant, 25 to 30 minutes.
Remove from heat and allow to stand 5 to 10 minutes.
Serve hot.
3b92f8e755.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, crumbled feta cheese, minced garlic, lemon zest, and freshly ground black pepper.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the bread crumbs, chopped parsley, and a pinch of salt.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the eggplant slices and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes per side. Remove from the heat and drain on paper towels.
5. In a large mixing bowl, combine the drained raisins, crumbled feta cheese, bread crumb mixture, and minced garlic. Season with salt and pepper.
6. In a large oven-safe skillet or baking dish, layer the eggplant slices, raisin-feta mixture, and a drizzle of olive oil. Repeat the layers until all the ingredients are used up.
7. Drizzle the remaining olive oil over the top of the dish.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the eggplant is tender and the bread crumbs are golden brown.
9. Remove from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

This recipe combines the flavors of eggplant, feta cheese, and pine nuts, creating a delicious and satisfying dish. The addition of raisins and lemon zest adds a touch of sweetness and tanginess, while the crumbled feta cheese and bread crumbs provide a crunchy texture. The dish is then baked until the eggplant is tender and the bread crumbs are golden brown, resulting in a mouthwatering and satisfying meal.

263a0fdd20.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Prepare cake batter as directed on package; pour into parchment-lined 15x10x1-inch pan.
Bake 18 to 20 min.
or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
Cool completely.
Beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl with mixer until creamy.
Blend in vanilla.
Gradually add sugar, beating well after each addition.
Cut cake lengthwise, then crosswise in half.
Stack cake layers on plate, spreading cream cheese frosting between layers and on top of cake.
263a0fdd20.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease and flour a 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the carrot cake mix, Brick Cream Cheese, softened butter, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
4. Add the icing sugar and mix until well combined.
5. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
6. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Once the cake is completely cooled, use a sharp knife to cut it into slices.

Enjoy your delicious carrot cake!

fe5d11c597.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Combine 1 cup sugar and 1/2 cup margarine in large mixer bowl.
Beat at medium speed until creamy.
Add egg and vanilla, and continue beating until well mixed.
Reduce speed to low,and add all remaining cookie ingredients except marshmallows.
Beat until well mixed.
Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake for 6-7 minutes or until edges are just set.
Remove from oven.
Press 1 marshmallow half onto center of each cookie.
Continue baking for 2 minutes or until marshmallow is softened.
Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheets.
Cool completely.
Combine all frosting ingredients except milk in small mixer bowl.
Beat at low speed, adding enough milk for desired spreading consistency.
Frost cooled cookies, covering entire marshmallow.
Variations: Before putting frosting over cooled cookies, spread a thin layer of peanut butter, caramel, or seedless raspberry jelly over marshmallow, and then add your frosting.
fe5d11c597.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, cream the sugar and margarine together until smooth.
2. Add the egg and vanilla, and mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the flour, cocoa, milk, baking soda, and salt, mixing until a smooth batter forms.
4. Fold in the marshmallows, and mix until they are evenly distributed throughout the batter.
5. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish, and smooth the top with a spatula.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Once the cake is completely cooled, use a spatula to spread the chocolate frosting evenly over the top.
10. Decorate the cake with the remaining marshmallows, if desired.

[/INST]

904095d715.gt:
In a 10-inch heavy saute pan, heat 1 ounce of clarified butter over high heat.
Add sliced mushrooms one handful at a time to saute pan.
As mushrooms begin to develop rich, brown color, push them to the outside of the saute pan.
Turn the mushrooms over as they begin to color.
When pan becomes dry, add remaining clarified butter to the pan.
Add another handful of mushrooms to the pan and continue until all mushrooms have been added.
Season with salt and pepper after the last addition to the pan has been made.
Make a hole in the middle of the pan and add the shallots.
Deglaze pan with cognac, scraping up any browned mushroom bits.
Add the chives.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
904095d715.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cremini mushrooms with the clarified butter, salt, and pepper. Spread the mushrooms evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
3. Roast the mushrooms in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. In a small saucepan, heat the cognac over medium heat until it is almost completely evaporated.
5. Add the minced shallots to the saucepan and cook until they are softened and fragrant.
6. Pour the cognac mixture over the roasted mushrooms and toss to combine.
7. Serve the mushrooms immediately, garnished with fresh chives.

[/INST]

This recipe involves roasting cremini mushrooms in clarified butter, which adds a rich and savory flavor to the dish. The cognac sauce is then added to the mushrooms, enhancing the taste with a hint of warmth and depth. The dish is served with fresh chives as a garnish, adding a touch of color and freshness to the presentation.

a562032555.gt:
Mix the flour and salt in a large mixing bowl with a wooden spoon.
In another large bowl, empty the yeast package, then slowly add the warm water, mixing with a fork to fully dissolve the yeast.
When the yeast mixture forms some bubbles, add the mixture to the flour/salt, then add the three eggs.
Mix the batter, then set the bowl on top of your refrigerator (or other warm place), cover with damp dish towel.
After 20 minutes, check the dough for rising, mix again and let rise for another 20 minutes.
In a saucepan, heat the oil to medium heat.
Add the dough by the spoonful (about the size of 2 golf balls) Experiment with the first batch to make sure the oil is not too hot.
Remove when golden brown and place on paper bags to absorb the oil.
Place warm Zeppoles in a paper bag with powdered sugar and SHAKE.
Cover with powdered sugar.
a562032555.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the corn oil, all purpose flour, yeast, warm water, eggs, salt, and powdered sugar. Mix until well combined.
3. Gradually add the remaining cup of warm water, and continue mixing until the dough comes together.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
6. Punch down the dough, and then roll it out on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
7. Transfer the dough to a greased baking sheet or a silicone mat.
8. Use a sharp knife or a pizza cutter to cut the dough into desired shapes or sizes.
9. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
10. Remove the baked dough from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade dough!

6ad5b0a9bb.gt:
Pour 4 oz A&W Rootbeer in a glass
Add vodka and syrup to the root beer, stir well and add ice

PLACE frozen yogurt in bowl.

59d1e62c4c.gt:
Heat a saucepan over medium heat.
Melt the butter and stir in the garlic and ginger.
Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, or until the garlic is lightly browned.
Add the soy sauce, sake, pineapple juice, rice vinegar and brown sugar.
Bring up to a gentle boil and simmer for 3 minutes.
Whisk the water and the cornstarch together and then whisk mixture into the teriyaki sauce and simmer until thickened, 8 to 10 minutes.
Set aside.
Rinse the chicken wings and pat them dry.
Generously season the chicken with salt and black pepper.
Dredge the wings in flour, shaking off any excess flour, and set aside.
In a large saucepan or deep fryer, heat the oil to about 375.
Fry the chicken wings in small batches until golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
Shake off any excess oil and place on paper towels to drain.
Continue frying the chicken in batches until all of the wings are cooked.
Toss the wings in the teriyaki sauce and sprinkle with green onions.
Serve warm.
59d1e62c4c.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the minced garlic, ginger, soy sauce, sake, pineapple juice, rice vinegar, brown sugar, and water. Mix well.
3. Add the cornstarch to the mixture and stir until smooth.
4. Season the chicken wings with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
6. Dredge the chicken wings in the flour, shaking off any excess.
7. Fry the chicken wings in the hot oil until golden brown, about 5-7 minutes per side.
8. Remove the chicken wings from the skillet and place them on a wire rack or a baking sheet.
9. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken wings and bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
10. Serve the chicken wings with sliced green onions for garnish.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful chicken wings!

b61f1917f7.gt:
For the salad: First place lettuce in a bowl, then top with chicken, onion, nectarine, raspberries, celery and almonds.
Pour vinaigrette over top and serve!

43d8c95718.gt:
Brew coffee using a ratio of about 1 1/2 tablespoons coffee per cup of water.
(We used a single brew coffee maker and used the espresso strength setting that uses less water and brews a stronger coffee.)
Set the coffee aside to reach room temperature or place it in the refrigerator for 10-15 minutes to cool quickly.
Add the room temperature coffee, creamer, raspberry and hazelnut syrups, and the ice into a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour the drink into a tall glass and enjoy!
Optional garnishes: top with whipped cream, shaved chocolate, mint leaves and a raspberry.
43d8c95718.pred:

2. Add 2 tablespoons of hazelnut flavored creamer (or half-and-half) to the coffee.
3. Stir the mixture well.
4. In a separate bowl, mix 2 teaspoons of raspberry syrup and 2 teaspoons of hazelnut syrup.

This meal is a delicious and refreshing coffee-based drink that combines the rich flavors of coffee, hazelnut, and raspberry. The crushed ice adds a cool and refreshing touch to the drink, making it perfect for a hot summer day or any time you want to enjoy a sweet and flavorful beverage.

54bc08b13e.gt:
Combine cream, milk, water, cocoa powder, corn syrup, and salt in a medium saucepan.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat, whisking until cocoa powder is completely dissolved.
Remove from heat and add chocolate, butter, and vanilla, stirring until chocolate is melted and sauce is smooth.
Serve warm.
54bc08b13e.pred:
[/SYS]

2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the whole milk, water, and corn syrup.
3. Stir in the unsweetened cocoa powder and fine salt until the mixture is smooth and well-combined.
4. Gradually pour the hot mixture into a large bowl, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming.

Microwave chocolate in microwaveable bowl on MEDIUM 2 min.
or until chocolate is almost melted, stirring after 1 min.

d3047450d6.gt:
Boil the water and pour a small amount in the teapot, swishing it around to warm the pot.
Combine the mint and green tea and sugar in the teapot, then fill it with the rest of the hot water.
Let the tea brew for three minutes.
Set out glasses for the tea.
A shot-glass is close to the slender glasses used in Morocco.
Fill just one glass with the tea, then pour it back in the pot.
Repeat.
This helps to dissolve and distribute the sugar.
Pour the tea.
You want a nice foam on the tea so always pour with the teapot a high distance above the glasses.
If you do not have at least a little foam on the top of the first glass, then pour it back into the teapot and try again until the tea starts to foam up nicely.
Garnish with the remaining sprigs of mint.
d3047450d6.pred:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the 10 sprigs of fresh mint, the green tea, and sugar. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.
2. Reduce the heat to low and simmer the mixture for about 10 minutes, or until the sugar has dissolved and the tea has infused the flavors.
3. Add the 4 cups of water to the saucepan, and continue to simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and let the tea mixture cool for a few minutes.
5. Strain the tea mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
6. Discard the solids, and return the liquid to the saucepan.
7. Add the 4 cups of water to the saucepan, and stir to combine.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, and then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the tea has infused the flavors and the liquid has reduced by about half.
9. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and let the tea mixture cool for a few minutes.
10. Strain the tea mixture through a fine-mesh sieve into a clean bowl, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
11. Discard the solids, and return the liquid to the saucepan.
12. Add the 3 tablespoons of sugar, and stir to combine.
13. Taste the tea mixture, and if it is too strong, add a bit more sugar or water to achieve the desired flavor.
14. Allow the tea to cool completely, and then refrigerate it for at least 2 hours or overnight.
15. Serve the tea chilled, garnished with a few extra sprigs of fresh mint for added flavor and visual appeal.

[/INST]

This cooking guide provides a simple and delicious recipe for a refreshing green tea, which can be enjoyed as a beverage or used as a base for other recipes. The tea is made with fresh mint, green tea, sugar, and water,

e946c009a6.gt:

df541b69a3.gt:

Set aside.

Add chile flakes and remove from heat.

Heat half of a gas or charcoal grill to high (about 400 degrees F) and the other half to low (about 300 degrees F).
Divide dough in 1/2 and roll into 2 rounds about 1/4 inch thick and 10 inches in diameter.
Brush the top of 1 round with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
Lay dough oiled side down on the hotter half of the grill and brush the top with oil and sprinkle with salt.
Grill without moving until grill marks form on the bottom of the dough, about 2 minutes.
Flip dough with a spatula or tongs to the cooler half of grill.
Spread 1/2 of the sauce evenly over the dough, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of the Parmesan cheese over the sauce, then top with 1/2 of the peppers, 1/2 of the sausage, and 1/2 of the mozzarella.
Cover and grill, rotating if necessary to avoid any hot spots, until dough is lightly charred and cheese is melted, about 8 to 10 minutes.
Transfer pizza to a cutting board, sprinkle 1 tablespoon more of the Parmesan over top, drizzle with desired amount of chile oil, slice, and serve.
Repeat with second round of dough and remaining toppings.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Thaw pastry according to directions on box (about 40 minutes).
Cut pastry into 3 sections along perforated lines.

Next, space 5 shrimp evenly on top of the pesto.
Sprinkle with slivers of sundried tomatoes and pine nuts.
Using your fingers, fold over the sides of the pastry so they meet in the middle, and pinch to form a seal (although it will open while baking).
Bake one roll at a time, at 450 degrees F for 5 minutes, then lower oven heat to 375 degrees F and cook an additional 5-8 minutes until pastry is brown and puffed.
Repeat assembly and baking process with remaining two pastry sheets.
Slice each roll into five pieces (one shrimp in each piece) and serve warm.
Makes 15 appetizers.

f537025690.gt:
Mix chili sauce, lime juice, fish sauce, and cilantro; set aside.
Divide shrimp into 4 equal portions.
Lay each portion of shrimp in a neat row with tails pointed in the same direction.
Thread 2 thin wood or metal skewers (8 to 10 inches long) about 1 1/2 inches apart through center of each row of shrimp, pushing the shellfish close together.
Place shrimp on an oiled grill above a solid bed of hot coals or high heat on a gas barbecue (you can hold your hand at grill level only 2 to 3 seconds); close lid on gas grill.
Cook, turning once, until shrimp are pink, 2 to 3 minutes a side.
Brush tops of shrimp with the chili sauce mixture, turn over, and cook just until glaze bubbles and browns slightly, about 30 seconds (watch closely; glaze burns easily).
Brush tops with more chili mixture, then turn glaze down and cook just until it darkens slightly, about 30 seconds more.
Transfer shrimp to plates or a platter.
Season to taste with remaining chili mixture and juice from lime wedges.
f537025690.pred:
To make the dish, follow these steps:

2. In a large bowl, combine the shelled and rinsed shrimp, cilantro, and a pinch of salt.
3. Pour the sauce mixture over the shrimp mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
4. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
5. Serve the dish immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 hours before serving.

This dish is a delicious and flavorful shrimp dish that can be enjoyed as a main course or as an appetizer. The combination of sweet chili sauce, lime juice, and fish sauce creates a unique and savory taste that is perfect for seafood lovers.

1b81060720.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Partially bake the pie crust for 5 minutes according to package (or your recipe) instructions.
Whisk together the sugar, flour, salt and cocoa powder in medium mixing bowl.
Blend in melted butter.
Add the eggs and vanilla and stir until well blended.

If crust gets too brown, cover with a pie shield or aluminum foil.
Allow to cool to room temperature (this allows the fudge to set up.)

I micowave a slice for about 20 seconds on high.
Top with your choice of ice cream, fudge sauce, whipped cream, nuts and cherries.

8. Pour the chocolate mixture over the cooled crust.

10. Allow the pie to cool completely before serving.

283c2400cb.gt:
Transfer cream to bowl of 5-quart electric stand mixer fitted with whisk attachment.
Tightly cover top of bowl and mixer with plastic wrap.
Beat cream at moderately high speed until it holds soft peaks, 10 to 12 minutes.
Increase speed to high and beat until mixture separates into thick, pale-yellow butter and thin, liquid buttermilk, about 5 minutes more.
Strain mixture through colander into large bowl.
Using hands, vigorously knead butter in colander, squeezing out remaining buttermilk, until dense and creamy, about 5 minutes.
Transfer butter to large bowl, reserving buttermilk.
Using hands, knead salt into butter.
Roll into logs and wrap in plastic wrap or transfer to airtight container and refrigerate.
(Butter will keep up to 1 week refrigerated or 1 month frozen.)
Strain buttermilk through fine-mesh sieve, then cover and refrigerate up to 1 week.

b4fd5e004b.gt:
Drain the yogurt to 1 1/2 cups: Line a strainer w/a coffee filter, add yogurt & set aside about 1 hour.
Cut off all but 1 inch of the beet stalks and leave the roots intact.
Rinse the beets well but do not peel.
Cook the beets in boiling salted water until tender, 25 to 35 minutes.
Drain, slip off the skins under cold running water, and cut away the root ends and stalks.
Coarsely grate the beets, using the shredding disk of a food processor or the large holes of a hand grater (latex gloves are recommended for the latter or you'll look like an axe murderer!
).
Combine the garlic, lemon juice, salt and pepper in a medium bowl.
Add the beets and yogurt and blend well.
Taste and add a pinch of sugar if desired.
Transfer to a serving dish, cover and refrigerate until well chilled, about 1 hour.
Garnish with sprigs of fresh mint just before serving.

7. Garnish each piece with a sprig of fresh mint.

[/SYS]

fba1dcbbd2.gt:
Sift dry ingredients.
Cut in 1/4 cup of butter.
Add the cream.
Roll out on a floured board.
Cut with a 2-inch cutter.

To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 4 cups of flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons of baking soda, 1 teaspoon of salt, and the 3 teaspoons of cream of tartar.
2. Cut the butter into small pieces and add it to the dry ingredients.
3. Using a fork or your hands, mix the ingredients until the butter is evenly distributed and the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
4. Gradually add the 2 cups of cream or half and half, stirring until the dough comes together.
5. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead it until it is smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest for 1-2 hours or until it has doubled in size.
7. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
8. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
9. Roll the dough out to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm).
10. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
11. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
12. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
13. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

6. Serve the chicken and noodle dish hot. Enjoy your culinary masterpiece!

0f717fcce7.gt:
Bring a pot of water to the boil, add the oranges, cover and simmer for one hour.
Stain off the water.
Cool the oranges.
If you are in a hurry, I suggest you partly cool them -- (this will still work).
While they are cooling, food process the sugar with the eggs until the sugar is dissolved and pour into a bowl.
Cut the oranges in half and de-seed them and put the oranges (with peel and pith) into a food processor and pulp until reasonably smooth.
Pour the pulp into the sugar/egg mix and add the almond meal.
Gently mix together.
Pour mix into baking paper lined 24 - 26cm springform tin and bake for 50 - 60 minutes at 185C.
Serve with creme fraiche, whipped cream, or vanilla ice-cream -- makes an awesome dessert.
You could drizzle a little citrus liqueur around the plate.
Added thoughts -- This cake DOES NOT need any syrup poured over it.
NB.Simply double this recipe to get two large cakes.
It is just as successful.
Occasionally, I will add a slurp of Grand Marnier, Contreau, or Galliano; however, try it plain initially.
0f717fcce7.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Cut the oranges into segments, removing the seeds and membranes.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oranges, sugar, and eggs.
4. Add the almond meal to the mixture, stirring until well combined.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased and floured 9-inch round cake pan.
6. Bake the cake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/SYS]

62bf8025cc.gt:
Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium high heat.
Add the onion and saute for three minutes, then add the garlic.
Continue cooking until the onions are soft, 1-2 minutes more.
Add the water and bring to a boil.
Add the jalapenos and carrots and cook for 5 minutes, until slightly softened.
Add the cider vinegar, 1 tbsp pickling salt, oregano and bay leaves and simmer for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.
Transfer the jalapenos, carrots and onions with slotted spoon or tongs into sterilized glass quart-sized jars.
Throw away the bay leaves.
Cover the vegetables with the cooking liquid until the jars are three-quarters full.
Add 1 tbsp pickling salt to each jar and fill to the top with white vinegar.
Cap each jar tightly and store in the refrigerator for up to several months.
The pickled vegetables can be used starting one week later.
62bf8025cc.pred:
1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the onion and garlic to the pot and cook until the onion is translucent, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the carrot to the pot and cook for a few minutes, until it starts to soften.
4. Pour in the water and bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Add the jalapeno chiles, quartered, and the rest of the sliced jalapeno, and cook for a few minutes, until the chiles are tender.
6. Add the cider vinegar, pickling salt, and oregano to the pot. Stir well to combine.
7. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the carrots are tender.
8. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
10. Discard the solids and return the liquid to the pot.
11. Stir in the white vinegar and bring the mixture to a boil.
12. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 30 minutes, or until it reaches your desired consistency.
13. Remove the pot from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
14. Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve, pressing on the solids to extract as much liquid as possible.
15. Discard the solids and return the liquid to the pot.
16. Stir in the pickling salt and let the mixture cool completely.
17. Store the pickled carrots in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

[/INST]

3af2ae11f5.gt:
Combine salt, pepper, chili powder and bay leaves.
Rub meat completely with liquid Smoke.
Place meat, fat side up, in a large roasting pan.
Sprinkle dry seasoning mixture on top.
Cover tightly.
Bake for 3 1/2 to 4 hours at 325 degrees.
Scrape seasoning off meat and cut in very thin slices across the grain.
Serve with barbecue sauce.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Cook for 10 minutes.
Serve with sliced brisket.
3af2ae11f5.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large, heavy-bottomed pot or Dutch oven, cook the beef brisket over medium-high heat until browned on all sides. Remove the brisket from the pot and set aside.
3. In the same pot, add the chili powder, crushed bay leaf, liquid smoke, and catsup. Stir to combine.
4. Add the water, Worcestershire sauce, dry mustard, celery seeds, and cayenne pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 2 hours or until the beef is tender.
5. Return the beef brisket to the pot and stir to combine. Simmer for an additional 30 minutes or until the beef is fork-tender.
6. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside to cool slightly.
7. In a small bowl, mix the brown sugar and butter.
8. Once the beef is cool enough to handle, shred it into bite-sized pieces.
9. Return the shredded beef to the pot and stir to combine with the sauce.
10. Simmer the beef and sauce mixture for an additional 30 minutes or until the sauce has thickened and coated the beef evenly.
11. Season the beef and sauce mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
12. Serve the beef and sauce mixture over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious-looking dish.

db5fd3bd93.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 F.
In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the bacon until almost cooked, but not too crisp.
Remove bacon from the skillet with a slotted spoon and place it in a large bowl.
Drain all but about 1 tablespoon of the bacon grease from the skillet and discard it or use it for another purpose.
Add the onion and green pepper into the skillet, if using.
Saute for a few minutes to soften.
Add them into the large bowl with the bacon.
Into the large bowl add the undrained pork and beans, the 2 cans of rinsed and drained beans and the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Pour into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish.
Cover the dish with a sheet of foil and bake at 325 F for 45 minutes.
Uncover and continue baking for 20-25 more minutes.
Cooks Notes: Sometime I will add a chipotle chile with a little of the adobo sauce that has been finely diced.
You know I cant get enough of those!
It is also delicious to turn them into cowboy beans (what Nanny called them) and add cooked ground beef or sausage.
db5fd3bd93.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, cook the onion, green pepper, and garlic until the onion is translucent.
4. Add the pork and beans, barbecue sauce, ketchup, picante sauce, molasses, maple syrup, brown sugar, liquid smoke, dry mustard, cumin, chili powder, and garlic powder to the skillet. Stir to combine.
5. Add the cooked bacon to the skillet and stir to combine.
6. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the mixture is hot and bubbly.
8. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy!

[/INST]

85b79cc54f.gt:
In a large skillet over medium heat, add meatless ground burger, water and spices.
Mix well and let simmer for 10-15 minutes until heated through and water is absorbed.
Use this mixture to replace the seasoned ground beef in any of your favorite Mexican recipes!
Another note* One can use 1 cup of TVP in place of the soy crumbles or Boca.
You might need a bit more that 1 cup of water to keep mixture from getting too dry.
85b79cc54f.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the instant minced onion and cook until softened, about 2 minutes.
3. Add the vegetable bouillon cube and chili powder, and stir to combine. Cook for another 2 minutes.
4. Add the cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, and oregano, stirring to combine. Cook for 1 minute.
5. Add the water and bring the mixture to a simmer.
6. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until it has thickened slightly.
7. Add the cooked ground beef to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for another 5-7 minutes, or until the beef is fully cooked through.
8. Remove the skillet from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Serve the dish over rice or your preferred grain.

This dish is a delicious and hearty meal that combines the flavors of the spices and the tender beef. The combination of the beef and the vegetable bouillon cube creates a rich and satisfying taste that will leave you wanting more.

1432c540ac.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. In a bowl, whisk the canola oil, vinegar, miso, ginger, sesame oil, honey, lime zest, and lime juice until smooth.
Season with salt.
On a rimmed baking sheet, toss the tomatoes with 3 tablespoons of the miso dressing and season with salt.
Roast for 20 minutes, stirring, until the tomatoes are charred in spots.
Scrape into a large bowl.
Cook the soba noodles in boiling water just until al dente, 4 minutes.
Drain and cool the noodles under cold running water.
Add the soba noodles, scallions, and half of the remaining dressing to the tomatoes and toss well.
Season with salt, transfer to a platter, and garnish with the sesame seeds.
Serve with the remaining dressing.Looking for vegetable recipes?
Try our best asparagus recipes, eggplant recipes, or zucchini recipes.
1432c540ac.pred:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the canola oil, rice vinegar, miso, ginger, sesame oil, honey, lime zest, lime juice, and salt.
2. Add the cherry tomatoes to the bowl and toss to coat evenly with the dressing.
3. Cook the soba noodles according to package instructions until they are al dente.
4. In a large skillet, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat. Add the scallions and cook until they are tender but still crisp.
5. Add the cooked soba noodles to the skillet and toss to combine with the scallions.
6. Serve the noodles immediately, garnished with toasted sesame seeds.

[/SYS]

44b3907e95.gt:
Combine all the cupcake ingredients in a bowl and mix until smooth.
If you want them to be more pink, add a bit of red food coloring.
Fill lined cupcake tin 2/3 of the way full.
Bake cupcakes at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes.
Combine Frosting ingredients and beat until smooth.
When cupcakes are cooled, topped with frosting.
Top them off with a maraschino cherry.
44b3907e95.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter, sugar, and eggs.
3. Add the flour, baking powder, and salt to the mixture, and mix until well combined.
4. If desired, add red food coloring to the dough to achieve the desired color.
5. Fold in the chocolate chips (if using) and maraschino cherries (if using).
6. Portion the dough into 12 equal-sized balls.
7. Place the balls of dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
9. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

72d89ed4de.gt:
Place all of the ingredients in a medium bowl; stir until they are combined, and transfer to an airtight container for storage.
Season popcorn to taste.
72d89ed4de.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius).
2. In a large bowl, combine the paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper (if using), chili powder, cumin, parmesan cheese, oregano, and red pepper flakes (if using).
3. Add the ground beef to the bowl and mix until well combined.
4. Shape the beef mixture into small meatballs, about the size of a walnut.
5. Place the meatballs on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the meatballs in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are cooked through and no longer pink inside.
7. While the meatballs are cooking, prepare the sauce. In a small bowl, mix the curry powder, salt, pepper, turmeric, and cayenne pepper (if using).
8. Once the meatballs are cooked, remove them from the oven and pour the sauce over them.
9. Return the meatballs to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce is bubbly and the meatballs are cooked through.
10. Serve the meatballs with the sauce over a bed of rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious homemade meatballs!

856a830dc7.gt:
Soak cucumber in cold salted (1 tsp) water for 5 minutes.
Drain and squeeze well.
Bring the water to a boil, add beanstarch vermicelli and cook according to the directions on the package.
Cut into bite sized pieces.
Mix all ingredients and marinate.
856a830dc7.pred:
1. Prepare the ingredients:
- Rinse the beanstarch vermicelli and cucumber under cold water.
- Cut the cucumber into thin slices.
- Prepare the marinade by mixing the vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, and sesame oil in a small bowl.

2. Cook the vermicelli:
- In a small pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil.
- Add the beanstarch vermicelli and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the noodles are tender but still slightly chewy.
- Drain the noodles and rinse them with cold water to stop the cooking process.

3. Assemble the dish:
- In a large bowl, mix the cooked vermicelli with the cucumber slices.
- Pour the marinade over the noodles and cucumber mixture, and toss everything together until the ingredients are well coated.
- Serve the dish immediately, or refrigerate it for a few hours before serving.

[/INST]

6cd8583372.gt:
Simmer all ingredients in covered saucepan over low heat 20 minutes.
Strain out solids before serving.
6cd8583372.pred:
To make the dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot, combine the apple cider, quince, brown sugar, and cinnamon stick. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the quince is tender.
2. Remove the cinnamon stick and cloves from the pot.
3. Using a spoon, mash the quince to release its juices.
4. Add the nutmeg to the pot and stir to combine.
5. Simmer for an additional 10 minutes, or until the quince is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened.
6. Serve the quince and apple cider mixture hot, garnished with a sprinkle of ground nutmeg if desired.

[/INST]

This recipe calls for a combination of sweet and spicy flavors, with the apple cider providing a refreshing base, the quince adding a unique tartness, and the brown sugar and cinnamon stick contributing warmth and depth. The nutmeg adds a subtle, aromatic touch to the dish, enhancing the overall taste. The result is a delicious, comforting, and seasonal dessert or warm beverage that can be enjoyed during colder months.

c7ae046d51.gt:
Place buttermilk, butter or margarine, sugar, salt, flour, whole wheat flour, and yeast into pan of bread machine.
Bake on White Bread setting.
Cool on wire racks before slicing.
c7ae046d51.pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the buttermilk, margarine, sugar, and salt. Mix until the sugar is fully dissolved.
2. Add the bread flour and whole wheat flour to the bowl, and mix until a smooth dough forms.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
5. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
6. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll the dough out into a large rectangle, about 1/2 inch (1.5 cm) thick.
8. Spread the dough with the softened butter, leaving a 1/2-inch (1.5 cm) border around the edges.
9. Sprinkle the dough with the yeast mixture, and then top it with the remaining flour mixture.
10. Roll the dough up from the long side, starting with the buttered side, and then transfer it to a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
11. Cut the dough into 8 equal pieces, and then transfer them to the prepared baking sheet.
12. Cover the baking sheet with a damp cloth, and let the rolls rise in a warm place until they have doubled in size, about 30-45 minutes.
13. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
14. Bake the rolls for 15-20 minutes, or until they are golden brown and the internal temperature reaches 190°F (88°C).
15. Remove the rolls from the oven, and let them cool for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade rolls!

3fcf600832.gt:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
In a small bowl, add balsamic vinegar, brown sugar and chicken broth; mix well, set aside.
Rinse pork and pat dry and season with salt and pepper.
In an oven proof skillet, add olive oil and pork.
Sear pork until all sides are seared and lightly brown, about 10 minutes.
Remove pork from pan.
In the same pan over medium low heat, add the balsamic vinegar mixture and stir to loosen up all the brown bits from bottom of pan.
Stir and cook until it resembles a glaze.
Place pork back in pan and turn to coat until all sides are covered with balsamic mixture.
Place in the oven and roast for 25 minutes or until pork is no longer pink.
When pork is done, remove from pan and cover for about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a skillet, add butter and pears and cook over medium low heat until pears are tender, about 10 minutes.
Just before you take the pears off the stove, add a splash of Stella Artois Cidre and mix well.
Cut pork into 4 equal sizes.
Place 1/2 cup of sweet mashed potatoes on each plate, place the pork over the sweet potatoes, and lay pears over pork.
Sprinkle with goat cheese.
3fcf600832.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the Balsamic Vinegar, Brown Sugar, and Chicken Broth.
3. Season the pork tenderloin roast with salt and pepper.
4. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pork tenderloin roast and cook until browned on all sides.
5. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
6. In the same skillet, add the diced pears and cook until they are tender.
7. Add the Balsamic Vinegar mixture to the skillet and cook until it has reduced by half.
8. Add the cooked sweet potatoes and goat cheese crumbles to the skillet. Cook until the potatoes are heated through and the goat cheese is melted.
9. Place the pork tenderloin roast back into the skillet and cook until it is cooked through.
10. Serve the pork and vegetable mixture over a bed of mashed sweet potatoes.

Enjoy your delicious-looking dish!

16241b3374.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and move a rack to the middle of the oven.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
Combine the peanut butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, vanilla extract and egg in a large bowl and stir until fully combined.
Form 24 balls, 1-inch in diameter, and set evenly spaced apart on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake until lightly browned and crisp on the edges, 15 minutes.
Remove the cookies from the oven, and cool for 5 minutes.
Use your thumb or the back of a spoon to press into the middle of each cookie to create an indent about 1/4-inch deep.
Spoon 1/2 teaspoon of the chocolate-hazelnut spread into each cookie indent, refrigerate until the chocolate-hazelnut filling is no longer runny, 10 to 15 minutes.
Cook's Notes: These tasty cookies last for up to 2 weeks.
16241b3374.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the crunchy peanut butter, firmly packed light brown sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla extract. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the egg to the mixture and stir until smooth.
4. Spread the mixture evenly onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are slightly golden.
6. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Spread the chocolate hazelnut spread evenly over the cooled mixture.
8. Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the chocolate hazelnut spread is melted and the mixture is fully combined.
9. Allow the dish to cool completely before cutting it into squares or serving it.

This dish combines the creaminess of the chocolate hazelnut spread with the crunchiness of the crunchy peanut butter and the sweetness of the sugar. The result is a delicious and satisfying treat that is both indulgent and nutritious.

2af4ecd0e3.gt:
Mix butter, margarine, flour, sugar, vanilla together.
Keep dough in refrigerator overnight.
After the dough has refrigerated overnight, take it out of the fridge, and start making small balls (a little smaller than a golf ball I use a Tablespoon full) out of the dough.
After you make your balls, roll each one out into a flat disc, and add hoop cheese and nuts and a Tablespoon of preserves (or more if youd like) into the center of the disc.
Then roll the discs up.
Seal edges by pinching them together (you can add a little water too, if you need some adhesive) and bake at 350 degrees F until golden brown (roughly 8 10 minutes).
*Hoop cheese is also known as farmers cheese.
2af4ecd0e3.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece, follow these instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and margarine until smooth.
3. Gradually add the flour, sugar, and vanilla, mixing until well combined.
4. Add the shredded hoop cheese or farmers cheese, and mix until well combined.
5. In a separate bowl, mix the ground walnuts and preserves.
6. Add the walnut mixture to the cheese mixture, and mix until well combined.
7. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
9. Allow the cheesecake to cool in the pan for about 15 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
10. Once cooled, cut the cheesecake into 12 equal pieces and serve.

Remember to use the correct ingredients and follow the instructions carefully to ensure that you create a delicious and visually appealing cheesecake.

b5234384e0.gt:
Heat oven to 325
Sautee onion and celery
Cook noodles as directed.
Mix tuna with mayo and soup.
Once noodles are cooked mix into tuna and mayo mix.
Spoon into casserole dish.
Sprinkle crumbled potato chips on top.
Bake for 30 mins or until potato chips are browned.
b5234384e0.pred:
1. In a small casserole dish, combine the can of tuna, Cream of mushroom soup, and mayonnaise.
2. Add the diced celery and onion to the mixture.
3. Cover the dish with a layer of crushed potato chips.
4. Bake the casserole in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 20-25 minutes, or until the potato chips are golden brown and the casserole is hot and bubbly.
5. Serve the casserole immediately.

[/SYS]

587189f28c.gt:
Okay.. so, not everyone is going to be extremely lucky like we were and have their friends spend over 12 hours smoking a pork shoulder with pineapple injection and giving you a Tupperware full to go home with...
But if you are or you know how to smoke your own.. this recipe is super exciting.
Spread out some delicious, crunchy tortilla chips, (I used Calidad brand) on a small baking sheet and cover with shredded cheese of your choice,( again, I used marble cheddar), be thorough, every hates a cheeseless chip.
Put in oven on 350 for about 3-4 minutes or until cheese is melted.
Take chips out of the oven and sprinkle with sliced black olives
Add a moderate layer of refried beans and another layer of cheese and stick back in the oven for 2 minutes
Sprinkle with Tapatio(or your favorite hot sauce
Spread a layer of your shredded meat and another layer of cheese.
Place back in oven for two more minutes.
Get out your salsa, sour cream and guacamole!
I just sliced up an avocado :P. Its time to eat!
587189f28c.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Spread the tortilla chips evenly on a baking sheet and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until they are crispy.
3. While the chips are baking, prepare the cheese mixture by combining the shredded cheese, sliced olives, and smoked pork shoulder in a large bowl.
4. Once the chips are crispy, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
5. Add the cheese mixture to the chips and mix well.
6. Add the Tapatio hot sauce to taste, and mix again.
7. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy!

bf7afbd2d2.gt:
In a large mixing bowl combine lettuce, carrots, cilantro, olive oil, lime juice, and salt and pepper to taste.
Lay out tortillas and divide mixture among tortillas; top with turkey breast strips.
Fold in half and enjoy.
Serves 2.
bf7afbd2d2.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the turkey strips with the extra virgin olive oil, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the turkey strips evenly on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes or until cooked through.
4. While the turkey is cooking, prepare the corn tortillas by heating them in a dry pan over medium heat until they are warm and pliable.
5. In a large bowl, combine the shredded lettuce, matchstick carrots, and cilantro.
6. In a small bowl, mix the juice of one lime with a pinch of salt and pepper.
7. Once the turkey is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. To assemble the meal, place a corn tortilla on a plate, then top it with the cooked turkey strips, the lettuce and carrot mixture, and a dollop of the lime dressing.
9. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious turkey and corn tortilla meal.

48d0d21f53.gt:
Stir in a mixing glass with ice.
Strain into a cocktail glass.
48d0d21f53.pred:
[/SYS]

To create a delicious dish, follow these steps:

This recipe is a variation of a classic cocktail, the Whiskey Sour, which is a popular choice for its smooth and refreshing taste. The addition of Punt Y Mes and Maraschino Liqueur adds a unique twist to the classic recipe, enhancing the flavor profile and creating a delightful drink.

d99c985b0e.gt:
Combine all ingredients.
except the sesame seeds.
Cover and refrigerate mixture for 15 to 20 minutes.
Add sesame seeds.
(If desired).
mix well.
Serve over salad.
d99c985b0e.pred:

8a45727c6f.gt:
Remove stems from mushrooms.
Make a light mushroom broth by simmering stems in 2 cups water for 15 minutes, then strain and reserve broth (discard stems).
Dice mushroom caps and set aside.
Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes.
Cover with boiling salted water, let steep for 15 minutes, then drain.
Put oil in a wok or wide skillet over medium heat.
Add red peppers, black beans and bean paste and cook, stirring until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add garlic and ginger and let sizzle, then add mushrooms, soy sauce, sesame oil and Sichuan pepper.
Add 1 1/2 cups mushroom broth and cook mixture gently for 2 minutes.
Carefully add tofu cubes.
Shake pan to distribute sauce, using a wooden spoon to help.
Try to avoid smashing tofu.
Drizzle in cornstarch mixture, gently swirling pan to incorporate (sauce will thicken) and simmer tofu in sauce for 2 minutes more.
Thin with a little mushroom broth if necessary.
Transfer to a low bowl or platter.
Sprinkle with scallions and cilantro sprigs.
8a45727c6f.pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the shiitake mushrooms, water, and tofu. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for about 20 minutes, or until the tofu is tender and the mushrooms are cooked through.

2. In a small bowl, mix the fermented black beans, rinsed, fermented spicy broad bean paste (doubanjiang), minced garlic, grated ginger, soy sauce, toasted sesame oil, and Sichuan pepper.

3. Add the sauce mixture to the pot with the mushrooms and tofu. Stir to combine.

4. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.

5. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld.

6. Serve the dish over rice or noodles, garnished with slivered scallions, both white and green parts, and cilantro sprigs.

[/INST]

dfa22ec3cd.gt:
Combine (sift, if possible) the whole wheat flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.
Add the olive oil to the dry ingredients and mix until crumbly.
Add the milk a little at a time, kneading until it forms a dough.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap, then chill in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes.
If you're in a hurry, you can skip this step.
Dust your working surface with flour, then knead the dough, just a little bit.
Do not knead too much.
Evenly spread out the dough, then cut into desired shapes.
I use a cup to cut them into circles!
Then all you need to do is bake them for 20 minutes in an oven preheated to 170C.
Keep an eye on the oven and adjust the baking time.
They're done!
If they don't taste sweet enough, serve them with maple syrup or your choice of sweetener.
Have them for breakfast.
I found them delightful.
dfa22ec3cd.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine 200 grams whole wheat flour, 30 grams sugar, 1 dash of salt, and 2 tsp baking powder.
3. Add 2 tbsp olive oil (or vegetable oil) and 100 ml milk to the bowl, and mix until a smooth batter is formed.
4. If the batter is too thick, add a little more milk to achieve the desired consistency.
5. Dust the surface of the batter with a little flour to prevent it from sticking.
6. Pour the batter onto a greased and floured baking sheet or a silicone mat.
7. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
8. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious whole wheat cake!

bd3bd0a131.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
In a large bowl, cream together margarine, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs and vanilla.
In a separate bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add to egg mixture, and mix well.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Instead of just dropping them onto the cookie sheet, I roll the cookies into balls - it makes them all look very uniform and nice!
Bake in preheated oven for 12 to15 minutes, or until light brown.
Cool on a wire rack.
bd3bd0a131.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened margarine, white sugar, and brown sugar.
3. Add the vanilla extract and eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and salt, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
5. Fold in the semisweet chocolate chips.
6. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet or a parchment-lined baking sheet.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
8. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

9b3acc9089.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with two long sheets of Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil, overlapping them in opposing directions so you make a cross, with plenty of foil at each end to eventually fold over into the center.
Lightly spray with cooking spray and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, stir together cream, shallot and garlic.
Add parsnips, sweet potato and turnip and carefully toss together until all the pieces are well coated.
In another mixing bowl combine 1 cup of cheese, green onion and thyme and toss together.
To assemble, place a single layer of cream-coated root vegetable pieces onto the foil-lined baking sheet and season generously with salt and pepper.
Sprinkle 1/4 of the cheese mixture over the surface.
Repeat with another layer of vegetables, salt and pepper and cheese mixture and continue with this pattern until all the ingredients have been used (finishing with a layer of vegetables).
Bring each side of the excess foil hanging over the baking sheet together and seal tightly, leaving room for heat circulation inside.
Bake gratin in the oven for 40 to 45 minutes or until vegetables are fork tender.
Open foil carefully by cutting along top fold with a sharp knife, allowing steam to escape; then open top of foil.
Uncover gratin and sprinkle remaining cheese over the top.
Place gratin under a broiler and broil for 30 seconds to 1 minute or until cheese has melted and the top has browned slightly.
Allow gratin to cool for about 10 minutes before cutting up and serving.
9b3acc9089.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the heavy cream over medium heat until it starts to bubble.
3. Add the minced shallot and garlic to the skillet, and cook until the shallot is softened and translucent.
4. Add the sweet potato, parsnips, and turnip to the skillet, and cook for about 5-7 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
5. Add the shredded Gruyere cheese to the skillet, stirring to combine.
6. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Transfer the skillet to a large baking dish, and cover the dish with Reynolds Wrap Aluminum Foil.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious mystery dish!

32d7fb7310.gt:
To roast vegetables: Preheat oven to 400.
Wrap peeled garlic cloves together in foil with a few drops of olive oil and put in oven for the same time you will be roasting the peppers and potatoes, around 35 minutes.
Cut potatoes in half and cut red peppers into half inch pieces.
In a large bowl, toss potatoes, bell peppers and 3 TBS olive oil, along with salt and pepper to taste.
Arrange potatoes and bell peppers in one layer, divided amongst 2 shallow baking pans.
Roast in the middle and lower third of the oven, switching positions of the pans halfway through the roasting time, for a total of 35 minutes, or until potatoes are golden brown and tender.
To make salad: After potatoes are done,remove pans from oven and immediately toss roasted potatoes and peppers with 2 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Cool and remove garlic from foil.
Squeeze cloves into a small bowl and mash with a fork with remaining 1/2 TBS olive oil and 1 TBS balsamic vinegar.
Toss together with potatoes and peppers.
Just before serving, add fresh basil.
Serve at room temperature.
Optional items you could add for a main dish meal: goat cheese, toasted pine nuts, grilled chicken, grilled tuna, etc.
32d7fb7310.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with 1 tablespoon of olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly crispy on the outside.
3. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the red bell peppers and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender but still vibrant in color.
4. In a small bowl, mix the remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil with the balsamic vinegar.
5. Add the garlic cloves to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until they are fragrant but not browned.
6. Add the red bell peppers to the skillet, along with the balsamic vinegar mixture. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until the vegetables are coated with the vinaigrette.
7. In a large bowl, combine the cooked potatoes, red bell peppers, and garlic cloves.
8. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the dish hot, garnished with fresh basil leaves.

[/INST]

827de473ae.gt:
Position oven rack to center position.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Butter a 10-inch pie plate.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir bacon in the hot skillet until crisp, 5 to 10 minutes.
Remove bacon and drain all but 2 tablespoons grease from skillet.
Cook and stir asparagus and mushrooms in the remaining bacon grease until asparagus is tender, about 5 minutes.
Remove skillet from heat and toss bacon into asparagus mixture.
Spread asparagus-bacon mixture into the prepared pie pan.
Sprinkle Swiss cheese over mixture.
Whisk cream, eggs, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Pour egg mixture over asparagus-cheese mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until quiche is set and a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.
827de473ae.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, cook the asparagus and mushrooms until tender, about 5 minutes.
4. In a medium bowl, whisk together the heavy whipping cream, eggs, salt, and pepper.
5. Add the cooked bacon, asparagus, and mushrooms to the cream mixture. Stir to combine.
6. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x9 inch baking dish.
7. Top the mixture with the shredded Swiss cheese.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the dish immediately.

This cooking guide provides a simple and delicious recipe for a dish that combines the flavors of bacon, asparagus, mushrooms, and Swiss cheese. The dish is easy to prepare and can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

bf91ac4066.gt:
Saute onion in vegetable oil until clear.
Add all other ingredients and simmer for 10mins
Puree with hand mixer until smooth
bf91ac4066.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix together the ketchup, beer, Worcestershire sauce, minced yellow onion, lime juice, malt vinegar, kosher salt, chipotle pepper, brown sugar, bay leaf, yellow mustard, liquid smoke, creole spice, and molasses.
3. Add the marionberry puree and mix well.
4. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 1 hour, or until the mixture is bubbly and the sauce is slightly thickened.
6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful dish!

97ad761304.gt:
Preheat oven to 250 degrees.
Grease a springform pan; dust with cocoa.
Line bottom with kitchen parchment.
In 2 qt saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate with butter.
In large bowl, with wire whisk beat egg yolks and vanilla.
Slowly beat warm chocolate mixture into yolk mixture until blended.
In small bowl with mixer at high speed, beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
Gradually beat in 1/4 cup powdered sugar until sugar dissolves and whites stand in stiff peaks.
Fold beaten egg whites into chocolate mixture, one third at a time.
Spoon batter into pan spreading evenly.
Bake torte 1 hour or until toothpick inserted in center comes out almost clean.
Cool torte in pan.
When torte is cool, remove side of pan then remove torte from pan bottom; discard parchment.
Cut torte in 12 wedges.
Sprinkle 6 wedges with cocoa, remaining 6 wedges with confectioners sugar.
Arrange wedges alternately on cake plate.
97ad761304.pred:
To prepare the chocolate mousse cake, follow these steps:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped semisweet chocolate and butter.
2. Place the bowl over a pot of simmering water or in a double boiler, making sure the water does not touch the bottom of the bowl.
3. Gradually add the eggs, one at a time, stirring constantly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
4. Add the vanilla extract and continue stirring until the mixture is smooth and glossy.
5. Remove the bowl from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Add the confectioners' sugar, one cup at a time, stirring well after each addition.
7. Once all the sugar has been added, continue stirring until the mixture is smooth and fluffy.
8. Pour the mixture into a cake pan lined with parchment paper or a non-stick baking mat.
9. Bake the cake in a preheated oven at 325°F (163°C) for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Remove the cake from the oven and let it cool completely before serving.

Enjoy your delicious chocolate mousse cake!

887374647e.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly grease one 9x13 inch pan.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, flour, baking soda, vanilla, butter or margarine, honey and brown sugar.
Stir in the chocolate chips.
Lightly press mixture into the prepared pan.
Bake at 325 degrees F for 18 to 22 minutes or until golden brown.
Let cool for 10 minutes then cut into bars.
Let bars cool completely in pan before removing or serving.
887374647e.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, flour, baking soda, and vanilla.
3. Add the melted butter, honey, and brown sugar, and mix until well combined.
4. Fold in the mini chocolate chips.
5. Scoop the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown and the center is set.
7. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

d939f3ae1c.gt:
Use cooking spray and heat garlic and ginger over medium-high heat till golden brown.
Stir in tomato sauce, coriander, cumin, pepper, masala, salt, and reduce heat to low.
Partially cover and summer for 8-9 minutes stirring frequently.
Stir in spinach.
Simmer 8-10 minutes until spinach turns olive green.
Stir in whipping cream.
Stir in cheese.
Simmer for 3-4 minutes or until cheese is hot and remove from stove.

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.

fc1f93e1ef.gt:
Preheat oven to 325F.
Crumble the ginger snaps in a food processor and add the melted butter.
Use this mixture to line a deep pie plate or spring form pan.
Bake this at 325F for 19 minutes.
Beat the egg yolks well, and add the sugar.
Soak the gelatin in the cold water and heat gently over low flame until fully dissolved.
Pour over sugar and egg mixture, stirring briskly.
Whip the cream until stiff.
Fold in the egg mixture and flavor with the rum.
Cool in the refrigerator until mixture begins to set and pour into the pie shell.
Chill until firm and garnish with chocolate curls and chopped nuts.

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted butter, egg yolks, sugar, and unflavored gelatin. Whisk until well combined.
3. Slowly pour the cold water into the mixture, whisking constantly to prevent lumps.

10. Garnish the dish with chocolate curls and chopped nuts.

0d6724156e.gt:
Slice tofu in half lengthwise, then cut each half into two long strips, approximately 1/2-inch thick.
Mix remaining ingredients in a small bowl.
Lay tofu strips in a shallow pan and pour marinade over, turning tofu to coat.
Marinade for at least 1 hour, or as long as overnight.
Heat oil in grill or nonstick pan over high heat.
Sear tofu on each side until browned and heated through, approximately 2-3 minutes per side.

2. In a small bowl, mix the peanut oil, sweet chili sauce, and kosher salt.

133d9c352d.gt:
If berries are frozen, slightly thaw.
In a bowl, stir together sugar and flour.
Add fruit to sugar mixture, tosing well and spread mixture into baking dish.
Preheat oven to 375.
Topping:
Coarsely chop pistachios.
In a bowl, mix the flour and sugars.
Cut the butter into cubes with your fingers or a pastry blender, blending the flour mixture until it resembles coarse meal.
Add pistachios and toss well.
Squeeze a handful of topping together and coarsely crumble in chunks over filling.
Squeeze and evenly crumble remaining topping over filling in same manner.
Bake crisp in oven until filling is bubbling and topping is crisp and golden, about 50 minutes.
(can be done in advance).
Just before serving, heat crisp in 300 oven for 20 - 30 minutes until just warm.
Serve with ice cream or frozen yogurt.
Note: When measuring out the fruit.
I just add the blueberries and enough rhubarb to the baking dish, taking in to allowance the shrinkage of cooking.
If no rhubarb is available, just use all blueberries.
133d9c352d.pred:
To make the food in the photo, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 13 cups of sugar, 2 tablespoons of flour, and the chopped pistachios.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the 34 pounds of rhubarb with the 2 cups of blueberries.
4. Add the rhubarb and blueberry mixture to the sugar and flour mixture, and mix well.
5. In a separate bowl, cream the 14 cups of brown sugar and 6 tablespoons of butter until smooth.
6. Add the creamed butter mixture to the sugar and flour mixture, and mix well.
7. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until it is set and slightly golden brown.
9. Allow the cobbler to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cobbler!

73d512de54.gt:
Split eggplants in half and scoop out flesh, leaving 1/4 inch thick sides.
Drop flesh in boiling water for 5 minutes, remove, drain in colander.
Repeat with shells, remove and drain, set aside.
Cook onion, garlic, green pepper and celery in half of the butter until tender.
Add eggplant flesh, parsley, thyme, shrimp, salt and pepper, worcestershire and cayenne.
Add eggs to above, cook 5 minutes.
Fill shells with mixture, sprinkle with bread crumbs and bake 20-30 minutes at 350 degrees.
Melt remaining butter, pour over eggplants, sprinkle with parmesan cheese, serve hot.
73d512de54.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Cut the eggplants into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes and spread them out on a baking sheet. Drizzle them with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast the eggplant in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly browned.
3. In a large skillet, heat the butter over medium heat. Add the green pepper, onion, and celery, and cook until the vegetables are tender.
4. In a large bowl, combine the parsley, bread crumbs, dried thyme, shrimp, Worcestershire sauce, cayenne pepper, and salt and pepper to taste.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and parmesan cheese.
6. Carefully remove the roasted eggplant from the oven and add it to the skillet with the vegetables. Cook for a few minutes, stirring to combine.
7. Pour the egg and cheese mixture over the vegetables and stir to combine. Cook for a few more minutes, until the egg is cooked through.
8. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and sprinkle the seasoned bread crumb mixture over the top.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the dish is hot and bubbly.
10. Serve the dish immediately and enjoy!

3d390b8cc2.gt:
Heat 1 T oil in a large soup pot over medium high heat.
Add sausage, and cook 3 to 4 minutes or until browned on all sides.
Transfer sausages to a plate.
Add remaining oil to drippings in pot to equal 1/4 C cup.
Whisk in flour Cook over low heat, stirring frequently for about 20 minutes or until mixture is dark reddish-brown.
Stir in onion, peppers, celery and garlic and saute over medium heat for 8 minutes or until softened.
Stir in stock and next 9 ingredients .
Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer, covered for 30 minutes.
Meanwhile cook grits according to package directions and and cheese.
Cover and keep warm.
Stir in sausage, shrimp, and crab sections and cook for about 3-4 minutes or until shrimp are just done.
Do not overcook.
Remove bay leaves and serve gumbo over cheese grits.
Season with hot sauce if desired.

d8fd0d2fdf.gt:
Heat oven to 375F; Grease cookie sheets.
In large bowl, combine butter and cream cheese; beat until smooth; Add sweetened condensed milk and egg; blend well.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off; Add flour and brownie mix; mix well; (Reserve enclosed chocolate-flavored syrup packet for topping) Stir in pecans, coconut and chocolate chips; Drop dough by heaping tablespoonfuls 1 inch apart onto greased cookie sheets.

Cut very small hole in corner of reserved chocolate-flavored syrup packet; lightly drizzle over cooled cookies Store in tightly covered container.
d8fd0d2fdf.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter or margarine, cream cheese, and sweetened condensed milk. Mix until smooth and creamy.
3. Add the egg and mix until well combined.
4. Gradually add the flour, mixing until a smooth dough forms.
5. Fold in the chopped pecans and coarsely chopped coconut.
6. Spread the dough evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden and the center is set.
8. Allow the dish to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares.

b4e6dfe29e.gt:
Place all shake ingredients in a blender in the order listed.
Blend until it's as smooth as you like it.
Pour into a large parfait glass.
Top with whipped cream, sprinkle with chocolate sprinkles, green colored sugar, then place the cherry on top.
Insert a long-handled (parfait) spoon, two straws, and a candy cane.
Serve cuddled by the fireside listening to your favorite Christmas carols and watching your holiday tree glisten.
Just like two turtle doves.
Enjoy!
b4e6dfe29e.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Crush the 6 peppermint candies (or 2 candy canes broken up) into small pieces.
2. In a blender, combine the crushed candies, 12 cup 2% low-fat milk, and 2 large scoops of vanilla ice cream. Blend until smooth and creamy.

Enjoy your delicious and festive peppermint mocha milkshake!

0118ce719d.gt:
Toast your bread, butter it but not too much so its not soggy, put your seasonings on and dice into bite size pieces and you now have emergency croutons!
:)
0118ce719d.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
