8198c69331.gt:
Place all ingredients in your bread machine in the order given.
Set bread machine to dough cycle.
IMPORTANT!
CHECK YOUR MACHINE WHILE IT IS KNEADING and ADD MORE WATER IF NEEDED 1 TABLESPOON AT A TIME.
The dough should not be too dry - it should look smooth and satiny after kneading for a few minutes.
When dough cycle is complete, remove dough from machine and shape into long loaf (like french bread).
Place on a cookie sheet and let loaf rise for about 45 minutes or until doubled in size.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes or until nicely browned.
You can also just cook this in your bread machine on the regular bread cycle if you want.
It still tastes great, you just don't get the cuban shaped loaf.
8198c69331.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece, follow these instructions:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine 14 cups of water, 12 teaspoons of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
2. Add 3 cups of bread flour (I use King Arthur) and 2 teaspoons of bread machine yeast.
3. Mix the ingredients until they form a smooth, elastic dough.
4. Cover the bowl with a clean cloth and let the dough rise in a warm, draft-free place for approximately 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
5. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
6. Punch down the dough, and then transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
8. Use a cookie cutter or a round object to cut out circles of dough.
9. Place the dough circles on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the cookies in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown.
11. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

96a66bd364.gt:
Whisk the milk and oil together.
(The key to making this good and not tasting like oil is using a little less oil and a little more milk.)
Add flour, salt, and sugar.
Press on bottom of pie plate.
With a fork, poke holes in bottom and sides of crust.
Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
So easy and so good.
See Amazing Blueberry Cream Cheese Pie for ideas on what to make this with.
96a66bd364.pred:
[/SYS]

To cook the dish captured in the picture, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt.
3. Gradually add the milk, stirring until smooth.
4. Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
5. Pour the batter into the skillet and cook until the edges are set and the center is still slightly liquid, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Carefully flip the pancake and cook for another 2-3 minutes, or until the pancake is cooked through and the edges are golden brown.
7. Transfer the pancake to a wire rack to cool.
8. Repeat the process with the remaining batter, creating a stack of pancakes.

Enjoy your delicious pancake dish!

61afcadcb1.gt:
1.
In a small bowl, combine almonds and brown sugar; set aside.
2.
In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Beat in the almond extract.
3.
Combine flour, baking soda and baking powder.
Add this to the creamed mixture alternately with bananas and sour cream.
Fold in the vanilla or white chips.
4.
Spread into a greased 13x9x2 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle with reserved almond and brown sugar mixture.
5.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack.

7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

6a6db8c9e3.gt:
trim away middle of bun
put 1 Cheddar cheese and 1tbsp of jam
add 3 hazelnut on each bun and bake 180 C for 5 minute till cheese melted
6a6db8c9e3.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Place the two slices of cheese on a baking sheet or a small baking dish.
3. Spread the blueberry jam evenly over the cheese slices.
4. If desired, add a sprinkle of hazelnuts on top of the cheese.
5. Bake the cheese and hazelnut mixture in the preheated oven for about 10-15 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

8590091d29.gt:
Lightly oil grill and preheat to high.
Loosen skin on chicken pieces with fingers, by sliding hand between skin and flesh.
In a small skillet, saute green onion and 2 cloves garlic in butter or margarine for 1 minute.
Stir in breadcrumbs and parsley.
Push this seasoning under chicken skins, working it down well.
Combine 1 cup butter or margarine with mustard, 1 clove garlic and curry powder.
Spread this seasoned butter or margarine over chicken and put on preheated grill.
Cook 10 to 15 minutes each side, or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.
Brush with remaining seasoned butter while grilling.
8590091d29.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the bread crumbs, parsley, and coarse grained prepared mustard.
3. Season the chicken legs with salt and pepper, then coat them in the bread crumb mixture.
4. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
5. Add the green onions and cook for another minute.
6. Add the crushed garlic and curry powder, stirring to combine.
7. Add the chicken legs to the skillet and cook until they are cooked through and the bread crumbs are golden brown, about 10 minutes.
8. Remove the chicken from the skillet and place it on a baking sheet.
9. Drizzle the remaining butter over the chicken legs and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the bread crumbs are crispy and golden brown.
10. Serve the chicken with the green onion and curry sauce on the side.

[/INST]

baa571bacd.gt:
Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 400F.
Drain 1 can tomatoes, reserving juice, then break up tomatoes into 1/2-inch pieces with a spoon if necessary; puree the second can of tomatoes,including juice and reserved juice (from other can), 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon allspice in a blender OR use hand blender, until smooth.
Transfer tomato puree to a 2-quart heavy saucepan and boil uncovered, stirring occasionally, until reduced to about 1/2 cup, about 20 minutes, remove from heat.
Heat a dry 12-inch heavy skillet over moderate heat until hot, then brown lamb with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon allspice, stirring and breaking up lumps (but leaving meat slightly chunky), about 5 minutes; add drained tomatoes and cook, stirring occasionally, until juices are absorbed, about 1 minute.
Cut polenta into 1/4-inch-thick slices with a sharp knife and cover bottom of a 9-inch glass pie plate with half of polenta slices (overlapping slightly); scatter half of lamb mixture over polenta, then top with half of mozzarella, then remaining polenta; scatter remaining lamb on top and spread tomato sauce over meat, then top with remaining mozzarella.
Bake, uncovered, until bubbling and beginning to brown, about 20 minutes; let stand, loosely covered with foil, 15 minutes before serving, Enjoy.
baa571bacd.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground lamb, 12 teaspoon ground allspice, 1 lb ground mozzarella, and 34 teaspoon salt. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the 12 teaspoon ground allspice, 1 lb ground mozzarella, and 14 teaspoon black pepper.
4. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray or oil.
5. Spread half of the polenta mixture evenly in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
6. Pour the stewed tomatoes over the polenta mixture.
7. Spread the remaining polenta mixture over the tomatoes.
8. Top with the lamb mixture.
9. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the polenta is cooked through and the lamb is fully cooked.
10. Let the dish rest for 10 minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/INST]

b5c909ba3f.gt:
Heat grill.
Slice onion into slightly larger than 1/4-inch slices and brush both sides of each slice with olive oil.
Place onion on grill and cook 4-5 minutes per side or until brown and tender.
Let onion cool and then chop.
Place potatoes into boiling salted water for about 20-25 minutes or until just tender; drain.
When cool enough to handle, peeled and cut into 3/4 inch pieces.
In a large bowl, stir milk and vinegar together and let sit 1-2 minutes to thicken.
Whisk in mayo, salt and pepper.
Stir in onions.
Add potatoes to bowl, stir and then add celery.
Stir gently.
Cover and refrigerate for several hours before serving.
b5c909ba3f.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the onion, olive oil, and milk.
3. Add the cider vinegar, mayonnaise, salt, and pepper to the bowl. Mix well.
4. Add the sliced celery to the bowl.
5. Pour the mixture over the red boiling potatoes in a baking dish.
6. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the mixture is hot and bubbly.
7. Serve the dish immediately.

[/INST]

This delicious-looking dish is a hearty potato salad with a creamy, tangy dressing. The combination of ingredients, such as the onion, olive oil, milk, and mayonnaise, creates a rich and flavorful dish. The celery adds a crunchy texture and a touch of freshness to the dish. The dish is perfect for a warm and comforting meal, and it can be enjoyed as a side dish or a main course.

6cb33feaa0.gt:
Preheat oven to 375F Lightly grease cookie sheets.
Combine dry ingredients.
Set aside.
In a large bowl, cream the butter and sugars together.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time.
Stir in the vanilla.
Stir in the dry ingredients until well mixed, then stir in the chocolate chips, coconut and almonds.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto the prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 8 to 10 minutes.
Cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
6cb33feaa0.pred:
To prepare the delicious chocolate coconut almond cookies, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Stir in the vanilla extract.
5. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and salt, mixing until well combined.
6. Fold in the chocolate chips and sweetened coconut.
7. Fold in the chopped almonds.
8. Drop the dough by rounded tablespoonfuls onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the edges are set and the centers are still slightly soft.
10. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious chocolate coconut almond cookies!

ed047c7fd8.gt:
Add the milk, and small pieces of torn up cheese into a small saucepan.
Heat it up over medium-low heat until right before it starts to boil.
When the cheese has melted, mix well with a wooden spatula.
Let the mixture cool down.
Separate the egg yolks and egg whites.
Add the egg whites, 1/2 of the sugar into a bowl, and whip into a firm meringue.
Add the egg yolks and the remaining sugar into a separate bowl, and mix with a whisk.
Add the Step 1 mixture, and mix well.
Sift the cake flour into the Step 4 bowl, and mix well with the whisk.
Add the lemon juice as well, and mix well.
Add 1/3 of the Step 3 meringue into the Step 5 bowl, and mix well with the whisk.
Add the remaining meringue, and mix well with a spatula.
Pour the batter into a cake pan lined with parchment paper.
Place it in a baking sheet filled with hot water in the preheated oven, and bake for about 50 minutes at 160C.
Cover with aluminium foil halfway through so that it won't get burned.
If you don't mix the mixture really well during Step 6, it will separate into 2 layers, so please be careful.
If you are using a cake pan with removable bottom, the hot water will come into the pan while steam-baking in a water bath during Step 8, so please cover the bottom with aluminium foil and bake.
ed047c7fd8.pred:
[/SYS]

To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, lemon juice, and sugar until well combined.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the cake flour and the grated cheese.
4. Heat a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add the milk and cook, stirring constantly, until it thickens slightly.
5. Pour the milk mixture into the egg mixture, stirring gently to combine.
6. Pour the mixture back into the pan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens and reaches the desired consistency.
7. Pour the mixture onto the prepared cake flour and cheese mixture, stirring gently to combine.
8. Transfer the mixture to a greased 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious cheesecake!

0f248f2042.gt:
In a large frying/saute pan add oil, butter and garlic, saute on low flame until oil starts to bubble.
Add tomatoes, salt and pepper.
Cook covered on a low flame for about 30 minutes.
Add vodka.
Cook uncovered for 25 minutes.
Add prosciutto-- cook 5 more minutes.
Add basil and heavy cream-- cook just 5 more minutes.
SERVE IT NOW!
I like this over penne pasta.
I only use Barilla.

3c84706338.gt:
Preheat oven to 400?.
Spray a 2 qt casserole dish, or 9x9 baking pan with non-stick cooking spray.
In this order, layer the chicken, broccoli, 1 1/2 cups cheddar cheese and 2/3 of the bacon-bits in prepared baking dish.
Reserve the remaining cheese and bacon for topping.
Blend the eggs, milk, Bisquik, and 1/8 tsp.
fresh ground pepper until well combined.
Pour evenly over chicken mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until knife inserted in center comes out clean.
Sprinkle remaining cheese and bacon evenly on top.
Let cool 5 minutes before serving.
3c84706338.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cubed cooked chicken, crumbled cooked bacon, and shredded sharp cheddar cheese.
3. Add the Bisquick to the bowl and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and milk together.

022318dd52.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
Spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray.
(I have a 4 quart casserole dish I use for this.)
In a large skillet, brown together ground beef and onion; drain grease and return to pan.
Add tomato sauce, mushroom soup, 1/2 cup of the cheese, salt, pepper, and garlic.
Simmer uncovered.
While meat mixture is simmering, cook the pasta according to package directions.
Combine the pasta and the meat mixture together in the casserole dish; mix well.
Sprinkle remaining cheese on top.
Bake for 20 minutes or until cheese is bubbly.
022318dd52.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these steps:

1. Cook the shell pasta according to the package instructions.
2. In a large skillet, brown the ground beef over medium heat. Season with pepper, salt, and garlic powder. Cook until the beef is fully cooked through.
3. Add the chopped onion to the skillet and cook until softened.
4. Pour in the canned tomato sauce and cream of mushroom soup. Stir to combine.
5. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the shredded cheddar cheese to the skillet, stirring until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.

565fbfd08a.gt:
NB: I like to use a fairly strong flavoured, but creamy blue cheese, like Gorgonzola, but Stilton is also nice.
Stock-wise, you may need a little more or less than in the ingredients list.
Bring stock up to a simmer.
Halve the leeks and remove any gritty bits from inside the rings.
Cut the leek into fine strips rather than semi-circles, of approx 1-2 inches in length.
Melt half the butter with the olive oil and cook the leeks for approx 10 minutes over a low-medium heat until soft and tinged with brown.
Add bacon to pan and cook for about 5 minutes.
Stir in garlic and rice, cook for a further minute or two, stirring the rice until it's coated in the butter and oil and starts to go slightly translucent.
Add the wine to the pan, turning up the heat to bubble most of it away.
Add a ladleful of hot stock to the leek and rice mixture at a time, stirring more or less constantly.
Add more stock each time that most of the liquid has been absorbed.
Add the fresh sage.
Keep doing this for approximately 15 - 25 minutes, until the risotto is creamy, but the rice grains still have a slight bite.

Cool over an ice bath.
Freeze in an ice cream machine according to manufacturers instructions.

e9acd2e2b9.gt:
Cook couscous in well-salted boiling water, uncovered, until tender, about 10 minutes.
Stir in sugar snaps 3 minutes before couscous is done.
Drain and transfer to a bowl, then stir in 1/2 tablespoon butter and salt and pepper to taste.
While couscous and sugar snaps cook, toss shrimp with 1/8 teaspoon each of salt and pepper.
Heat remaining tablespoon butter in a 10-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat until foam subsides.
Saute shrimp, turning once, until just cooked through, about 3 minutes total.
Transfer shrimp with a slotted spoon to a plate.
Add wine, tomato, and sugar to skillet and boil until tomato starts to fall apart, about 4 minutes.
Return shrimp to skillet and stir in tarragon.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve shrimp and pan sauce on top of pearl couscous.

3. In the same saucepan, add the remaining butter and cook until it turns a light golden color. Add the dry white wine and cook until it has reduced by half.
4. Add the chopped tomato to the saucepan and cook until it has softened.

Enjoy your delicious-looking dish!

bce4690032.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a baking sheet (or 2) with parchment paper.

Reduce the speed of the mixer to low and add the flour.
Mix until just combined and then add in the chocolate chips and crispy bacon.
Form the cookie dough into 12 even-sized balls and arrange them on the cookie sheet about 2 inches apart from each other.
Flatten the cookie balls with your fingers and then bake for 12-14 minutes until golden brown.
Let the cookies cool for about 2 minutes on the baking sheet before transferring to a cooling rack.

Crust cookies in a food processor (or smash in a Ziploc bag with a rolling pin).

Bake for 3 to 4 minutesjust long enough for it to set.
Cool crust completely.
Place raspberries on a plate or in an empty pan.
Smash them with a fork, then sprinkle on 3 tablespoons of sugar.
Stir together and allow to sit for 15 minutes.

Beat on low until combined, about 1 minute.
Pour in heavy cream and whip on low for 30 seconds.
Stop the mixer and scrape down the bowl with a rubber spatula.
Turn mixer on medium-high speed and beat for two minutes, or until mixture is thick.
Turn off mixer, then fold in raspberries until just combined.
Pour into cooled pie pan and spread evenly.
Freeze for two hours, or until very firm.
Cut into slices and top each slice with cookie crumbs, dollops of whipped cream, and extra raspberries.
Keep in freezer, allowing time to thaw before serving.

70b786a095.gt:
Preheat the oven to gas 4 / 180C / 350F with and line 2 baking trays with foil and have 2 spare baking trays handy
Peel the beets and slice very thinly, 1/16 inch thick with a mandolin but be careful of your fingers.
In a large bowl, toss the sliced beets with the extra virgin olive oil
Arrange the beets in a single layer on each tray and sprinkle with a small amount of the salt.
You can use plain sea salt or any flavoured salt of preferrence.
Stack an extra baking tray on top of each layer of beetroot.
This keeps the crisps flat.
Put one tray on the oven top shelf and the other on the bottom
Bake until the edges of the beets begin to dry out, about 20 minutes.
Peek around 17 minutes to check!
Remove the extra trays that are on top of the beets and rotate the trays so the top one now goes in the bottom and the bottom one goes to the top
Bake a further 17 - 20 minutes.
Remove the crisps as they become lighter in color.
Transfer to a wire rack, they will crisp up as they cool
Keep in a lidded container for up to a week

Trim pork tenderloin removing fat and sinew, slice thinly across the grain (1/4" thickness), place in a bowl.
Add marinade ingredients (soy sauce, white wine, sriracha sauce, honey and ginger), mix to distribute sauce evenly and set aside.
Chop veggies.
Heat wok on high heat for a few minutes, add sesame oil, when oil just starts to smoke, add pork slices, turning frequently.
Stir-fry until pork is mostly cooked and opaque, about 5 - 8 minutes.
Remove pork from wok into a clean bowl/plate, set aside.
In the juices left in the wok, stir in chopped garlic, then add broccoli & carrots.
Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes, adding more sesame oil if desired.
Add baby corn and stir-fry for another 1-2 minutes.
Return pork to wok and stir into veggies, add more soy sauce, sriracha, and honey if needed to create a liquid gravy of about 1/2 cup in volume.
Push food to the outer edges so liquid is settled in the bottom of wok.
In a seperate bowl combine cool water & corn starch.
Add mixture to liquid gravy in the wok and stir until thickened.
Mix everything together and voila!
Serve immediately with cooked rice.
(Basmati/wild blend cooked in chicken stock and nutmeg is nice!)

7. Serve the yogurt sauce immediately, or let it cool and refrigerate for later use.

This recipe is for a delicious and flavorful yogurt sauce that can be used as a dip, a topping, or a side dish with various dishes. The combination of yogurt, ginger, red chile, and mint creates a unique and refreshing taste that is perfect for a variety of cuisines.

c577db5950.gt:
Squeeze the lime wedges into a small glass; add wedges and mint to glass.
Crush with the back of a spoon for 30 seconds.
Add soda, rum, Simple Syrup, and nectar; stir gently.
Serve over ice.Note: Nutritional analysis includes Simple Syrup.
c577db5950.pred:
1. In a cocktail shaker, combine the lime wedges, mint leaves, club soda, rum, Simple Syrup, and mango nectar.

3. Strain the mixture into a glass filled with crushed ice.
4. Garnish the drink with a mint sprig and a lime slice.

These are the steps for making a refreshing and delicious mango mojito using the ingredients provided in the photo.

2069c35857.gt:
Bring water to a boil in a covered saucepan.
Add butter, cumin, raisins, currants, zest, and rice.
Stir the rice and return to a rolling boil.
Cover and reduce heat to low.
Cook 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and add chives.
Fluff rice with fork and transfer to a serving dish.
Cover rice liberally with toasted sliced almonds or smoked almonds.

To make the unknown food item, follow these clear instructions:

2. Add 1/3 of a handful of golden raisins, 2 handfuls of currants, and 1 teaspoon of lemon or orange zest (from about 1/2 of the fruit). Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add 14 cups of enriched white rice to the saucepan, stirring to combine. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
4. Remove the saucepan from the heat, and stir in 2 blades of fresh chives, chopped.
5. Allow the rice to cool slightly, then add 1 (3 ounce) bag of sliced almonds, lightly toasted or 3 ounces of smoked almonds. Stir to combine.

e55ff056b8.gt:
1.
Mix soy sauce, lime juice, vegetable oil, chili garlic sauce and ketchup.
2.
Add chicken breasts to mixture and refrigerate for at least 6 hours.
3.
Remove from refrigerator and season chicken with salt and pepper.
4.
Place on a hot grill or bake in a 400 degree oven until cooked completely through.
A meat thermometer should read at least 155-160 degrees.
5.
Mix mayonnaise and Thai chili sauce.
Both the Thai chili sauce and the chili garlic sauce should be available in the Asian food section of the grocery store.
4.
Brush 1 Tbl of the mayonnaise-Thai chili sauce mixture over each hamburger bun.
5.
Place chicken on the bun and serve with lettuce and tomato.
e55ff056b8.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the chicken breasts with the Thai sweet chili sauce, chili-garlic sauce, and mayonnaise. Allow the chicken to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the ketchup, lime juice, vegetable oil, and soy sauce. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the marinated chicken until it is fully cooked through, about 5-7 minutes per side.
5. Once the chicken is cooked, remove it from the skillet and place it on a baking tray.
6. Pour the sauce mixture over the chicken in the skillet, and stir to coat the chicken evenly.
7. Return the chicken to the skillet, and place it in the preheated oven. Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
8. Remove the chicken from the oven, and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into thin pieces.
9. Toast the hamburger buns, and serve the chicken with the sauce on top of the buns.

[/INST]

f1211da4d4.gt:
In a serving dish, add quinoa, watermelon, red onion, feta and mint.
Gently toss to combine.
Drizzle in olive oil and balsamic vinegar.
Toss to combine.
Top with mint garnish.
Serve chilled.
f1211da4d4.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:
1. Cook the quinoa according to the package instructions, usually by boiling it in water until it is tender and the water has been absorbed.
2. Once the quinoa is cooked, let it cool down for a few minutes.
3. In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa, watermelon balls or cubes, thinly sliced red onion, and crumbled feta.
4. Add extra virgin olive oil and balsamic vinegar to the bowl, and mix everything together until the ingredients are well combined.
5. Tear the mint leaves and add them to the bowl, ensuring that they are evenly distributed.
6. Season the salad with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Serve the salad immediately, garnished with additional torn mint leaves for a pop of color and freshness.

This recipe is a delicious and refreshing summer salad that combines the nutty flavor of quinoa with the sweetness of watermelon and the tanginess of feta cheese. The red onion adds a touch of crunch, while the mint leaves provide a cool, fresh aroma. The balsamic vinegar and olive oil add a burst of flavor, making this a delightful and healthy dish that can be enjoyed during warm weather.

ee5c4e9487.gt:
Arrange cauliflower and carrots in four half-pint canning jars; set aside.
Heat remaining ingredients to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat, cook 10 minutes.
Turn off heat; let steep 5 minutes.
Pour mixture over the vegetables to cover.
Cover jars tightly; cool to room temperature, about 1 hour.
Refrigerate at least three days before serving.
ee5c4e9487.pred:
To cook the dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the cauliflower florets, carrots, and dill sprigs together.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the garlic, cilantro, serrano chilies, habanero pepper, and white wine vinegar.
4. Pour the vinegar mixture over the cauliflower and carrot mixture, and toss everything together to coat the vegetables evenly.
5. Transfer the vegetables to a baking dish, and drizzle the remaining white wine vinegar over the top.
6. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the dish from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious cauliflower and carrot dish with a tangy and spicy twist!

97b16dfccd.gt:
Cook pasta according to package directions.
Drain and set aside in a large bowl.
Cook bacon.
When cool enough, crumble into bite-size pieces.
Set aside.
In a small bowl, stir together the ranch dressing, green onions, cheddar cheese and black pepper.
Pour mixture over the pasta and add chopped bacon.
Stir together and serve.

2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the bacon by frying it until crispy.
3. In a small bowl, mix the buttermilk ranch dressing.
4. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and set it aside.
5. In a large skillet, cook the green onions until they are softened.
6. Add the crispy bacon to the skillet and cook until the bacon is fully cooked.
7. In a separate bowl, mix the shredded cheddar cheese.
8. Combine the cooked pasta, green onions, and crispy bacon in a large bowl.
9. Pour the buttermilk ranch dressing over the pasta mixture and toss to coat evenly.
10. Season the pasta mixture with black pepper to taste.
11. Serve the pasta salad immediately.

[/INST]

f78a4f2c70.gt:
Preheat oven to 425F.
Coat baking sheet with cooking spray.
Heat large, deep skillet over medium heat.
Add 1 Tbs.
oil, and swirl to coat pan.
Add onion and cook 5 minutes, or until onion becomes translucent, stirring often.
Stir in button mushrooms, garlic, and salt, and cook 8 to 10 minutes, or until mushrooms are soft and most of liquid is evaporated, stirring frequently.
Stir in rice, and cook 1 to 2 minutes longer, or until heated through.
Remove from heat, and stir in goat cheese.
Fill each portobello with about 1/3 cup filling mixture.
Toss tomatoes with lemon juice in bowl, and lay tomato halves cut-side up over tops of filled portobellos.
Place stuffed portobellos on baking sheet greased with remaining 1 Tbs.
oil, and sprinkle each with 1 tsp.
breadcrumbs.
Bake 30 to 35 minutes, or until mushrooms are cooked through and breadcrumbs are golden.
Sprinkle with parsley.
f78a4f2c70.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbs. of the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute.
5. Add the rice, salt, and 1 cup of water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, until the rice is cooked and the water is absorbed, about 20 minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix the herbed goat cheese, lemon juice, and 1 Tbs. of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. In a large baking dish, combine the cooked rice, mushrooms, and goat cheese mixture.
8. Drizzle the remaining 1 Tbs. of olive oil over the top, and sprinkle with the breadcrumbs.
9. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the breadcrumbs are golden and the dish is hot and bubbly.
10. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

[/SYS]

[/SYS]

d1d3e72257.gt:
Dice the tomato into 2-3 cm cubes.
Thinly slice the garlic.
Salt and pepper the cod.
Prep the shrimp.
Put the olive oil, red chili pepper, and garlic into a frying pan and saute over low heat.
Add the cod and cook both sides over medium heat.
Add the shrimp.
Quickly cook both sides, and add the water and tomatoes.
When it comes to a boil, simmer for 4 minutes over medium to high heat as you pour the broth over the fish.
Add the olive oil, and season with herb salt once the acqua pazza comes to a boil.
Dish it up, and scatter parsley on top.
d1d3e72257.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the sliced garlic, thinly sliced onion, and a pinch of salt. Allow the mixture to sit for 10 minutes.
3. Rinse the shrimp and pat them dry with a paper towel.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the sliced red chili pepper, herb salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
5. Place the shrimp in the bowl with the sliced garlic and onion mixture, and toss to coat the shrimp evenly.
6. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shrimp and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side.
7. Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
8. In the same skillet, add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
9. Add the sliced garlic and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
10. Pour in the water and bring the mixture to a boil.
11. Add the tomatoes, herb salt, and red chili pepper mixture to the skillet. Simmer the mixture for about 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
12. Add the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to combine with the sauce.
13. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
14. Serve the shrimp and tomato sauce over cooked pasta or rice, and garnish with chopped parsley or Italian parsley.

[/INST]

a0e261ef2d.gt:
Stir liquid soap into baking soda.
Add the water, and stir to be as smooth as possible.
Add the vinegar and stir again.
Pour into a squeeze bottle.
(A clean, empty ketchup or syrup bottle works well.)
Shake well before using, and keep tightly closed between uses.

8afb34ca7c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Quarter the large strawberries and halve the smaller ones.
Place the strawberries in a 9-inch pie plate or 8x8 baking dish.
Sprinkle the sugar over the strawberries and toss several times.
Roast the strawberries for 15-20 minutes, stirring once during the baking time.
The strawberries are done when they have softened and the juices are thick and bubbly.
Cool completely and store in the fridge.
8afb34ca7c.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, you will need the following ingredients: 1 pound of strawberries, stems removed, and 3 tablespoons of granulated sugar or raw sugar. First, wash the strawberries thoroughly and remove the stems. Next, place the strawberries in a large mixing bowl.

Add the sugar to the bowl and mix it well with the strawberries. You can use your hands or a spoon to ensure the sugar is evenly distributed. Allow the mixture to sit for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. This will allow the sugar to melt and the strawberries to release their juices.

After the strawberries have been sitting for the appropriate amount of time, use a spoon to scoop out the mixture and place it in a saucepan. Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has melted and the mixture has thickened. This should take around 5-10 minutes.

Once the mixture has reached the desired consistency, remove it from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes. Then, pour the mixture over the strawberries and serve immediately. This dish is a delicious and refreshing dessert or snack that combines the natural sweetness of strawberries with the richness of sugar.

bbff2a5297.gt:
Clean the shrimp and pat dry.
Slice and toast the baguette.
Peel all the garlic and mince finely.
Add to a pan over medium low heat with the olive oil.
We have a clay pot from Spain, but any pan will work.
Keep stirring, allowing the garlic to sizzle lightly (you want to make sure not to burn the garlic) for a few minutes.
Add the paprika, salt and pepper, and stir.
Bring the heat up to medium and add the shrimp to the pan.
Let the shrimp cook for 90 seconds, flip, and add the white wine.
Let everything cook together for another 2 minutes, or until the shrimp is just cooked through.
Place shrimp on toasted bread, drizzle with garlic oil, and garnish with parsley.
bbff2a5297.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the shrimp, garlic, olive oil, paprika, smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper. Mix well.
3. Spread the shrimp mixture evenly on the sliced baguette, making sure to cover the bread completely.
4. Place the bread with the shrimp mixture on a baking sheet.
5. Bake the bread for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the shrimp is cooked through.
6. Remove the bread from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Once the bread is cool enough to handle, cut it into bite-sized pieces.
8. Serve the shrimp and bread as a delicious appetizer or snack.

[/INST]

53ee6640d1.gt:
Using an espresso machine or cappuccino maker, prepare 2 shots espresso.
Fill a large serving glass 2/3 with ice.
Do not use extract or ice cream topping in place of syrup (use types specially made for beverages).
Add vanilla syrup, sugar (if desired), and espresso to glass and top up with cold milk.
Stir or shake briskly until syrup and sugar is nicely blended in the drink.

2. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
3. In a blender, combine the milk, ice, and the cooled espresso mixture. Blend until smooth and creamy.
4. Pour the milkshake into a glass and enjoy!

[/INST]

b3eb381c7e.gt:
Finely grind almond paste in processor.
Add softened butter, flour, and egg; blend until smooth.
Preheat oven to 400F.
Roll out puff pastry on floured surface to 13x11-inch rectangle.
Fold 3/4 inch of edges over; press to adhere to make 11 1/2x9 1/2-inch rectangle.
Transfer to rimmed baking sheet.
Pierce surface evenly with fork, avoiding folded edges.
Spread almond paste mixture evenly over crust within folded edges.
Arrange pear slices atop filling, overlapping slightly.
Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon sugar.
Bake until crust is deep golden and pears are tender, about 38 minutes.
Cool slightly.
Meanwhile, stir vinegar and remaining 1/4 cup sugar in heavy small saucepan over medium heat until sugar dissolves.
Increase heat; boil until syrup is reduced to 1/4 cup, about 6 minutes.
Place tart on platter.
Drizzle syrup over.
Sprinkle lightly with peppercorns and serve warm.
b3eb381c7e.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the almond paste, crumbled, and 1 tablespoon of the sugar.
3. In a large bowl, beat the egg and the remaining 1 tablespoon of sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Add the flour and the butter to the egg mixture and mix until well combined.
5. Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
6. Cut the pastry into 4 equal squares.
7. Place a spoonful of the almond paste mixture in the center of each pastry square.
8. Fold the pastry over the filling, pressing the edges to seal.
9. Place the filled pastries on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
10. Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the pastries are golden brown.
11. While the pastries are baking, prepare the pear slices. In a small bowl, mix the sugar and the black raspberry vinegar or raspberry vinegar.
12. In a large bowl, toss the pear slices with the sugar mixture.
13. Remove the pastries from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
14. Carefully transfer the pastries to a serving plate.
15. Arrange the pear slices on top of the pastries.
16. Optionally, sprinkle crushed pink peppercorns on top of the pears for added flavor.

Enjoy your delicious almond paste-filled pastries with pear slices!

048c81274c.gt:
in small sauce pan boil chiles and tomatillos.
when tender add to blender with onion and garlic.
blend on high until smooth.
in large fry pan melt butter/margerine and add cooked pasta.
cooke mixing every few minutes to prevent burning.
the color ur looking for is about 1/4-1/2 of the pasta turning golden brown.
add salsa from blender to pasta and mix thoroughly.
Then add sour cream/ crema mexicana and mix thoroughly.
salt to taste at this time.
lower heat to low and let simmer and obsorb juices.
crumble cheese on top and cover with lid to allow some melting...
serve right away and enjoy..goes well with any meat dish or even just a salad...
048c81274c.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the butter or margerine over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the garlic and cook for another 1 minute.
4. Add the cooked angel hair pasta to the skillet and toss to combine.
5. Add the tomatillos, jalapenos, and a pinch of salt. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the panela or queso fresco cheese and crema mexicana or sour cream. Cook until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Transfer the pasta mixture to a large baking dish.
9. Sprinkle the top with the remaining cheese.
10. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
11. Serve immediately and enjoy!

[/INST]

18f9bb7f6e.gt:
Mix all ingredients except the Romaine and the whole croutons in a small bowl or a "cruet".
Toss with Romaine and croutons.
Serve with a sprinkle of fresh shredded parmesan.
18f9bb7f6e.pred:

2. In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, and garlic. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Add the crushed parmesan cheese to the bowl and mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, toss the fresh romaine lettuce with croutons.
5. To assemble the salad, place the lettuce on a serving platter or individual plates.
6. Pour the dressing over the lettuce, and toss to coat evenly.
7. If desired, add minced anchovies to the salad for an extra burst of flavor.
8. Serve immediately, garnished with croutons.

This cooking guide provides a simple and delicious recipe for a salad featuring fresh romaine lettuce, croutons, and a flavorful dressing made from olive oil, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, garlic, and crushed parmesan cheese. The optional addition of minced anchovies can enhance the salad's flavor profile, making it a delightful and satisfying dish.

5f080b5a48.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Cream together eggs, butter, both sugars, crisco, and vanilla.
In separate bowl mix dry ingredients and slowly add to the wet.
Spoon on to cookie sheets.
You can roll each dough ball in sugar or icing them later if desired.
Bake at 375 for 12-15 minutes.
5f080b5a48.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the butter, Crisco, sugar, and vanilla.
3. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Gradually add the flour, baking soda, and cream of tartar, mixing until a smooth dough forms.

6. Cover the dough and refrigerate it for at least 30 minutes.
7. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to your desired thickness.
8. Cut out desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
9. Place the cookies on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
10. Bake the cookies for 8-10 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
11. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

ede4b858c3.gt:
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Drizzle 1 tablespoon of olive oil over both sides of each mushroom.
Sprinkle the mushrooms with salt and pepper.
Grill until the mushrooms are heated through and tender, about 5 minutes per side.
Meanwhile, add the extra-virgin olive oil and garlic in a medium bowl, and whisk until well blended.
Toss the tomatoes, cheese, and basil until evenly coated.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Place 4 hot grilled mushrooms gill side up on 4 individual plates.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper if needed.
Fill up the mushroom cap with the bruschetta and cheese mixture.
Drizzle a little bit more extra-virgin olive oil over if needed.
Serve and enjoy!

2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add the mushrooms to the pan and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Add the minced garlic to the pan and cook for another minute or until fragrant.
5. Add the tomatoes to the pan, breaking them up with a spoon or your hands. Cook for about 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are softened and slightly caramelized.
6. Add the chopped basil leaves to the pan and stir to combine.
7. Remove the pan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mozzarella cheese, salt, and pepper.
9. Add the cooked mushroom and tomato mixture to the bowl with the cheese. Stir to combine.
10. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish or a casserole dish.
11. Drizzle the remaining olive oil over the top of the dish.
12. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly, and the dish is hot and bubbly.
13. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious portabello mushroom and tomato bake!

b65ea7e6a7.gt:
Boil the pasta according to the instructions on the package.
In a large frying pan, heat the oil and over a medium heat, soften the garlic.
After a couple of minutes, add the tomatoes, tomato puree and sugar, and leave to stew over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
Add the mascarpone and stir until it has melted into the sauce.
Add the parsley or basil and season to taste with salt and pepper.
When it is ready, drain the pasta and add it to the pan with the sauce.
Mix well and then serve.

1. Prepare the pasta according to the package instructions.
2. In a large skillet, heat the Sunflower Oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
3. Add the diced tomatoes, tomato puree, sugar, and salt and pepper to the skillet. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are softened and the sauce has thickened slightly.
4. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and stir to combine.
5. Fold in the Mascarpone Cheese and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, until the cheese is melted and the sauce is creamy.
6. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the finely chopped parsley or basil.
7. Serve the pasta immediately, garnished with additional parsley or basil, if desired.

[/SYS]

fcb625ec64.gt:
Cut the carrot into thin strips.
Rehydrate the kanpyo in water.
Place the pork into the kombu, and then place the carrots on top.
Roll it up from the front with the carrot, and tie in two places with the kanpyo.
Add the A condiments and Step 2 to a pot, cover with a drop lid, and boil for at least 40 minutes until the kombu softens.
Stick with a toothpick, and cook until it pierces straight through.
After it has softened, turn off the heat, let cool, cut into half, and arrange on a plate.

6206f8059f.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Lightly grease a 9 x 5 loaf pan.
In a large bowl, combine butter, sugar, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, baking soda, baking powder and salt, beating till smooth.
Add the mashed bananas, jam, honey and eggs, again beating until smooth.
Add the flour, then the walnuts, stirring just until smooth.
Spoon batter into the prepared loaf pan, smoothing the top.
Let rest at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Bake bread for 45 minutes.
Gently lay a piece of aluminum foil across the top, to prevent over-browning.
Bake for an additional 20 to 25 minutes.
Remove the bread from the oven; a long toothpick or cake tester inserted into the center should come out clean, with the most a few wet crumbs clinging to it.
The tester shouldn't allow any sign of uncooked batter.
If it does, bake the bread an additional 5 minutes, or until it tests done.
Allow the bread to cool 10 minutes in the pan.
Remove it from the pan, and cool it completely on a rack.
6206f8059f.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the vanilla extract and cinnamon, and mix well.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients (baking soda, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg) to the butter mixture, mixing until just combined.
5. Fold in the mashed bananas and apricot jam or orange marmalade.
6. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add them to the banana mixture, stirring until just combined.
7. Stir in the chopped walnuts.
8. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish.
9. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
10. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please let me know if you have any questions or need further clarification on any of the steps.
<</SYS>>

[INST]<<SYS>>
I hope this recipe helps you make a delicious banana cake with walnuts!

fd96b8b1a7.gt:
Heat about 1-2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium low heat.
Add the mushrooms.
Cook them with the lid on for about 9 minutes or until golden brown, stirring occasionally.
Transfer to a food processor and pulse until finely ground.
In the same saucepan (add a little more oil if needed), over medium low heat, combine the minced mushrooms and onions.
Saute until onions are nice and soft and then add the ground turkey.
As it cooks, break up the turkey.
After a few minutes add all of the remaining ingredients (except the buns).
Continue to cook until the turkey is browned and no longer pink.
Spoon mixture onto buns and top with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.
(Recipe adapted from Pass The Sushi, who in turn adapted it from Americas Test Kitchen.)
fd96b8b1a7.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat.
3. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Add the onion and cook until it is softened, about 3-5 minutes.
5. Add the ground turkey and cook until it is browned and cooked through, breaking it up into smaller pieces as it cooks.
6. Stir in the ketchup, mustard, BBQ sauce, apple cider vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Transfer the mixture to a large baking dish or oven-safe casserole dish.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the turkey is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly thickened.
9. Serve the dish on top of the hamburger buns.

[/INST]

643060cd52.gt:
Throw all ingredients into a bowl and combine!
(You can add 3tsp of Cacao powder for a slight chocolatey flavour)
643060cd52.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Casein Protein Powder, Peanut Butter, and Honey. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the cubed small dates to the mixture and stir to combine.
4. Add the water, one tablespoon at a time, stirring after each addition, until the desired consistency is reached.
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
6. Pour the mixture onto the prepared baking sheet.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the mixture is set and the edges are slightly crispy.
8. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting into bars.
9. Enjoy your delicious, homemade protein bars!

[/INST]

84fd3c9208.gt:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees, cut top off of squash and remove pulp and seeds, place upside down on cookie sheet and fill pan 1/2 way up with water, cover with foil and bake 45 minutes, remove and make sure it is fork tender, if not continue cooking in 10 minute intervals, leave on pan to cool.
While it is baking, in rice cooker cook rice with 2 cups vegetable broth, diced zucchini, 1 diced carrot, chopped parsley, and about 1/2 cup water.
When rice is done cooking, stir it well and add the raw tomato, pepper and 1/2 of the onion diced.
In a Large skillet add olive oil and brown 1/2 of the diced onion, when brown add the ground turkey, sage, garlic and mushrooms -- continue cooking until meat is done -- add the rice mixture to the meat mixture and stir well, use the remaining vegetable broth to deglaze pan and get moisture level up for oven baking.
Remove about 3/4 of the squash meat and puree for pie or freeze for later use.
Fill squash with the rice/meat mixture about 1/2 full then add 1/2 the cheese, then layer remaining rice mixture on top and top it all with the remaining 1/2 cup of cheese.
Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes just to get the cheese melted and the flavors melded.
Makes a great presentation to the table with the squash full of the meal!
84fd3c9208.pred:
To cook the dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the squash, brown rice, white rice, zucchini, carrots, onion, garlic, and vegetable broth. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 25-30 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the vegetables are tender.
3. In a separate pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned.
4. Add the ground turkey to the pot and cook until it is fully cooked through.
5. Stir in the grated parmesan cheese, pepper, and sage.
6. Transfer the mixture to a large oven-safe dish.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the top is golden brown and the filling is hot and bubbly.
8. Serve the dish immediately.

This dish is a delicious and nutritious meal that combines the flavors of squash, rice, and turkey. The vegetables provide essential vitamins and minerals, while the mushrooms add a savory taste and the cheese adds a creamy texture. The dish can be enjoyed as a main course or as a side dish, making it a versatile and satisfying option for any meal.

0f967b0694.gt:
In a large bowl, toss together the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado and red onion; set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together jam, vinegar, walnut oil, pepper and salt.
Taste, and adjust amounts to suit your liking.
Pour over the salad and toss to coat.
0f967b0694.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the spinach, cranberries, blue cheese, tomatoes, avocado, red onion, and raspberry jam.
3. In a small bowl, mix the raspberry jam and red wine vinegar.
4. Drizzle the raspberry-vinegar mixture over the salad mixture and toss to coat evenly.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together the walnut oil, salt, and pepper.
6. Pour the walnut oil mixture over the salad mixture and toss to combine.
7. Spread the salad mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
8. Roast the salad in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Remove the salad from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade salad!

ec81905a61.gt:
Place the dry pancake mix into a large bowl.
Add the eggs, club soda and melted shortening.
Use a wire whisk to mix carefully until there are no lumps (dont over mix).
Allow the batter to rest while you preheat your griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
Use about 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in the preheated skillet for each pancake; use 1/2 cup batter for each pancake.
Flip pancake only once when you see open bubbles appear on the surface and the edges appear dry around the pancake.
Makes about 10 pancakes 8 inches in diameter.
ec81905a61.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Bisquick or Jiffy baking mix, beaten eggs, and melted Crisco shortening. Mix until well combined.
3. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. Dot the top with the club soda, pouring it evenly over the mixture.
5. Bake the casserole in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown and set.
6. Remove the casserole from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares and serving.

[/SYS]

e531d7ab07.gt:
Cut the fat cap side off of the beef.
Rinse meat in water, then place in a slow cooker.
Sprinkle all sides of meat with salt generously.
Add up to 4 cups of baby carrots to the slow cooker.
Fill a large measuring cup with 4 cups of hot water.
Pour contents of seasoning envelope into the water and stir until blended.
Pour water and seasoning into the slow cooker.
Set slow cooker to cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
If you only have 6 to 8 hours for cooking, set slow cooker on high for the last 3 hours, or all of the cooking time.
Additional ingredients can be added to the slow cooker during preparation, such as: quartered red potatoes, sliced celery, sliced onions, green peas.
If adding these extra ingredients, you may need to use a smaller meat portion in order to fit everything in your slow cooker.
My preference is to cook the largest meat portion I can and prepare mashed potatoes just before serving.
This option provides enough meat for pot roast leftovers the next night and two nights of beef enchiladas through the week.
Check out my recipes for Easy Extraordinary Mashed Potatoes and Pot Roast Turned Enchiladas.
e531d7ab07.pred:
[INSTRUCTIONS]
1. Preheat your oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. Place the 5 pounds of beef roast from Costco in a large roasting pan.
3. In a small bowl, mix 5 tablespoons of salt, 4 cups of baby carrots, and 1 envelope (about 1.5 Oz. Packet) of pot roast or beef stew seasoning.
4. Pour the mixture over the beef roast in the roasting pan.
5. Add 4 cups of water to the pan.
6. Cover the roasting pan with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 3 hours or until the beef is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
7. Remove the roasting pan from the oven and let it rest for about 20 minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INSTRUCTIONS]

[/SYS]

c78e924f69.gt:
Whisk mayonnaise, yogurt, vinegar and crushed red pepper to taste in a medium bowl.
Add pineapple and coleslaw mix and stir to combine.
Place cornmeal in a shallow dish.
Sprinkle both sides of fish with Cajun seasoning and salt.
Dredge the fish in the cornmeal.
Heat 2 teaspoons oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat.
Add half the fish and cook until golden, about 2 minutes per side.
Transfer to a plate and repeat with the remaining 2 teaspoons oil and fish, adjusting heat as needed to prevent burning.
Top toasted bread with the fish and pineapple slaw to make sandwiches.
Serve immediately.
c78e924f69.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the low-fat mayonnaise, nonfat plain yogurt, rice vinegar, crushed red pepper flakes, and cajun seasoning. Mix well.
3. Add the drained and coarsely chopped pineapple chunks to the bowl and mix gently.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the coleslaw mix, cornmeal, 4 teaspoons of canola oil, and salt. Mix well.
5. Dip the haddock or cod into the cornmeal mixture, making sure it is evenly coated.
6. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add the remaining 2 teaspoons of canola oil. When the oil is hot, add the breaded haddock or cod and cook until it is golden brown on both sides and the fish is cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.
7. Remove the fish from the pan and place it on a baking sheet.
8. Pour the pineapple-mayonnaise mixture over the fish and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
9. Serve the fish with the pineapple-mayonnaise sauce on top.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy meal!

a203693020.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Roll out half of pastry to line pie pan, and roll out other half to cut into strips for lattice top.
In a medium mixing bowl combine eggs, sugar, flour, salt, lemon juice, and grated lemon rind.
Mix well then stir in pineapple.
Spread filling into pastry-lined pie pan, make lattice top, and crimp edges.
Place in preheated oven and bake 40 minutes or until filling is set and crust is lightly browned.
Chill before serving.
a203693020.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, salt, and lemon zest.
3. Add the eggs and lemon juice, and mix until a dough forms.
4. Press the dough into a disk, wrap it in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
5. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to fit a 9 inch pie pan.
6. Line the pie pan with the dough, leaving a 1 inch border around the edges.
7. Bake the pie crust for 15-20 minutes, or until it is set and lightly golden.
8. Remove the pie crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. In a large mixing bowl, combine the pineapple chunks, sugar, and lemon juice.
10. Pour the pineapple mixture into the cooled pie crust.
11. Roll out the remaining dough and use it to cover the pie.
12. Crimp the edges of the dough to seal it, and cut a few slits in the top to allow steam to escape.
13. Bake the pie for 35-40 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly and hot.
14. Allow the pie to cool for a few minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

This comprehensive set of instructions will guide you through the process of preparing the delicious double crust pie filled with pineapple chunks. The pie crust is made from scratch, and the filling is a combination of pineapple, sugar, and lemon juice, resulting in a delightful and appetizing dessert.

df9193a49e.gt:
In a large pot, heat 1 tablespoons of the oil on high heat.
When hot, add the pork cubes and cook until soft.
Stir in the garlic, curry powder, coriander, cumin, and crushed red pepper.
Cook 1 minute.
Add ginger, cinnamon, bay leaf, salt, chicken broth, and tomato paste.
Bring liquid to a boil, cover and simmer on low for 45 minutes.
Add peanut butter and blend well.
Cook stew another 3 minutes, uncovered to blend.
Stir in chopped tomato and bell pepper.
Simmer 2-3 minutes, just until the vegetables soften but still retain shape.
Before serving, taste to correct seasonings; You may wish to add a final splash of lemon juice to refresh the flavors.
df9193a49e.pred:
[/SYS]

1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the pork, onion, garlic, curry powder, ground coriander, ground cumin, crushed red pepper flakes, ginger, cinnamon, bay leaf, and salt. Mix well.
3. Heat 1 tablespoon of the peanut oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Add the pork mixture and cook until the pork is browned and cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.
4. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of peanut oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
6. Add the tomato paste to the skillet and cook until it begins to caramelize, about 5-7 minutes.
7. Add the chicken broth, tomato, and peanut butter to the skillet. Stir to combine.
8. Return the pork to the skillet and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for about 15-20 minutes, or until the pork is tender and the sauce has thickened.
9. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the cilantro, peanuts, and green bell pepper.
10. Transfer the mixture to a large oven-safe baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
11. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

[/SYS]

[/SYS]

This recipe card provides clear instructions for preparing a delicious and flavorful dish featuring a combination of pork, tomatoes, peanuts, and curry spices. The dish is easy to follow and can be enjoyed by people who enjoy spicy and flavorful cuisine.

fcf4d62dec.gt:
Measure the sugar and 1 tablespoon of water, and put into a pan.
You don't have to dissolve the sugar.
Measure out the water you will add later, and prepare in a cup.
Start heating over a medium-high heat.
It will gradually bubble up.
Keep watching it, and you'll see it starting to brown from the edges.
When all of the syrup has browned, turn off the heat.
It will keep cooking and the flavor will continue to deepen, so watch out!
If you like bitter caramel wait for a while before adding the water.
If you prefer less bitter caramel or you're serving this to little kiddies, add the water immediately.
It will splatter, so be careful.
Shake the pan to even out the consistency of the mixture.
If you added too much water, put the pan back on the heat to evaporate some.
Pour the caramel sauce into flan or pudding cups while it's still hot.
If you don't add it right away, it will harden!
Swirl the cups around so that the sauce is evenly distributed.
When the surface of the sauce hardens and no longer sticks to your fingers when you touch it, add the flan mixture and get going!
fcf4d62dec.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil, stirring until the sugar is dissolved.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
4. Add the cooled mixture to a mixing bowl.
5. Gradually add the water, stirring until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
6. Place the bowl in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or until the mixture is cold and firm.
7. Once the mixture is firm, remove it from the refrigerator and let it sit at room temperature for about 10-15 minutes.
8. Meanwhile, prepare your baking sheet by lining it with parchment paper or a non-stick spray.
9. Roll out the dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness (1/4 inch or 0.6 cm).
10. Cut out desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
11. Place the dough shapes on the prepared baking sheet.
12. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes or until they are lightly golden brown around the edges.
13. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your homemade sugar cookies!

88803603ec.gt:
Place sardines in 11 x 7 x 2-inch glass baking dish.
Sprinkle fish with 1 teaspoon coarse salt.
Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare barbecue (medium-high heat).
Combine cilantro, parsley, and lemon peel in small bowl.
Mix olives and onion in another small bowl.
Brush sardines lightly with oil.
Sprinkle half of herb mixture over sardines; turn to coat.
Grill sardines until just opaque in center, 1 to 2 minutes per side, depending on size.
Arrange sardines on platter.
Sprinkle with olive mixture, then remaining herb mixture.
Sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper.
Garnish with lemon wedges.
88803603ec.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the sardines, coarse kosher salt, coarsely chopped cilantro, coarsely chopped parsley, finely grated lemon peel, and pitted brine-cured green olives.
3. Add the red onion and mix well.
4. Brush the sardine mixture with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
6. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the cooked sardines on a platter, garnished with lemon wedges.

[/INST]

e4f1c20d6c.gt:
Preheat oven to 400F
Beat egg yolks thoroughly with salt and paprika.
Beat in oil a little at a time.
Beat in butter a little at a time.
Stir in 3/4 of the cheese.
Combine with spinach.
Pour one third of spinach mixture into a greased shallow 9" square baking dish.
Season both sides of fish with lemon juice, salt and pepper.
Roll fish up and place rolls, loose side down, in pan on top of spinach.
Top with remaining spinach mixture.
Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes.
e4f1c20d6c.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted and cooled slightly melted butter, egg yolks, salt, and paprika.
3. Add the shredded cheese to the mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Add the cooked and drained spinach to the mixture.
5. Place the fillets of plaice on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
6. Drizzle the cooked spinach mixture over the fillets, making sure to cover them evenly.
7. Bake the fillets in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and the spinach mixture is bubbly and slightly crispy.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the dish rest for a few minutes before serving.
9. Squeeze a fresh lemon over the dish before serving.

[/INST]

5a22f9a832.gt:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Grease an 8-inch square baking dish.
Combine ground beef, rolled oats, French onion soup, and eggs in a bowl until thoroughly combined; transfer to prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until the meat loaf is no longer pink in the middle and an instant-read meat thermometer inserted into the center of the loaf reads at least 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), 60 to 75 minutes.
5a22f9a832.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until it is browned and cooked through. Drain any excess fat.
3. Add the rolled oats to the skillet and stir to combine. Cook for a few minutes until the oats are slightly toasted.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, salt, and pepper.
5. Pour the egg mixture over the ground beef and oats in the skillet. Stir to combine.
6. Pour the French onion soup into the skillet, stirring to combine.
7. Cook the mixture over medium heat until the eggs are cooked through and the ingredients are heated through.
8. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 20-25 minutes, or until the dish is hot and bubbly.
9. Serve the dish immediately.

[/INST]

7d71040d61.gt:
In a skillet, cook the spinach, stirring, until wilted; transfer to a colander and squeeze dry.
Finely chop the spinach.
In a bowl, combine 1 1/2 teaspoons of the soy sauce, the sesame oil, sherry, salt, sugar and white pepper.
Mix in the pork, scallion, ginger and spinach.
Chill for 10 minutes.
Dust a large baking sheet with cornstarch.
Arrange 4 wonton wrappers on a work surface, keeping the other wrappers covered with plastic wrap.
Brush the edges of the wrappers with water and spoon 1 teaspoon of filling in the center of each.
Fold the wrappers diagonally over the filling to form triangles; seal.
Bring the two opposite corners of the triangle together; press to seal.
Transfer to the baking sheet and cover.
Repeat.
In a large saucepan of boiling water, simmer the wontons over moderate heat, stirring occasionally.
When they float, cook for 3 minutes longer.
Drain the wontons well.
In a large bowl, combine the remaining soy sauce with the chile oil, peanut oil and garlic.
Add the wontons and toss.
Sprinkle with the cilantro and serve.
7d71040d61.pred:
1. In a large bowl, combine the baby spinach, soy sauce, Asian sesame oil, dry sherry, salt, sugar, and pepper. Mix well.
2. Add the ground pork and minced scallion to the bowl, and mix until the pork is evenly coated with the sauce.
3. In a small bowl, mix cornstarch with a little water to form a slurry.
4. Add the cornstarch mixture to the pork mixture, stirring to combine.
5. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
6. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
7. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
8. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the wonton wrappers into thin circles.
9. Place a spoonful of the pork mixture in the center of each wrapper, leaving a small border around the edges.
10. Fold the wrapper over the filling, pressing the edges to seal.
11. Place the filled wrappers on the prepared baking sheet.
12. Brush the tops of the wrappers with peanut oil.
13. Bake the wontons in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown and cooked through.
14. Serve the cooked wontons immediately, garnished with chopped cilantro.

[/INST]

10dc73989c.gt:
Cook pasta as directed on package, omitting salt.
Meanwhile, heat large skillet on medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, tomatoes and cream cheese spread; cook and stir 3 to 4 min.
or until cream cheese is melted and shrimp are done.
Drain pasta; place in large bowl.
Add spinach and shrimp mixture; mix lightly.
10dc73989c.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, you will need to follow these steps:

1. Cook the linguine according to the package instructions.
2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they are softened and slightly browned.
3. Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook until they are pink and cooked through.
4. In a small bowl, mix the PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese Spread with the torn fresh spinach.
5. Drain the cooked linguine and combine it with the shrimp mixture in the skillet.
6. Add the spinach-cream cheese mixture to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with fresh chopped parsley if desired.

Enjoy your delicious and creative linguine dish!

de0b779581.gt:
In 2-cup glass measuring cup, combine chicken broth and enough water to equal 2 cups.
In 2-quart saucepan, heat broth mixture, thyme, and nutmeg to boiling over high heat.
Add bulgur, reduce heat to medium-low.
Cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed.
Garnish each serving with a thyme sprig.
de0b779581.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. In a large pot, combine the chicken broth, dried thyme leaves, and nutmeg. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat.
2. Add the bulgur to the pot, stirring to ensure it is evenly coated with the liquid. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the bulgur is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
3. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Garnish the dish with thyme sprigs for a touch of freshness and aroma.
5. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy the delicious, comforting meal.

55c9dcc2b4.gt:
Cut each cake roll into eight slices; set aside any chocolate coating that separates from rolls for garnish.
Line a 9-inch springform pan with cake slices so that the swirl of cream and chocolate is on it's side and can be seen when you take the springform pan off, completely covering the bottom and sides.
In a small bowl, whisk milk and pudding mixes for 2 minutes.
Let stand for 2 minutes or until soft-set.
Pour over cake.
Spread with whipped topping; sprinkle with any reserved chocolate coating.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
**Cook time does not include refrigeration time of two hours.
55c9dcc2b4.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chocolate swiss rolls and cold milk. Mix until the chocolate swiss rolls are fully submerged and the mixture is smooth.
3. Add the chocolate fudge instant pudding mix to the mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the edges are set and the center is still slightly wobbly.
6. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into 12 equal pieces.
7. Serve the cake with whipped topping on top.

[/SYS]

e03a36dd25.gt:
Place popcorn kernels in paper bag.
Fold the top of the bag 3 times.
Place in microwave.
Set time for 40 to 60 seconds.
(this will vary depending on your microwave, Mine takes 3 minutes total)
When popping has stopped pour popcorn in a bowl and finish popping any unpopped kernels for 15 to 20 seconds (depending on your microwave).
Add rest of popcorn to bowl, when done.
Salt popcorn to your taste and enjoy!
Note: Add melted butter and/or other seasonings over top of popcorn and stir well to distribute butter and seasonings.
e03a36dd25.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 250°F (120°C).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
3. In a large bowl, combine the unpopped popcorn and salt.
4. Spread the popcorn mixture evenly on the prepared baking sheet.
5. Roast the popcorn in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the popcorn is golden brown and crisp.
6. Remove the popcorn from the oven and let it cool completely.
7. In a small brown paper bag, mix the butter and seasoning of your choice.
8. Open the bag and pour the butter mixture over the popcorn.
9. Close the bag and shake it gently to evenly coat the popcorn with the butter mixture.
10. Spread the popcorn evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or aluminum foil.
11. Roast the popcorn in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the popcorn is golden brown and crisp.
12. Remove the popcorn from the oven and let it cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious and appetizing popcorn snack!

6febef31e3.gt:
Pour the water in a saucepan and heat it until medium hot.
Mix the cocoa powder with the water.
Add in Splenda and mix until the mixture becomes creamy and thick.
Do not add too much Splenda as biscuits themselves are the major source of sweetness in the recipe.
Crush the biscuits separately in a bowl.
Make sure the pieces are neither too big nor extremely powdery.
We just need small pieces.
Add the cocoa mixture to the bowl and mix it lightly with a spoon.
Take a small plastic bag and put in the resulting mixture, roll the plastic bag in a cylinder like shape.
Put the bag in a Refrigerator and allow it to cool for 4-6 hours.
