Flip over the chicken and fry while forming the shapes.
Arrange onto a plate and it's finished.
bb41f986c4.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the eggs, soy sauce, honey, and a pinch of salt.
4. Heat sesame oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the green onions and cook until they are softened.
5. Add the chicken breast to the skillet and cook until it is cooked through and no longer pink in the middle.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
7. In a small bowl, mix the cake flour with a pinch of salt.
8. Add the mixture to the skillet with the chicken and cook until it is golden brown.
9. Add the whisked egg mixture to the skillet and stir until it is cooked through.
10. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and stir to combine.
11. Serve the dish immediately, garnished with sesame seeds.

Enjoy your delicious mystery dish!

b384c81283.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
Place the frozen berries, sugar, cornstarch and 1/2 cup of the crisp topping into a medium mixing bowl and stir to combine.
Divide the mixture evenly between 4 ramekins (7-8oz size).
Top each ramekin with 1/2 cup of the remaining crisp topping.
Place ramekins on a sheet pan and bake in the middle rack of the oven for 30-35 minutes or until the fruit is bubbling and the topping is browned.
Allow to cool for 1 minutes before serving.
Crisp topping.
Place the flour, sugar, nuts and cookies into a large mixing bowl and combine.
Work the butter into with your hands until it is crumbly.
Store in the refrigerator for up to a week.
Use as topping for crisps, cobblers or grunts.
b384c81283.pred:
To make the topping, combine the sugar, cornstarch, and water in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and boils. Remove from heat and stir in the chopped nuts or pecans or almonds. Spread the mixture evenly over the prepared topping.

To make the crust, combine the flour, sugar, and butter in a large bowl. Press the mixture into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch springform pan. Bake the crust in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set but not browned. Remove the crust from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.

To assemble the dessert, pour the prepared topping over the cooled crust. Spread the frozen berries evenly over the topping. Return the dessert to the oven and bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the berries are bubbly and cooked through.

Remove the dessert from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Then, transfer the dessert to a wire rack and let it cool completely. Once cooled, cut the dessert into slices and serve.

[/INST]

7f9c7a1b1f.gt:
About one hour before smoking, coat both sides of ribs with a little vegetable oil and sprinkle with Chinese 5 spice.
Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour.
Heat charcoal or gas grill for indirect cooking at 230 to 250 degrees F. Add drained wood chips, if using.
Place the ribs, meaty side down, over a drip pan and cook for 2 hours.
Add about 12 coals to a charcoal grill every 45 minutes or so to maintain the heat.
Remove ribs from grill.
Double-wrap each rack in heavy-duty aluminum foil.
Return wrapped ribs to the grill and cook for 1 1/2 to 2 hours more over indirect heat, until very tender.
Add more coals as needed to maintain temperature for a charcoal grill.
Meanwhile, make the glaze.
Combine all ingredients in small saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat; reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove ribs from grill and unwrap.
Place ribs over direct heat on grill and brush with honey red pepper glaze.
Cook for about 5 minutes until the glaze is set.
Turn ribs and repeat with more glaze.

3d317eada1.gt:
Prepare berry blue jello according to directions on box.
Pour into 13x9 baking dish and place in the refrigerator.
Allow to chill until firm, about 1 hour.
Prepare lemon flavored gelatin using 1 cup of boiling water.
Beat cream cheese slightly and then add the lemon gelatin mixture.
Beat gelatin and cream cheese until smooth.
Set aside and allow to cool to room temperature.
Once the cream cheese mixture has cooled, fold in the whipped topping until mixed thoroughly.
Pour this mixture over the firmly set bottom layer.
Return to the refrigerator and chill until firm, about 1 hour.
Prepare raspberry jello according to directions on box.
Cool this mixture until room temperature and then pour over the middle cream cheese layer.
Return the 3 layers to the refrigerator and chill until top layer is firm.
Cut into squares to serve.
Top with a little whipped topping and a couple of blueberries, if desired.
3d317eada1.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:
1. Combine the berry blue gelatin mix and lemon Jell-O gelatin in a large mixing bowl.
2. Add the cream cheese and whipped topping to the bowl.
3. Stir the mixture until well combined.
4. Add the raspberry Jell-O gelatin (or any other red jello) to the bowl and stir until the gelatin is fully incorporated.
5. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 4 hours or overnight, allowing the flavors to meld together.
6. Serve the dessert in individual bowls or cups, garnished with fresh raspberries if desired.

This recipe combines the flavors of the berry blue gelatin mix, lemon Jell-O, cream cheese, and whipped topping to create a delicious and visually appealing dessert. The addition of the raspberry Jell-O gelatin adds a pop of color and a touch of tartness to the dish.

e993bcfbe8.gt:
Wash the beans.
In a large pot, cover them with cold water.
Soak for 6-8 hours.
Drain into a colander.
In the same pot, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat, add the onion and garlic, and saute until soft.
Add the beans and water or stock.
Cover and bring to a boil over high heat.
Reduce heat to low, add the rosemary, and simmer 2 hours or until the beans are tender.
Raise heat to high, add the pasta, and cook until al dente.
Season the soup to taste with salt and pepper, garnish with the chopped parsey.
Serve accompanied by grated Parmesan cheese and the optional extra-virgin olive oil.
e993bcfbe8.pred:
1. In a large pot, combine the small dried white beans, extra virgin olive oil, and minced garlic. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
2. Add the chopped onion and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add 10 cups of water or vegetable stock, and bring the mixture to a boil.
4. Add the dried rosemary, and cook for another 5 minutes.
5. Add the small shell pasta (orzo or small shells), and cook until the pasta is al dente.
6. Season the pasta with salt and black pepper, to taste.
7. Serve the pasta with a drizzle of extra virgin olive oil, and a sprinkle of fresh parsley and chopped parmesan cheese, if desired.

[/INST]

4eef71a937.gt:
Pare and cut eggplant into 1/2 inch slices.
Set oven control at broil and/or 550 degrees.
Place eggplant slices on rack in broiler pan.
Brush butter on slices; season with salt and pepper.
Broil with tops about 3 inches from heat until eggplant is hot and tender.
about 6 minutes.
In a small saucepan, heat tomato sauce and garlic powder, stirring occasionally.
Serve on eggplant slices.
4eef71a937.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Cut the eggplant into 1-inch (2.5 cm) cubes.
3. In a large bowl, mix the eggplant cubes with the butter or margarine, tomato sauce, garlic powder, pepper, and salt.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the eggplant is tender and cooked through.
5. Serve the baked eggplant on a plate, and enjoy your delicious dish!

[/SYS]

87047dd9ed.gt:
Butter an 8x8 inch (20cmx20cm) pan or line it with parchment paper leaving a 2-inch/5 cm paper overhang on two sides.
In a bowl, mix together the crushed cookie crumbs, melted butter and sugar.
Transfer to the pan and press it down lightly and evenly with your fingers to cover the entire bottom of the dish.
Refrigerate until ready to use.
In a large microwave safe bowl combine condensed milk, butter and salt.
Microwave on high for 3 minutes.
Remove bowl from the microwave.
It will be very bubbly.
Add the chocolate chips or chopped chocolate.
Stir well until all the chocolate is melted and the mixture is really smooth.
Add the lemon curd, lemon juice, lemon extract and lemon zest.
Mix one more time.
Pour the lemon mixture on top of the cookie crust and spread evenly to the edges of the prepared pan.
Smooth the top.
Sprinkle marshmallows on top and press lightly to make sure it will stick to the bars.
Refrigerate or freeze until completely set.
Using the parchment paper overhangs, lift bars from pan and transfer to a cutting board.
Use a kitchen torch to lightly brown the marshmallows if you want to and then cut into 25 squares.
Eat them all or try not to!
87047dd9ed.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a medium-sized bowl, mix the melted butter, light brown sugar, and salt.
3. Add the crushed graham crackers to the mixture, and mix well.
4. Press the mixture onto the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch springform pan.
5. Bake the crust for 10-12 minutes, or until it is set and lightly golden.
6. Remove the crust from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth.
8. Add the melted butter, white chocolate chips, lemon curd, lemon juice, lemon extract, and lemon zest. Mix until well combined.
9. Spread the filling evenly over the cooled crust.
10. Sprinkle the mini marshmallows evenly over the filling.
11. Bake the cheesecake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly wobbly.
12. Remove the cheesecake from the oven, and let it cool for about 15-20 minutes.
13. Refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours, or overnight, before serving.

Enjoy your delicious graham cracker crust cheesecake with marshmallows!

5af1409bc9.gt:
Pick over the lentils, discarding any misshapen lentils or stones.
Rinse the lentils until the water runs clear, then drain.
In a saucepan over high heat, combine the lentils, water, turmeric and the 1 teaspoon ghee.
Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.
Reduce the heat to medium, cover and simmer until the lentils are soft and tender, about 30 minutes.
In a frying pan over medium-high heat, warm the remaining 2 tablespoons ghee.
When hot, add the mustard seeds and fry until they turn gray, spatter, and pop, about 2 minutes.
Add the chillies, onion, garlic, ginger and curry leaves and saute until the onion is soft and golden, about 5 minutes.
Stir in the garam masala and tomatoes ad cook for 1 minute.
Pour the onion mixture into the pan of cooked lentils, add the salt and simmer for 5 minutes to blend the flavours.
Transfer to a serving dish and serve.

6ac54b5e92.gt:
Cream butter and sugar.
Add egg and beat well.
Combine buttermilk and soda.
Combine flour and spices.
Add alternately with buttermilk, beginning and ending with flour.
Stir in apple butter and pecans.
Pour into greased and floured 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
Bake at 350*F for 1 hour or until wooden pick inserted comes out clean.
Cool in pan for 5 minutes; remove to wire rack and cool completely.
6ac54b5e92.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the softened butter or margarine, brown sugar, and egg. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the buttermilk, baking soda, flour, apple butter, cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, clove, and pecans to the bowl. Mix until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
5. Bake the cake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
6. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then remove it from the pan and let it cool completely on a wire rack.

Enjoy your delicious apple cake!

c833711642.gt:
Season chops with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet, brown pork chops in olive oil.
In a small bowl, combine the cider, brown sugar, vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, mustard, and ginger.
Pour over the chops.
Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat medium or medium low heat; cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until tender.
c833711642.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the pork chops with salt and pepper, then coat them with olive oil.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the pork chops and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
4. Remove the pork chops from the skillet and place them on a baking sheet.
5. In the same skillet, add the apple cider (or juice), light brown sugar, cider vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger. Cook until the liquid has reduced by half, about 5-7 minutes.
6. Return the pork chops to the skillet and toss them in the sauce until they are coated evenly.
7. Transfer the pork chops to the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
8. Remove the pork chops from the oven and let them rest for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

1666f024c2.gt:
Toss pasta with mixed vegetables, chickpeas, artichokes, onions, parsley and olives in large bowl.
Whisk pasta sauce with oil, vinegar, mustard and garlic until blended.
Add to pasta mixture; toss until evenly coated.
Refrigerate 1 hour.
Spoon pasta mixture onto large platter; surround with tomatoes, cheese and salami.
1666f024c2.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked farfalle, mixed vegetables, chickpeas, artichoke hearts, green onions, and parsley.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together the Classico di Napoli Tomato & Basil Pasta Sauce, extra virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, Dijon mustard, garlic, and salt and pepper to taste.
4. Pour the sauce mixture over the pasta mixture and toss to combine.
5. Transfer the pasta mixture to a large baking dish.
6. Top the pasta with the sliced black olives, provolone cheese, and salami.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve the dish hot and enjoy!

[/SYS]

273d93a669.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Mix crushed cookies, butter,pecans, and coconut; press firmly onto bottom of 13x9-inch baking pan.
Refrigerate while preparing filling.
Beat cream cheese and sugar in a large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended.
Add eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed after each addition just until blended.
Pour over crust.
Bake 40 minutes or until center is almost set.Cool.
Refrigerate 3 hours or overnight.
Place whipping cream and chocolate in saucepan.
Cook on low heat until chocolate is completely melted and mixture is well blended, stirring occasionally.
Pour over cheesecake.
Refrigerate 15 minutes or until chocolate is firm.
Store leftover cheesecake in refrigerate.
Note: To make cheesecake extra special, Once chocolate topping is firm, place 2 additional chocolate squares in microwaveable bowl.
Microwave on medium 1 minute, stirring after 30 seconds.
Stir till chocolate is completely melted.Pour into small reusable bag; seal bag; twist bag.
Snip off one small corner from bottom of bag; twist top of bag to squeeze chocolate from bag; to pipe a special message, such as "Greetings" on top of cheesecake.
Chill time includes.
273d93a669.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the softened cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
3. Add the melted butter, one cup at a time, mixing well after each addition.
4. Add the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
5. Add the whipping cream, and mix until smooth.
6. Add the chopped pecans, flaked coconut, and crushed Oreo cookies to the mixture, stirring to combine.
7. Spread the mixture evenly into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
8. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly jiggly.
9. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before cutting it into squares.
10. Transfer the cake to a wire rack to cool completely.

[/INST]

This recipe card provides clear instructions for making a delicious dessert using the ingredients provided in the image. The dessert is a layered cake that combines the flavors of Oreo cookies, pecans, coconut, cream cheese, and chocolate. The cake is baked until set and slightly jiggly in the center, and it is then allowed to cool before being cut into squares. This dessert is perfect for sharing with friends and family, and it can be enjoyed as a sweet treat or as a part of a larger gathering.

3ffc1f8ead.gt:
Follow instructions on pizza crust package
After flattening the mix on round cookie sheet, add the pasta sauce in circular motions starting from middle with spoon (leaving 2 inches on the outer ring for crust)
Add the cheese evenly across sauce
Add the pepperoni
Cook for 10-14 minutes or until crust is golden brown
3ffc1f8ead.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the pasta sauce, mozzarella cheese, and Italian seasoning. Mix well.
3. Spread the pasta sauce mixture evenly over the pizza crust mix, leaving a small border around the edges.
4. Add sliced pepperoni on top of the pasta sauce mixture.
5. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
6. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

9c55f0ed34.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Toss first 4 ingredients in large baking dish.
Mix remaining ingredients; pour over vegetables.
Bake 50 min.
or until vegetables are tender.
9c55f0ed34.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the sweet potato wedges, parsnips, and fennel slices with the KRAFT Classic CATALINA Dressing.
3. Spread the vegetables out on a baking sheet, making sure they are evenly distributed.
4. Roast the vegetables in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
5. While the vegetables are roasting, combine the cranberry juice and maple-flavored or pancake syrup in a small bowl.
6. Once the vegetables are cooked, remove them from the oven and pour the cranberry-maple syrup mixture over them.
7. Toss the vegetables to coat them evenly with the sauce.
8. Serve the roasted vegetables immediately, and enjoy your delicious culinary masterpiece!

[/INST]

00707f2955.gt:
Fry bacon.
Remove bacon from pan; add butter.
Add flour; purists say don't brown flour but I do because I don't like a raw flour taste, and I cook on high (sigh).
Add milk.
Season with salt and pepper.
Cook until thickened.
Add cheese.
crumble up bacon and add here.
00707f2955.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove the bacon from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture turns golden brown.
4. Gradually add the milk, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
5. Add the salt, pepper, and the cooked bacon to the skillet. Stir to combine.
6. If using cheddar cheese, add it to the skillet and stir until melted. If using another milder cheese, add it to the skillet and stir until melted.
7. If using Swiss cheese, add it to the skillet and stir until melted.
8. If using Parmesan cheese, add it to the skillet and stir until melted.
9. Cook the mixture over medium heat for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth and creamy.
10. Serve the dish immediately over cooked pasta or rice.

[/INST]

bd4aa24126.gt:
Marinate steaks in marinade for 2 hours.
Saute steaks in butter; remove from pan when cooked to doneness you like.
Add mushrooms to pan.
Add peppercorns.
Add brandy OFF stove.
Deglaze pan, scraping browned bits off bottom of pan.
Don't ignite; fire scares me.
Add cream.
Reduce; pour over steaks.
bd4aa24126.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the melted butter over medium heat. Add the sliced beef and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add the minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the scotch whiskey and cook until it has reduced by half.
4. Add the mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they are tender and slightly caramelized, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Add the thyme, crushed peppercorn, and Worcestershire sauce to the skillet and stir to combine.
6. Add the beef back to the skillet and stir to combine with the mushroom mixture.
7. Pour the cream over the beef and mushroom mixture and stir to combine.
8. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the beef is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
10. Serve the dish immediately and enjoy!

[/INST]

024ad1d04e.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
In a large bowl, whisk all dry ingredients together to combine.
Form a well in the middle of the dry ingredients.
Measure and pour the remaining wet ingredients into the well.
Slowly and gently mix the wet into the dry until just combined.
Scoop into 12 greased or paper-lined muffin tins.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted.
024ad1d04e.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ground cloves, nutmeg, and brown sugar.
3. Add the canola oil, unsweetened applesauce, and grated carrot to the dry ingredients. Mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and add them to the dry ingredients. Mix until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x9 inch (23x23 cm) baking dish.
6. Bake the cake for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool for a few minutes before removing it from the baking dish and transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious mystery dish!

77f61a5608.gt:
Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Position a rack in the upper third of the oven.
In a small bowl, combine the hoisin, soy sauce, wine, honey and garlic.
Line a baking sheet with foil and spray it lightly with cooking spray; set aside.
Place the salmon fillets on the baking sheet, and spoon the sauce over the fillets, trying to keep as much on each fillet as possible.
Bake for 15 to 18 minutes, depending on the thickness of your fillets, until just cooked through.
*Note: If you want extra sauce for after the fish is done baking (because the sauce in the oven sort of caramelizes), then I recommend doubling the sauce and reserving half of it for pouring over the fish after it is done baking.
Just be sure NOT to touch any utensils that touched the raw fish into the reserved sauce.
77f61a5608.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a small bowl, mix the hoisin sauce, low sodium soy sauce, dry white wine, and honey. Set aside.

2. In a large bowl, mix the minced garlic, and set aside.

3. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).

4. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.

5. Heat a large skillet or oven-safe pan over medium-high heat. Add a small amount of oil and cook the salmon fillets until they are cooked through, about 4-5 minutes per side.

6. Remove the salmon fillets from the pan and place them on a baking sheet.

7. Pour the sauce mixture over the salmon fillets, making sure to coat them evenly.

8. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.

9. Remove the salmon from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

10. Enjoy your delicious salmon with hoisin sauce and garlic butter.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
Please note that the image may not be the exact dish you will be preparing, but it serves as a guide for the ingredients and cooking process. Feel free to adjust the seasoning and cooking time based on your preferences and the specific ingredients you have available.

62ef1c9c06.gt:
Cook the pearl barley according to package directions.
For me, it took about 40 minutes and I used water.
When barley is tender and liquid absorbed, remove from heat and set aside.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
In a medium pan over medium heat, add the olive oil, zucchini, onion, mushroom and squash.
Season with sea salt and pepper to taste.
Cook the vegetables until lightly browned.
Add the cooked barley and cook until barley begins to brown.
Stir in the basil and oregano; add more sea salt and pepper if desired.
Gently spoon the mixture into a casserole dish.
Crack the eggs over the barley mixture and make sure not to break the yolk.
Feel free to add more eggs if you wish!
Bake for 15 minutes or until eggs are set.
Enjoy its flavor and enjoy how good and good for you it is!
62ef1c9c06.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the Extra Virgin Olive Oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and become tender, about 5 minutes more.
4. Add the sliced summer squash and cook until it starts to become tender, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the uncooked pearl barley to the skillet, stirring to combine with the vegetables.
6. Pour in the cup of water and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let it simmer for about 25-30 minutes, or until the pearl barley is tender and the liquid has been absorbed.
7. While the pearl barley is cooking, whisk the eggs in a separate bowl.
8. Once the pearl barley is cooked, remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the whisked eggs.
9. Season the dish with salt and pepper, to taste.
10. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the eggs are set and the dish is hot and bubbly.
11. Serve the cooked dish immediately.

Enjoy your delicious mystery dish!

a2b2813b98.gt:
Heat the olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium high heat.
Saute the onions, carrots and celery until they are softened and light golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Stir in the garlic for about 30 seconds, and then add in the ham and saute for a few minutes.
Pour in the chicken stock, beans and spices, stirring well and scraping up the browned bits off the bottom of the pot.
Before you add any salt, taste the broththe beans/ham/stock can be quite salty as it is!
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 2 hours or longer.
Remove the bay leaf and serve with lots of crusty bread!
a2b2813b98.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the chopped carrots and celery, and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
5. Add the diced ham and cook until it is browned and the flavors have melded together.
6. Add the chicken stock, beans, cumin, chipotle chili powder, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the beans are tender.
8. Remove the bay leaf and serve the soup hot.

[/INST]

f2251c8a98.gt:
Mix together ground pork, kosher salt, black pepper, sage, thyme, rosemary, nutmeg, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes in a bowl.
Knead with hands until thoroughly incorporated.
Form into 8 patties.
Place patties into a skillet over medium heat; cook until browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
Flip patties and continue to cook until fully cooked through, 5 to 8 more minutes.
f2251c8a98.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground pork, kosher salt, black pepper, sage, thyme, rosemary, nutmeg, cayenne pepper, and red pepper flakes. Mix well to combine all ingredients.
3. Shape the pork mixture into small meatballs, about 1-inch in diameter.
4. Place the meatballs on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
5. Bake the meatballs in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are cooked through and have a nice golden-brown color.
6. Serve the meatballs with a side of your choice, such as a simple pasta, a salad, or a side of your favorite vegetables. Enjoy your delicious and appetizing meal!

6fe5e21aec.gt:
Preheat oven to 425 F.
Wrap potatoes in aluminum foil.
Bake potatoes on a pan in the oven until done, about an hour.
Remove foil and let potatoes cool to room temperature.
Put potatoes on a plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate overnight.
Grate the chilled potatoes, including skins.
You can use a large box grater or a food processor.
(I like the food processor!)
Transfer grated potatoes to a bowl and sprinkle in the shallots, 1 3/4 cup cheese, salt, and pepper.
Use your hands to gently toss together.
(I guess you could stir it too but you would miss all the fun.
Go ahead, plunge those hands down in there!)
Then fold in sour cream.
Transfer mixture to a 1 1/2 quart gratin dish, making sure that you dont compress (or squash, or moosh, or squish) it!
Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top.
Bake at 350 F until the top is golden brown, about 30 minutes.
Serves 6.
Recipe slightly adapted from williams-sonoma.com via Strip House.
6fe5e21aec.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash the potatoes thoroughly and pat them dry.
3. Cut the potatoes into evenly sized pieces, making sure to keep the skin on.
4. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes with the minced shallots, 2-1/2 cups of the grated cheddar cheese, and the kosher salt and pepper.
5. Spread the potato mixture evenly on a baking sheet, making sure not to overcrowd the pan.

7. Bake the potatoes in the preheated oven for 45-55 minutes, or until they are tender and golden brown.
8. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the potatoes rest for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade potato gratin!

1788cb51c4.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Place squash, cut sides down, in a 9x13 baking dish.
Pour water into dish around squash halves.
Bake in the preheated oven until tender and easily pierced with a fork, about 1 1/2 hours.
Carefully remove the skin with a fork; it should be very easy to remove.
Top squash halves with butter and season with salt and pepper to taste.
1788cb51c4.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, toss the butternut squash with 1 tablespoon of butter, salt, and ground black pepper.
3. Spread the squash in a single layer on a baking sheet, and roast in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the squash is tender and slightly caramelized.
4. Remove the squash from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes.

6. When the squash is cool enough to handle, use a fork to scrape out the flesh into a bowl.
7. Add the remaining butter to the bowl with the squash, and stir to combine.
8. Season the squash mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve the roasted butternut squash and its sauce over a bed of rice or pasta.

4efef5709b.gt:
Preheat a heavy bottomed skille tover medium-high heat.
Pour in the oil and add the zucchini and jalapeno, sprinkle with the salt.
Saute for about 7 minutes, or until the zucchini is lightly browned.
Add the garlic, olives, cumin, and coriander, and saute for 2 minutes more.
Add the salsa verde and black beans and cook for 5 minutes.
The salsa should reduce a bit so its not soupy.
Mix the ingredients for the Garlic-Lemon Yogurt if your using.
Warm the tortillas in a skillet or wrap in a moist towel & nuke for a minute.
Assembly the tacos by adding the filling, yogurt, and topping with scallions.
Enjoy!
4efef5709b.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the diced zucchini, minced garlic, salt, and ground cumin.
3. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until the zucchini is tender and slightly browned.
4. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced jalapenos and cook for a few minutes, until they are softened but not browned.
5. Add the chopped pitted kalamata olives and cook for a few more minutes, until they are heated through.
6. In a small bowl, mix the salsa verde, black beans, and lemon juice.
7. In a large bowl, mix the chopped scallion, unsweetened plain soy yogurt, and lemon zest.
8. To assemble the dish, place the roasted zucchini on a plate and spoon the salsa verde mixture over it.
9. Serve the dish with the corn tortillas on the side, and enjoy your delicious and healthy meal.

62880ae3e8.gt:
Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with salted water.
Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain and allow to steam dry for a minute or two.
Return the drained potatoes to the pot.
Pour the vegetable broth, thyme, rosemary, oregano, basil, onion powder, parsley, sage, and garlic over the potatoes; mash with a potato masher.
62880ae3e8.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the peeled and cut potatoes, vegetable broth, dried thyme, rosemary, oregano, basil, onion powder, parsley, sage, and minced garlic. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
3. Carefully transfer the pot with the cooked potatoes to a baking dish.
4. Drizzle some olive oil over the potatoes, then sprinkle the dried sage evenly over the top.
5. Bake the potatoes in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sage is crispy and the potatoes are golden brown.
6. Serve the cooked potatoes immediately, and enjoy your delicious mystery dish!

[/INST]

0e47e93343.gt:
Place pork in a wide nonstick frying pan.
Drain about 1/2 cup liquid from tomatoes into pan.
Bring to a boil over high heat; then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Uncover pan; add onions, celery, oregano, and sage.
Cook over high heat, stirring often, until liquid has evaporated and drippings are browned (8 to 10 minutes).
Add bay leaves.
Cut up tomatoes then add tomatoes and their remaining liquid and stir to scrape browned bits free.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 30 more minutes.
Stir in bell pepper and chilies; cover and continue to cook stirring occasionally until pork is very tender when pierced (about 15 more minutes).
If chili is too thin, uncover and simmer until it's as thick as you like.
Skim and discard fat, if necessary.
To serve, spoon chili over rice and garnish with cilantro sprigs.
0e47e93343.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F (163°C).
2. In a large, oven-safe skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of oil over medium heat. Add the pork and cook until browned, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the pork from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of oil and cook the onions until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the celery and cook for another 3-4 minutes, until softened.
5. Add the oregano, sage, bay leaves, and green bell pepper to the skillet. Cook for another 3-4 minutes, until the vegetables are tender.
6. Add the cooked rice to the skillet and stir to combine.
7. Add the tomatoes, chilies, and cooked pork to the skillet. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
8. Cover the skillet with a lid and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked through and the pork is tender.
9. Remove the skillet from the oven and let it sit for a few minutes.
10. Serve the dish hot, garnished with fresh cilantro stems.

[/INST]

fa63e5df5b.gt:
Preheat the oven to 425.
Season the chicken breast with 1/8 teaspoon each of sea salt and freshly ground pepper.
In a small pan, heat 1 tablespoon of extra-virgin olive oil over medium high heat.
Add the chicken and cook for 1 minute.
Turn the chicken, reduce the heat, cover and cook for 8 minutes.
Remove the pan from the heat and leave covered for 10 minutes, then shred the chicken with 2 forks.
In a medium bowl, combine the cream cheese, water, soy sauce, garlic and the remaining sea salt and freshly ground pepper and whisk to combine.
In an 8-inch-square baking dish, combine the shredded chicken, onion, egg noodles, the cheese, broccoli and the sauce and mix thoroughly.
Cover the dish with aluminum foil and bake for 10 minutes.
Uncover the dish, stir well and bake for 15 minutes, until the noodles are cooked and the sauce has thickened.
Remove from the oven and let sit for 5 minutes before serving.
fa63e5df5b.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Season the chicken breast with sea salt and pepper.
3. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chicken breast and cook until browned on both sides and cooked through, about 5-7 minutes.
4. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
5. In the same skillet, add the cream cheese and cook until melted and smooth.
6. Add the water, soy sauce, and minced garlic to the skillet. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 5 minutes.
7. Add the cooked chicken back to the skillet and stir to combine.
8. In a separate saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the dry egg noodles and cook according to the package instructions until al dente.
9. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked noodles with the chicken and cream cheese mixture.
10. In a separate bowl, combine the grated cheddar cheese and broccoli florets.
11. Add the chicken and cream cheese mixture to the bowl with the cheese and broccoli. Stir to combine.
12. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
13. Serve the meal immediately and enjoy!

917795ebdc.gt:
These are the ingredients.
Chop the chicken into large bite-sized pieces, then season with Magic Salt (or salt and pepper).
Heat olive oil in a frying pan, saute garlic until aromatic, then fry both sides of the chicken, starting with the skin side down.
Once both sides of the chicken are golden brown, add the mushrooms and lightly saute.
Pour in the white wine (or sake), steam-cook for 10 to 15 minutes.
Taste once the broth boils down, and season to taste, add butter, stir until its coated evenly over the chicken and mushrooms, then it's ready to serve.
Garnish with minced green onions or parsley.
917795ebdc.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. Season the chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and any additional seasoning of your choice.
3. In a large skillet or oven-safe pan, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
4. Add the mixed mushrooms and cook until they are tender and slightly browned, about 5 minutes.
5. Add the chicken thighs to the skillet and cook until they are cooked through and the juices run clear, about 10 to 15 minutes.
6. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
7. In a small bowl, mix the salt, pepper, and any additional seasoning of your choice.
8. Return the skillet to the heat and add the white wine or sake. Bring to a simmer and cook until the liquid has reduced by half, about 3 to 4 minutes.
9. Add the butter to the skillet and stir until it has melted and the sauce has thickened slightly.
10. Add the chicken back to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
11. Transfer the chicken and sauce to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 10 to 15 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
12. Serve the chicken and sauce over rice or noodles, and enjoy your delicious homemade chicken and mushroom dish.

[/INST]

6ea1219c93.gt:
Chop the sweet potato into small cubes, and soak in water to remove the bitterness.
Transfer to a heatproof dish, wrap in plastic wrap, and microwave (for 2 to 3 minutes at 500W).
Heat water and sugar in a sauce pan, and add the sweet potatoes once the sugar dissolves.
Simmer until the liquid boils out.
Bring the eggs to room temperature.
Sift together the almond powder, cake flour, cinnamon, and baking powder.
Microwave or double boil the butter to melt.
Beat the egg in a bowl, add the brown sugar and honey, and mix well.
There's no need to beat until foamy.
Sift in the dry ingredients, stir until smooth, then add the rum.
Mix in the melted butter, a little at a time, then add about half of the boiled sweet potatoes and lightly mix.
Pour into small baking cups, top with the remaining sweet potatoes, and sprinkle black sesame seeds.
Bake for about 20 minutes in an oven at 170C.
6ea1219c93.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the sweet potato, water, sugar, eggs, brown sugar, honey, and butter. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the almond flour, cake flour, cinnamon, baking powder, and rum.
4. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, stirring until well combined.
5. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
6. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
7. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
8. Before serving, sprinkle the black sesame seeds on top of the cake.

Enjoy your delicious mystery dish!

8367b4bf0f.gt:
Cook the onion in a pan with a small bit of butter until soft.
Stir in the flour to create almost a roux for a minute or so.
Stir in the milk, a little at a time, and then bring up to boiling point.
Add the remaining ingredients and wait until the cheese has hit melting point.
Taste and season accordingly, serve warm with bread.
(I only need to add pepper).
8367b4bf0f.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped onion, cheddar cheese, mustard, and milk.
3. Add the flour to the mixture and stir until well combined.
4. Gradually add the butter to the mixture, stirring until the butter is fully incorporated.
5. Pour the mixture into a greased baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the dish is bubbly and the cheese is melted and slightly browned.
6. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy!

[/SYS]

9181bac2c8.gt:
Place the onion, parsley, vinegar, mustard, mayonnaise, honey, salt, pepper, and lime zest in the bowl of a small food processor or blender.
Process until thoroughly blended.
Serve immediately, or place in a covered container and refrigerate until needed.

2878092da0.gt:
Combine all dry ingredients with a whisk.
In a separate bowl whisk all wet ingredients together.
Combine wet ingredients into dry by using a wooden spoon or spatula.
Batter needs to be very thick and lumpy -- This is correct.
Make sure that you either use a griddle set at 350 degrees or a cast iron skillet over medium heat.

).
Using a 1/3 cup pour batter onto griddle using a swirling motion to flatten out.
When the batter starts to bubble, flip the pancake.
To keep warm we store them in a tortilla warmer.
For left overs they can be frozen, just place wax paper in between cakes and freeze in a zip lock.
When you want one just pull out and microwave.

3fff1d1389.gt:
Preheat oven to 375.
Cut a 2-inch pocket in the thickest part of each chicken breast.
In a small bowl combine the Feta and the chopped olives, then stuff 1/2 of mixture into each pocket.
In a nonstick skillet, heat 2 Tbs.
olive oil on medium to high heat.
Season the chicken with pepper and add it to the skillet, cooking 2 minutes on each side or until brown.
Transfer to an oven safe baking dish, drizzled with 1 Tbs.
olive oil and bake for 18 minutes.
In a bowl mix tomato, kosher salt, onion, garlic, basil and parley.
When chicken is 5 minutes from being finished, put the remaining olive oil in the skillet, add tomato mix and heat through.
Serve chicken with tomato mix on top.
3fff1d1389.pred:

2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
3. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and garlic, and cook until softened.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook for a few minutes until they start to release their juices.
5. Add the crumbled herbed feta cheese, and cook until the cheese is melted and the sauce is slightly thickened.
6. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then transfer them to a baking dish.
7. Pour the tomato-feta sauce over the chicken breasts, and bake for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and slightly caramelized.
8. Serve the chicken and sauce over a bed of cooked pasta or rice.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy meal!

3d81546407.gt:
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
Pour in gin, lemon juice, lime juice, simple syrup, and dash of bitters.
Cover and shake rapidly.
Strain into a highball glass full of ice.
Pour in lemon and lime spritzer and stir.
Garnish with the lime slice.
Unleash the monkey.

To prepare the appetizing meal shown in the photo, follow these steps:

2. Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
3. Garnish the drink with a lime slice.
4. Enjoy your refreshing and delicious cocktail.

The photo features a cocktail with a gin base, lemon and lime juices, simple syrup, and bitters. To recreate this appetizing meal, follow the provided instructions and use the ingredients as indicated. The result will be a refreshing and delicious cocktail that can be enjoyed during a meal or as a standalone drink.

caf3797f1b.gt:
Preheat oven to 350F.
Butter and flour 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Combine flour, sugar, ground ginger, baking powder, cinnamon, 3/4 teaspoon salt, nutmeg, allspice, and cloves in large bowl; whisk to combine.
Whisk eggs, oil, milk, and 1 teaspoon vanilla in medium bowl to combine.
Pour egg mixture over dry ingredients; stir until just combined.
Stir in parsnips and walnuts.
Transfer batter to prepared pan.
Bake until tester inserted into center comes out clean, about 25 minutes.
Cool cake completely in pan on rack.
Beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl until smooth.
Beat in fresh ginger and remaining 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla.
Gradually add powdered sugar and beat until frosting is smooth.
Spread over cake.
(Can be prepared 1 day ahead.
Cover and chill.)
caf3797f1b.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, ginger, baking powder, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg, allspice, and cloves.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, oil, milk, and vanilla extract.
4. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined.
5. Fold in the shredded parsnips and toasted walnuts.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23cm) round cake pan.
7. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. Once the cake is cooled, use a serrated knife to slice it into wedges.
10. To make the frosting, beat the cream cheese and butter in a large mixing bowl until smooth.
11. Gradually add the powdered sugar, beating until the desired consistency is reached.
12. Spread the frosting over the cooled cake slices.
13. Garnish with grated peeled fresh ginger, if desired.

Enjoy your delicious cake!

7384993dda.gt:
Mix gin, rum, vodka, tequila, triple sec, Midori, blue curacao and sour mix together.
Shake well and pour into Hurricane glass.
Then add a splash of 7-up to the top and serve.
7384993dda.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. In a shaker, combine the gin, rum, vodka, tequila, triple sec, Midori melon liqueur, and blue curacao.
2. Fill the shaker with ice, and shake vigorously for about 15-20 seconds.
3. Strain the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
4. Add the sour mix to the glass, and stir to combine.
5. Top the glass with 7-Up soda.
6. Garnish with a lemon or lime wedge, if desired.

This recipe creates a refreshing and colorful cocktail, perfect for a party or a relaxing evening. The combination of gin, rum, vodka, tequila, triple sec, Midori melon liqueur, and blue curacao provides a mix of flavors and textures, while the sour mix and 7-Up soda add a tangy and fizzy element to the drink. Enjoy!

bf6be1f473.gt:
Drain tuna.
Combine mayonnaise & pepper relish, stir into tuna.
Place spinach & diced onion in the bowl and top with tuna, shredded cheese & crumbled bacon.
bf6be1f473.pred:
To make the dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the drained canned tuna, mayonnaise, hot pepper relish, and shredded monterey jack pepper cheese. Mix well.
3. Add the baby spinach leaves and red onion to the bowl, and toss to combine.
4. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish, and spread it evenly.
5. Top the mixture with the crumbled bacon.
6. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
7. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy!

This cooking guide provides a simple and delicious recipe for the unidentified dish, using the provided ingredients. The dish combines the flavors of tuna, mayonnaise, hot pepper relish, monterey jack pepper cheese, baby spinach, red onion, and crispy bacon, creating a satisfying and appetizing meal.

fd78cf3ab6.gt:
Cut the tortillas into quarters.
In a large skillet, heat the oil and fry the tortilla pieces until crunchy.
Lower the heat to low.
Add the red chile sauce and mix gently through the tortilla pieces.
Top with the shredded cheese and cook until the cheese just starts to melt.
Remove from the heat and serve with your choice of eggs.
Garnish with chopped green and red onions.
For the sauce: Remove the stems, seeds and veins from the chile pods.
Rinse with cold water.
Add the chiles to a pot and add enough water just to cover them.
Bring to a boil and simmer covered for 20 minutes.
After 10 minutes turn the chiles over to cook evenly.
Drain and cool.
In a blender, mix 3 cups of water, half of the cooked chile pods, 3 Tablespoons flour, 2 cloves garlic and half the salt.
Blend until smooth.
Strain the sauce removing any seeds.
Repeat this process with the rest of the ingredients and set aside to cool.
Recipe from Muy Bueno Cook Book.
fd78cf3ab6.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the canola oil over medium heat. Add the chopped green onions and cook until they are softened, about 2 minutes.
3. Add the chopped red onions and cook for another 2 minutes.
4. In a small bowl, mix the red chile sauce, Colby cheese, and salt.
5. Place the tortillas in a single layer on a baking sheet.
6. Spread the red chile sauce mixture evenly over the tortillas.
7. Top each tortilla with a portion of the cheese mixture.
8. Bake the tortillas in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Carefully remove the tortillas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes.
10. Carefully slice the tortillas into wedges.
11. Serve the tortilla wedges with the red chile sauce for dipping.

[/INST]

9fd2cdfff6.gt:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Toast almonds in oven for 10 minutes or until brown.
Dissolve coffee in 2 tablespoons hot water.
In a separate small mixing bowl mix flour, baking soda and salt.
Beat butter and sugar in an electric mixer at a medium speed until fluffy.
Pour coffee, vanilla and eggs into the butter mixture; mix well.
Reduce mixer's speed to low and slowly pour flour mixture into the butter mixture.
Fold chocolate chips and almonds into the dough.
Drop dough by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet, 3 inches apart.
Bake for 10 minutes.
9fd2cdfff6.pred:
To make the chocolate almond cookies, preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large mixing bowl, combine the slivered almonds, instant coffee granules, hot water, and baking soda. Mix well. In a separate bowl, cream the softened butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla extract and eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture, mixing until well combined. Stir in the chocolate chips.

Using a cookie scoop or spoon, drop the dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges are lightly golden. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely. Enjoy your delicious chocolate almond cookies!

3a1d0d3143.gt:
chop bacon into small pieces and fry
unroll the cressant creations, apply a thin layer of ranch dressing
sprinkle the cooked bacon and cheese
tightly roll into a log and cut into half inch sections
bake in over at 350 for 15 minutes
enjoy!
!
3a1d0d3143.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the Pillsbury Cressant Creations, crumbled bacon, and grated cheddar cheese.
3. If using swiss cheese, add it to the mixture as well.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the ranch dressing.
5. Pour the ranch dressing over the Cressant Creations mixture, and toss to coat evenly.
6. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
7. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the Cressant Creations are golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Serve immediately, and enjoy your delicious bacon and cheese-filled Cressant Creations!

ec8f7992cb.gt:
Cover a large flat surface with waxed paper.
In a large bowl, stir together the popcorn, cereal, corn chips, almonds, and pretzels.
Melt the confectioners' coating in a glass bowl in the microwave for 1 minute.
Continue to cook at 30 second intervals, stirring between each one, until the coating is smooth.
Pour melted coating over the cereal mixture.
It's best to use a large metal spoon, and pour 1 or 2 spoonfuls at a time then mix to ensure even distribution.
(A second person can be useful here - one to pour, one to mix.)
Once everything is coated, spread the mixture out onto waxed paper in a thin layer.
Let stand for about 1/2 hour, or until coating is dry.
Transfer to a bowl to serve, or store in an airtight container.
ec8f7992cb.pred:
To make this dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the popped microwave popcorn, corn cereal puffs, and corn chips.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the blanched slivered almonds and thin pretzel sticks.
4. In a small bowl, mix the vanilla flavored confectioners' coating.
5. Pour the coating over the popcorn mixture, stirring to coat evenly.
6. Spread the mixture onto a baking sheet or a large, flat surface.
7. Bake the mixture in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the coating is melted and the mixture is evenly coated.
8. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes before serving.

This dish combines the crunchiness of the popcorn, corn cereal puffs, and corn chips with the sweetness of the vanilla coating and the crunchiness of the almonds and pretzel sticks. It is a delicious and unique snack or dessert that can be enjoyed by people of all ages.

dfbfe8732e.gt:
Mix water and sugar in a saucepan.
Bring water to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook, stirring regularly, until sugar is dissolved completely into a simple syrup, about 5 minutes.
Stir 6 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling, cinnamon sticks, nutmeg, ginger, cloves, vanilla extract, and pumpkin pie spice into the syrup.
Bring liquid again to a simmer and cook until the syrup is well-spiced, 8 to 10 minutes.
Strain the mixture through a sheet of cheesecloth.
Return liquid to the saucepan over low heat.
Stir sweetened condensed milk and remaining 2 tablespoons pumpkin pie filling into the spiced syrup and cook, stirring regularly, until the pumpkin dissolves into the liquid, about 5 minutes.
dfbfe8732e.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan, combine 1 1/2 cups water, 1 1/2 cups white sugar, and 1/2 cup pumpkin pie filling or to taste. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.

2. Add 4 cinnamon sticks, 4 teaspoons freshly grated nutmeg, 2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger, 2 teaspoons whole cloves, 2 teaspoons vanilla extract, and 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice to the saucepan. Stir to combine.

3. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and cooled slightly.

4. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in 1/4 cup sweetened condensed milk. Allow the mixture to cool for a few minutes.

5. Pour the mixture into individual serving dishes or a large serving dish. Refrigerate the dish for at least 2 hours or until the mixture has set.

6. Serve the dish chilled or at room temperature, garnished with a sprinkle of cinnamon or nutmeg if desired.

Enjoy your delicious pumpkin pie-flavored dessert!

68fd9e5935.gt:
In a large resealable bag, toss pork meat with the taco seasoning mix until coated.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
Fry the seasoned pork in the hot oil, stirring occasionally until pork is no longer pink.
Stir the beans, salsa and apricot preserves into the skillet with the pork.
Reduce heat to low, and simmer until heated through, about 10 minutes.
Spoon 1/3 cup of the pork mixture into each taco shell, and top with sliced olives.
68fd9e5935.pred:
1. In a large skillet or pan, cook the pork stew meat over medium heat until browned, about 5-7 minutes.
2. Add the taco seasoning mix and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the vegetable oil, salsa, and chili beans. Stir to combine.
4. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and let it cook for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the apricot preserves and continue cooking for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the pork is cooked through and the sauce has thickened slightly.
6. Serve the pork stew in the taco shells, topped with sliced ripe olives.

Enjoy your delicious homemade pork stew with taco seasoning and a touch of sweetness from the apricot preserves.

1873e358d7.gt:
Slice hard stem off the mushrooms and shred accordingly.
Rinse the ginger and mince or julienne.
Add the prepared ingredients (Step 1) into a small pan.
Also add water, and cover the pan to cook over medium heat.
After the mushrooms are slightly soft, add soy milk and curry powder.
Bring it to a boil.
*But don't boil it too much after adding soy milk!
Turn the heat down to low.
Dissolve the miso thoroughly to finish.
Sprinkle in some parley and cinnamon if you'd like.
1873e358d7.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a small saucepan, heat the water and bring it to a boil.
2. Add the shimeji mushrooms and ginger to the saucepan and cook for 5 minutes or until the mushrooms are tender.
3. Remove the mushrooms and ginger from the saucepan and set aside.
4. In a small bowl, mix the soy milk, curry powder, and miso.
5. Add the soy milk mixture to the saucepan and stir well.
6. Add the cooked mushrooms and ginger back to the saucepan and stir well.
7. If desired, add a pinch of cinnamon for extra flavor.
8. Serve the mushroom and soy milk mixture over rice or noodles, garnished with parsley.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy mushroom and soy milk dish!

55412fa6ca.gt:
Combine butter, sugar, corn syrup and spices in a saucepan.
Over low-medium heat, stir ingredients constantly until ingredients look like they are about to boil.
Remove from heat and transfer to a mixing bowl.
Allow sugar mixture to cool to room temperature.
Stirring occasionally might help speed up this process.
Stir eggs into cooled sugar mixture.
Sift flour and baking soda together and add to sugar mixture.
Mix well.
Roll dough into a ball.
Cover and chill in the refrigerator for 8-12 hours or overnight.
Split dough into 2 parts; Roll dough about 1/4-inch thick on a clean, floured surface.
Cut into desired shapes.
Bake in preheated oven at 350F for about 10-15 minutes, or until firm to the touch.
Cookies can be left plain, or decorated with pipped icing.
NOTE: This makes a crisp cookie, if a softer cookie is desired you may substitute brown sugar for the granulated sugar.
55412fa6ca.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Add the corn syrup, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, allspice, and orange zest. Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, baking soda, and flour.
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until well combined.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9x13 inch baking dish.
7. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes before transferring it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade cinnamon rolls!

7e8b44a915.gt:
Mix chicken, carrots, broth, ginger root, brown sugar, soy sauce, allspice and pepper sauce in a 4-5 quart crock pot, slow cooker Cover and cook on low heat setting 7-9 hours or until veggies are tender and chicken is no longer pink in centre.
Mix cornstarch and reserved pineapple juice, gradually stir into chicken mixture.
Stir in pineapple and bell pepper.
Cover and cook on high heat setting about 15 minutes longer or until slightly thickened and bubbly.
7e8b44a915.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a large saucepan or pot, combine the chicken broth, gingerroot, brown sugar, soy sauce, ground allspice, red pepper sauce, and cornstarch. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
2. Add the chicken pieces to the pot, and continue to cook until the chicken is fully cooked through and the sauce has thickened, about 10-15 minutes.
3. Remove the chicken from the pot, and set aside to cool slightly.
4. In a small bowl, mix the pineapple chunks and their juice.
5. In a large skillet or wok, heat some oil over medium-high heat. Add the red bell pepper, and cook until it is tender, about 5 minutes.
6. Add the pineapple mixture to the skillet, and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the pineapple is heated through.
7. Return the cooked chicken to the pot, and stir to combine with the sauce.
8. Serve the meal over rice or noodles, and enjoy!

[/INST]

72a1d68c4d.gt:
Slice the jalapenos longwise and carefully remove all the seeds and veins.set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix up the Cornbread batter according to the box instructions, add in the Corn and 1 cup of the Cheddar.
Fill each Jalapeno half with some batter!
Careful, dont over fill them!
Sprinkle them all with the remaining 1/2 cup of Cheddar.
Place them on a baking rack & sheet pan, bake them at 350 for about 15-20 minutes, or until the Cornbread is firm and cooked through.
They will be puffed and cheesy too!
Alternatively put the dough in mini muffin tin and then place a slice of jalapeno on top or sneak it in the middle and put more cheese on top.
This is a milder approach.
72a1d68c4d.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the jalapenos, cornbread mix, and shredded cheddar cheese.
3. Stir until well combined.
4. Fill greased muffin tins with the batter, dividing it evenly among the tins.
5. Bake the muffins for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of one of the muffins comes out clean.
6. Allow the muffins to cool for a few minutes before removing them from the tins.

8. Serve the muffins warm.

[/INST]

e91cf4e18b.gt:
Pour bean with bacon soup into a large saucepan and cook over medium-low heat until warmed through, 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir tomatoes, sausage, onion, mushrooms, and hot sauce into the soup.
Reduce heat to low and cook soup at a simmer, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes are breaking down, about 1 hour.
e91cf4e18b.pred:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large pot, combine the canned soup, sliced sausage, and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
3. Add the chopped red onion and mushrooms (if using). Cook for an additional 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
4. Season with hot pepper sauce (optional) to taste.
5. Transfer the soup mixture to a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until the soup is hot and bubbly.
7. Serve the soup immediately.

This recipe is a delicious and hearty meal that combines the flavors of the canned soup, sausage, and vegetables. The addition of hot pepper sauce (optional) adds a spicy kick to the dish, making it a perfect choice for those who enjoy a bit of heat in their meals.

5de42f87b0.gt:
Whisk garlic powder, salt, black pepper, oregano, and turmeric together in a bowl.
Store in an airtight container.

7. Serve the chicken with your choice of side dishes, such as rice, pasta, or a salad.

09fc954006.gt:
For dressing, blend everything in blender and slowly add 1/2 C oil.
Add celery seed.

fc76b776c7.gt:
Pre-heat oven to gas mark 2/300F/150C.
Prepare a baking tray lined with parchment paper.
First of all, beat the butter in a bowl with a wooden spoon to soften it.
Beat in the sugar, followed by the sifted flour and semolina.
Work the ingredients together with the spoon, pressing them to the side of the bowl, then finish off with your hands until you have a smooth mixture that doesn't leave any bits in the bowl.
Divide the mixture into 9, and shape each portion into a ball (dust the work surface with flour if you find the mixture too sticky to work with).
Flatten each one slightly and prick the centre with a fork (but not all the way through).
To make it look pretty, make a 1 cm crinkly border on the top by lightly pressing a fork making a slight indent working all the way around (working for the edge towards the centre).
Make sure that the biscuits are at least 1/2 inch in thickness (with the indentations at the edges).
Place onto the prepared baking sheet, very well spaced out as they will spread out quite a bit during baking.
Bake them for 50-60 minutes on the centre shelf of the oven (keep an eye on it after 45 mins - the edges seem to colour more easily than the top) it should have turned pale gold and feel firm in the centre.
Remove from the oven and dust the top with caster sugar.
Leave it to cool for 5 minutes on the baking tray before transferring them onto a wire rack to cool completely.
Store in an airtight container.
fc76b776c7.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 180°C (350°F).
2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
3. Gradually add the flour and semolina, mixing until the dough comes together.
4. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic.
5. Roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1.5 cm (0.6 inches).
6. Cut out the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
7. Place the shaped dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
8. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
9. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade cookies!

199261e80a.gt:

199261e80a.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

3. Add the eggs, coconut extract, and flour, mixing until well combined.

5. Pour the mixture into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.

bf025fd805.gt:
Break up the chocolate bars into small pieces with your hands and put in a heat resistant bowl.
Microwave for 3-4 minutes to melt.
Add the vegetable oil.
Put the eggs and sugar in a food processor, then process for 2 to 3 minutes on full strength.
Add the yogurt to Step 2 and blend for 2 minutes.
Pour the mixture from Step 3 into a rice cooker bowl, sift in the combined ingredients.
Fold in with a rubber spatula, while turning the bowl.
When the batter is no more floury, place in the rice cooker and turn the switch!
Press "Cook" 2-3 times and let the batter bake through a couple cycles until a bamboo skewer inserted into the middle comes out clean.
When it's done, remove the cake from the rice cooker bowl and cool on a cooling rack.
The cake comes right out of the bowl if you run a rubber spatula between the cake and bowl to loosen it.
You can eat it straight a way, but it tastes even better the next day.
It's also delicious decorated!
bf025fd805.pred:
[/SYS]

Mix all together.
Pour into 8 X 8 baking dish.
Lay bacon across the top.
Bake at 350* until bacon is brown and beans are bubbly.

This recipe is a delicious and hearty meal that can be enjoyed by people of all ages. The combination of pork and beans, onions, green peppers, and bacon creates a flavorful and satisfying dish that is perfect for a cozy night in or a family gathering.

3986074ac9.gt:
In a large bowl, mix together cottage cheese, caraway seed, sugar, monosodium glutamate (MSG), white pepper, chives and celery salt.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat, about 6 min.

Combine cheese and salsa over low heat until melted.
Stir in sour cream.
Pour over split hot baked potatoes.

c5f32e3595.gt:

Combine gin, jam, fennel syrup, lemon juice and bitters in a shaker with ice, and shake.

Top with the soda, and serve.

To recreate the culinary masterpiece, follow these instructions:

1. In a mixing glass, combine 2 ounces of DH Krahn gin, 1 teaspoon of apricot jam, 3/4 ounce of fennel syrup, and 3/4 ounce of freshly squeezed lemon juice.

3. Fill the mixing glass with ice.
4. Stir the ingredients until well-chilled.
5. Pour the mixture into a glass filled with ice.
6. Top the glass with club soda.
7. Stir the ingredients again.

This recipe is a delicious and visually appealing cocktail that combines the flavors of fennel, apricot, and lemon, with a touch of bitterness from the peach bitters. The combination of these ingredients results in a refreshing and delightful drink that can be enjoyed at any social gathering or special occasion.

12. Serve the dish over rice or with bread.

Enjoy your delicious shrimp curry!

7dc021d68f.gt:
Peel the potatoes and slice them really thin, dropping the slices into a bowl of cold water as you go along.
When they are all sliced, drain and pat dry.
Melt 2 tbls.
of the butter in a 10" nonstick skillet.
Swirl the butter to coat the surface; then remove the skillet from the heat.
Arrange 1/3 of the potato slices in a spiral, starting in the center and overlapping, so that the bottom of the skillet is covered.
Cut 2 tbls.
of the butter into small pieces and sprinkle them over the potatoes.
Then sprinkle the potatoes with 1/2 teaspoons of the rosemary,1/2 tsp of the parsley, 1/4 teaspoons of the thyme, and salt and pepper.
Repeat, making 2 more layers of potates, butter, and seasonings, pressing each layer down with a spatula.
Place the skillet over medium low heat, and cook until the bottom is crisp and golen brown, 45 minutes.
Then invert the galette onto a flat plate and slip it back into the skillet.
Continue cooking until the other side is golden, 10 to 15 minutes.
Invert the galette agaiin onto a serving platter.
Cut it into wedges and serve immediately.
Enjoy!
7dc021d68f.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Wash and peel the 4 Idaho potatoes, then cut them into even-sized pieces.
3. In a large mixing bowl, toss the potatoes with the 8 tablespoons of melted butter, ensuring they are evenly coated.
4. Add the chopped rosemary, Italian parsley, dried thyme, and fresh ground black pepper to the bowl, stirring to combine.
5. Season the potatoes with salt to taste.
6. Spread the potatoes evenly on a baking sheet, making sure not to overcrowd them.
7. Roast the potatoes in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until they are golden brown and tender.
8. Remove the potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade roasted potatoes!

255666c11a.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325F.
In a bowl, cover the chipotle with hot water and let stand until softened, 30 minutes.
Bake the halved apples cut side down on a rimmed baking sheet for 30 minutes, until tender.
Let cool.
Scoop the apple pulp into a food processor and discard the skins.
Stem, seed and chop the chipotle; add it to the food processor and puree.
Meanwhile, spread the bread in a pie plate and bake the pieces for about 10 minutes, until golden.
In a saucepan, boil the hard cider with the vinegar, sugar and apple puree.
Simmer, stirring, until reduced to 3/4 cup, 10 minutes.
Remove from the heat and season with salt.
Light a grill.
Grill the sausages over moderate heat, turning, until lightly charred on both sides and cooked through, 12 minutes.
Transfer to a plate and tent with foil.
In a skillet, heat the oil until shimmering.
Add the broccoli and season with salt.
Cover and cook until browned, 2 minutes.
Stir in the mustard, caraway, cider sauce and 1/2 cup of water and bring to a boil.
Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and season with salt.
Serve the sausages with the broccoli and sauce, garnishing with the bread crumbs and apple matchsticks.
255666c11a.pred:
As a chef, I would start by preheating the oven to 375°F (190°C). Next, I would prepare the dish by combining the dried chipotle chile, granny smith apples, and rye bread in a large mixing bowl. I would then add the Hard Cider, apple cider vinegar, light brown sugar, kosher salt, and the smoked pork sausages or cheddar wursts. Mix everything together until the bread is evenly coated with the liquid mixture.

To cook the dish, I would transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake it in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the sausages or wursts are cooked through.

While the dish is baking, I would prepare the broccoli florets by washing and trimming them. Once the dish is done, I would transfer the cooked broccoli to the baking dish and mix it with the sausages or wursts.

Finally, I would add the Dijon mustard and caraway seeds to the dish, and mix everything together. Lastly, I would transfer the dish to a serving platter and garnish it with the halved and cored apple cut into matchsticks for added texture and visual appeal.

This dish combines the flavors of smoked pork, apple, and rye bread, creating a delicious and hearty meal that can be enjoyed by everyone.

776b79b2b7.gt:
Toss the romaine lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and parsley together in a large bowl; season with salt.
Drizzle the lemon juice and olive oil over the salad; stir.
Add the sour cream and mix until evenly coated.
776b79b2b7.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce, sliced tomatoes, cucumber, and onion.
3. Add the chopped parsley, salt, lemon juice, and extra-virgin olive oil. Mix well.
4. Place the mixture in a large, oven-safe dish.
5. Cover the dish with foil and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the mixture is heated through.
6. Remove the foil and stir in the sour cream.
7. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the sour cream is melted and the mixture is heated through.
8. Serve the dish immediately.

[/INST]

25cf1f8952.gt:
Add the oil to the pan and put heat on to medium high.
Add the rice and saute until golden brown approximately 10 - 15 minutes.
Add the onion and bell pepper and saute another 5 - 10 minutes.
The important thing is to make sure the rice is toasted to a nice golden brown.
Using a garlic press, add the minced fresh garlic by squeezing the press and cutting off
the garlic as it comes out, with a knife.
Continue to saute for an additional 3 minutes.
You will notice a wonderful garlic aroma.
Add the tomato puree, chicken broth and salt.
Stir and turn heat up to high.
Bring to a full boil while stirring.
Continue to boil for 2 minutes.
Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 minutes.
When it's done, turn off the heat, remove the lid and stir in the peas.
wait 5 minutes before serving.
25cf1f8952.pred:
1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the canola oil over medium heat.
2. Add the yellow onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the bell pepper and cook for an additional 5 minutes, or until softened.
4. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute, or until fragrant.
5. Add the rice to the pot and stir to combine with the vegetables.
6. Pour in the tomato puree and stir to coat the rice evenly.
7. Add the sea salt, chicken broth, and peas to the pot. Stir to combine.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot.
9. Cook for about 20 minutes, or until the rice is tender and the liquid is absorbed.
10. Remove the pot from the heat and let it sit, covered, for an additional 5 minutes.
11. Fluff the rice with a fork and serve.

[/INST]

158484cb44.gt:
Heat oven to 350F.
Beat reduced-fat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended.
Add egg whites and cinnamon; mix well.
Gradually beat in milk.
Spread bread cubes onto bottom of 8-inch square baking dish; top with chocolate and cream cheese mixture.
Bake 30 to 35 min.
or until center is set.
Cool slightly.
158484cb44.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the 1/2 cup of PHILADELPHIA 1/3 Less Fat than Cream Cheese, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, and 2 egg whites. Mix until well combined.

159b22acbe.gt:
In 1 1/2- to 2-quart container with cover, mix all ingredients; cover tightly.
Store at room temperature.
Kitchen Tip:.
For cute gift bags, buy some small snack-sized bags and black pipe cleaners at the party or craft store.
Cut 5 pipe cleaners in half (makes ten 6-inch pieces).
Cut 14 pipe cleaners into 4-inch lengths (3-lengths per pipe cleaner).
To make each spider hold four 4-inch lengths together and twist a 6-inch length around the middle of the bundle to secure.
Bend 4-inch pieces to resemble spider legs.
Use 6-inch piece to seal gift bag.
Two 4-inch pieces will be left over.
159b22acbe.pred:
