2. In a large mixing bowl, cream the butter and dark cooking chocolate until smooth.
3. Add the brown sugar, sour cream, and bi-carbonate soda, mixing until well combined.
4. Add the almond meal, egg, and vanilla essence, and mix until the dough comes together.
5. If the dough is too dry, add a bit more sour cream. If it's too wet, add a bit more almond meal.
6. Roll the dough into small balls, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
7. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden around the edges.
8. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

b7d53a2696.gt:
Make the cookie base: Position a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 350 degrees F. Put the butter in a food processor, along with the flour, light brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.
Pulse until the mixture is well combined (about 20 pulses).
Scatter the dough into a 9x9-inch baking pan and press it evenly over the bottom.
(Wipe out the processor bowl but don’t bother washing it.)
Bake the base until firm and lightly browned, about 25 minutes.
When the cookie base comes out of the oven, sprinkle the grated chocolate evenly over the top.
(Don’t turn off the oven.)
Set the pan aside.
Make the pecan topping: As the cookie base bakes, pulse the pecans in the food processor until coarsely chopped.
In a medium-size heavy saucepan, melt the butter.
Stir in the dark brown sugar, honey, cream, and salt.
Simmer for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the pecans.
Pour the pecan mixture over the chocolate-sprinkled cookie base, spreading evenly.
Bake until much of the filling is bubbling (not just the edges), 16 to 18 minutes.
Let cool completely in the pan.
When ready to serve, cut into 16 squares.
Tightly covered, these bars will keep for about five days (though they never last that long).
b7d53a2696.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cold unsalted butter, flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Mix until the dough comes together.
3. Press the dough into a flat disk, wrap it in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
4. In a small saucepan, heat the heavy cream over medium heat until it starts to bubble.
5. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the dark brown sugar and finely grated bittersweet chocolate. Let the mixture cool for a few minutes.
6. In a separate bowl, mix the toasted pecans with the remaining 1/2 cup of packed dark brown sugar.
7. Add the cooled chocolate mixture to the dough, stirring until the dough is well combined.
8. Roll the dough out on a floured surface to a thickness of about 1/4 inch.
9. Cut the dough into desired shapes using a cookie cutter or a sharp knife.
10. Place the cut-out dough shapes on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
11. Bake the cookies for 10-12 minutes, or until they are set and slightly golden around the edges.
12. Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade cookies!

ebbeab0277.gt:
Cover baking sheet with parchment.
Dip 12 plastic teaspoons, 1 at a time, in white chocolate; shake spoon gently over bowl of melted chocolate to remove excess chocolate.
Place on prepared baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
or until chocolate is firm.
Melt semi-sweet chocolate.
Partially dip each spoon in chocolate; return to baking sheet.
Refrigerate 10 min.
Use decorating gels to decorate spoons to resemble snowmen faces as shown in photo.
ebbeab0277.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the melted Baker's White Chocolate and Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate.
3. Add the orange and black decorating gels to the chocolate mixture.
4. If desired, add a pinch of salt to the chocolate mixture.
5. Spread the chocolate mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the chocolate mixture in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the chocolate is set and the edges are slightly crispy.
7. Allow the chocolate to cool for a few minutes before spreading it onto the cake or cookie.
8. Enjoy your delicious chocolate treat!

[/INST]

9405c380d3.gt:
Place a large pot or saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add the butter, allow to melt then add the garlic, ginger, 1/2 of the cream, soy sauce, a few grindings of black pepper, pinch of salt, sugar and sweet potatoes.
Reduce heat to low, cover and cook until the sweet potatoes are very tender, about 45 minutes.
Remove from heat, mash with a potato masher adding the remaining cream.
Taste, adjust seasoning with black pepper and soy sauce as needed.
Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.
9405c380d3.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a large skillet or wok, heat 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat.
2. Add 2 tablespoons of light cream (half&half) and stir to combine.
3. Add 1 teaspoon of sugar and stir to dissolve.
4. Add 2 teaspoons of soy sauce, tamari, and ginger minced fresh. Stir to combine.
5. Add 1 clove of garlic minced and stir to combine.
6. Add 1 pound of sweet potatoes or yams cut into 1/2 inch dice. Stir to combine.
7. Season with black pepper to taste.
8. Cook the mixture for about 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender and slightly caramelized.
9. Add 2 tablespoons of cilantro fresh, chopped, and stir to combine.
10. Cook for an additional 2 minutes or until the cilantro is wilted.

Serve the meal over rice or noodles for a delicious and nutritious dish.

7e82f5698a.gt:
Mix together the ground lamb, basmati rice, 2 tablespoons tomato puree, 1/2 teaspoon mint, salt, and pepper; mix well, and set aside.
Slice the ends off of the zucchinis and hollow out the centers using an apple corer.
Stuff with lamb mixture.
Stir together the remaining tomato puree with 1/2 teaspoon salt in a large skillet.
Place the stuffed zucchini into the sauce, and add enough water to cover the zucchini.
Bring to a simmer over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in the garlic, lemon juice, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of mint.
Recover, and simmer an additional 15 minutes.
To serve, cut the zucchini crosswise into rounds and arrange on a serving plate.
Spoon sauce over the top.
7e82f5698a.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the ground lamb, 1/4 cup of the basmati rice, and 1/2 teaspoon of the dried mint. Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cinnamon. Mix well.
3. In a separate bowl, mix the remaining 1/4 cup of basmati rice, 1/2 teaspoon of dried mint, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, and 1/8 teaspoon of black pepper.
4. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the zucchini and squash, and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender but still crisp. Season with salt and pepper.
5. In a large oven-safe dish, layer the ground lamb mixture, the rice mixture, and the cooked zucchini and squash.
6. Drizzle the lemon juice over the top of the dish.
7. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the lamb is cooked through and the rice is tender.
8. Serve the dish hot, garnished with a sprig of fresh mint.

[/INST]

817c37fbf2.gt:
1.
Line a 9-inch round cake pan with parchment paper and preheat the oven to 350 F/177 C. 2.
Combine water and 1/2 cup of the sugar and bring to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat.
When it hits a boil remove from the heat, add chocolate and stir until the chocolate is completely melted.
Stir in the butter until melted.
Let the mixture cool for about 10 minutes.
3.
Meanwhile, in a large mixing bowl using a whisk attachment, whip the eggs, the remaining sugar, and vanilla extract until is has reached maximum volume.
This process should take about 10 minutes.
4.
Gently fold the chocolate into the egg mixture.
5.
Pour into prepared cake pan and bake for 30 minutes, or until a knife inserted comes out clean.
Remove pan from oven and set on a rack.
6.
Cool then wrap in plastic wrap (with the cake still in the pan) and refrigerate overnight so its easier to work with for decorating.
817c37fbf2.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. In a saucepan, heat the water and sugar over medium heat until the sugar is fully dissolved.
2. Add the chocolate to the saucepan, stirring until melted and smooth.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and let the mixture cool slightly.
4. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs and vanilla extract until well combined.
5. Gradually add the cooled chocolate mixture to the egg mixture, stirring until well combined.
6. Add the melted butter and stir until smooth.
7. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch round cake pan.
8. Bake the cake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
9. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious chocolate cake!

5894d0c850.gt:
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups of flour, sugar, undissolved yeast and salt.
Heat milk, water and 5 tablespoons butter until very warm (120F-130F).
Stir into dry ingredients.
Mix in eggs and enough remaining flour to make soft dough.
Knead on floured surface until smooth, about 6 minutes.
Cover let rest 10 minutes.
Divide dough into 32 pieces; roll into balls.
Melt remaining butter.
Dip balls in butter.
Layer evenly on bottom of greased 10 inch tube pan with non-removable bottom; 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1/2 cup nuts,16 balls, 1/3 cup maple syrup, 1/2 nuts, 16 balls and 1/3 cup maple syrup.
Cover and let rise in warm place until it has doubled in size, about 30-40 minutes.
Bake in 375F preheated oven for 35 minutes or until done.
Cover with foil during the last 10 minutes of baking.
Invert on serving plate.
5894d0c850.pred:
To make the dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, yeast, and salt.
3. Gradually add the milk, water, and melted butter, stirring until a smooth dough forms.
4. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 5-7 minutes.
5. Place the dough in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean cloth, and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
6. Punch the dough down and then roll it out on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
7. Spread the dough with the pure maple syrup and sprinkle with chopped walnuts.
8. Roll the dough up and place it in a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
9. Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let it rise in a warm place until it has doubled in size, about 1-2 hours.
10. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
11. Bake the dough in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until it is golden brown.
12. Remove the dough from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before cutting it into slices.
13. Serve the dough warm or at room temperature.

[/INST]

This recipe is for a delicious, warm, and comforting dessert that combines the flavors of maple syrup, walnuts, and a soft, fluffy dough. The dough is easy to prepare and can be customized with various ingredients, such as nuts, fruits, or chocolate chips, to suit your preferences. The dish is perfect for a cozy evening or a special occasion, and it can be enjoyed with a warm beverage or a scoop of ice cream.

66d695cd65.gt:
For the butter: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Slice the head of garlic in half crosswise and place it on a sheet of aluminum foil.
Drizzle with the olive oil and wrap the foil around the garlic tightly to seal.
Roast for about 1 hour, until the garlic is soft and caramelized.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly.
Squeeze the garlic cloves into the bowl of a food processor with the butter and salt and blend until smooth.
For the steaks: Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Stir together the pepper and salt in a shallow dish and press both sides of each steak into the mixture to coat.
Add the steaks to the pan and cook for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your liking.
Transfer to a cutting board and let steaks rest for 10 minutes.
Slice the steaks into thin slices and spoon the garlic butter over the top.
66d695cd65.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add the steaks to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides, about 3-4 minutes per side.
4. Remove the steaks from the skillet and place them on a baking tray.
5. In a small bowl, mix the kosher salt, black peppercorns, and vegetable oil. Spread the mixture evenly over the steaks.
6. Return the steaks to the oven and cook for 6-8 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 120°F (49°C) for medium-rare.
7. Remove the steaks from the oven and let them rest for 5 minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

1dcfb48390.gt:
Prep: Smash the tofu until it turns into a paste.
Add the tempura batter crumbs and let them soften.
Finely shred the cabbage.
Mix the ingredients together.
Mix the ingredients and cabbage with the tofu and mix very very well.
That's the batter.
Pan fry: Heat oil in a frying pan, cook the pork and pour in the batter.
When the pork is cooked, turn the pancake over to brown the other sides.
When done, transfer to a serving plate, top with the okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, ketchup etc.
to your liking and it's done.
Add some aonori seaweed powder and bonito flakes to taste, and enjoy.
1dcfb48390.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a large pan, heat a small amount of oil over medium heat.
2. Add the tofu and cook until it is golden brown and slightly crispy.
3. Add the cabbage and cook until it is tender but still crunchy.
4. In a small bowl, mix the tempura batter crumbs with the flour, Katakuriko, and water.
5. Dip the pork slices in the batter mixture, ensuring they are evenly coated.
6. Heat a small amount of oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
7. Carefully add the pork slices to the pan and cook until they are golden brown on both sides.
8. Add the cooked tofu, cabbage, and any remaining batter mixture to the pan.
9. Cook everything together until the pork is cooked through and the flavors are well-mixed.
10. Serve the dish on a plate, garnished with aonori and bonito flakes.

Enjoy your delicious Okonomiyaki creation!

60d7ee5f76.gt:
Cover beans with cold water, cover pot and bring to boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 3 hours, adding water as needed.
In a skillet, slowly brown ground beef.
When crumbly, add onion and saute until limp.
Add to beans along with rest of ingredients except the salt and pepper.
Cover and simmer for three hours or until beans are tender and liquid is somewhat thickened.
Add salt and pepper and serve.
60d7ee5f76.pred:
1. Rinse the pinto beans and place them in a large pot with water. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and let them simmer for about 30 minutes or until they are tender but still firm.

2. In a separate pan, heat the ground chuck over medium heat. Season with chili powder, onions, and red hot pepper sauce. Cook until the meat is browned and cooked through.

3. Drain the beans and add them to the pan with the ground chuck. Stir to combine.

4. Add the red chili sauce, vinegar, and tomatoes stewed. Stir to combine and let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes.

5. Serve the dish hot, garnished with fresh cilantro if desired. Enjoy your delicious-looking dish!

176a112293.gt:
Dissolve coffee in water; set aside.
In a mixing bowl, combine milk, pudding mix and cinnamon.
Beat on low speed for 2 minutes; stir in coffee.
Fold in whipped topping and spoon into serving dishes.
Garnish with whipped topping if desired.
176a112293.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the instant coffee granules and boiling water. Stir until the coffee granules are fully dissolved.
2. Add the cold skim milk to the coffee mixture and stir until well combined.
3. Add the sugar-free instant chocolate pudding mix to the coffee mixture and stir until smooth.
4. Add the ground cinnamon and stir to combine.
5. Pour the mixture into a large mixing bowl or a 9x13 inch baking dish.
6. Refrigerate the mixture for at least 2 hours or until it is well chilled.
7. Once chilled, top the mixture with the light whipped topping.
8. Refrigerate the mixture for an additional 30 minutes or until the whipped topping is firm.
9. Serve the dessert immediately or store it in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours.

[/INST]

e29121a9a8.gt:
In a food processor, puree the avocados with the chickpeas, lemon juice and tahini.
Add the 1/2 cup of oil and puree until smooth; season with salt and pepper.
Transfer the dip to a bowl, drizzle with olive oil and serve with crudites, bread and chips.
e29121a9a8.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped avocados, chickpeas, lemon juice, tahini, and olive oil. Mix well to ensure all ingredients are evenly distributed.
2. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Serve the dip in a bowl or on a platter, accompanied by a variety of crudites, bread, and tortilla chips for dipping.

Enjoy your delicious and healthy dip, perfect for a party or gathering with friends and family.

9c8b451253.gt:
Combine the potatoes, tomato, carrot, onion, and bay leaves in a slow cooker.
Place the chicken breasts atop the vegetables.
Stir the tomato sauce, chicken broth, and Italian seasoning in a bowl; pour over the chicken breasts.
Add water as needed to assure the chicken is completely covered.
Cook on Low for 6 hours.
Remove the chicken breasts and cut into bite sized chunks and return to slow cooker.
Continue cooking until the vegetables are tender, another 1 to 2 hours.
9c8b451253.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
3. Add the sliced carrot and cook for another 3 minutes.
4. Add the chopped fresh tomato and cook for 2 minutes.
5. Add the peeled and cubed potatoes, bay leaves, Italian seasoning, red pepper flakes, and water. Stir to combine.
6. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 20-25 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.
7. Remove the bay leaves and season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. While the potatoes are cooking, prepare the chicken breast halves. Season them with salt and pepper, then cook them in a skillet or oven until they are cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
9. Once the potatoes are cooked, add the cooked chicken breast halves to the skillet. Stir to combine.
10. Pour the tomato sauce and chicken broth over the chicken and potatoes. Stir to combine.
11. Cover the skillet and cook in the oven for about 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce is bubbly and hot.
12. Serve the chicken and potato dish hot. Enjoy your culinary masterpiece!

c1e7a519f3.gt:
Place graham squares, side by side, in single layer in ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Microwave caramels and water in microwavable bowl on HIGH 2 to 3 minutes or until caramels are completely melted, stirring after each minute.
Pour over grahams; spread to evenly cover graham squares.
Sprinkle immediately with marshmallows, chocolate and peanuts; press gently into caramel mixture with back of spoon to secure.
Cool completely.
Cut into 24 squares to serve.
c1e7a519f3.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the broken graham crackers, chopped chocolate, and water until the chocolate is melted and smooth.
3. Press the mixture into the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
4. In a small saucepan, heat the caramels over low heat until they are melted and smooth.
5. Pour the melted caramel over the graham cracker mixture in the baking dish.
6. In a small bowl, mix the miniature marshmallows and chopped peanuts.
7. Pour the marshmallow mixture over the caramel layer.
8. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the marshmallows are puffed and golden brown.
9. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Use a spatula to gently lift the marshmallow and caramel mixture from the bottom of the dish, and then carefully transfer it to a serving dish.
11. Cut the dish into 12 equal pieces and serve.

[/INST]

6ee25d7bfc.gt:
Prepare bread pans,.
I just use Pam cooking spray.
In large mixing bowl: Beat eggs until frothy, add sugar, oil, molasses, vanilla, and zucchini, mix well.
Combine flour slowly, add soda,baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Also add nuts if desired.
Pour into bread pans, bake at 325F for 40 to 45 minutes or until you can stick a toothpick in and it comes out clean.
This recipe makes 3 large or 6 small bread pans.
This may vary.
6ee25d7bfc.pred:
[INST] <<SYS>>
To make a delicious and healthy zucchini cake, follow these clear instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, brown sugar (or white sugar and brown sugar), and vanilla. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the zucchini, corn oil, and molasses to the mixing bowl. Mix until well combined.
4. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and walnuts (if using).
5. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until well combined.
6. Pour the batter into a greased and floured 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan.
7. Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
8. Allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely.
9. If desired, you can add raisins (optional) to the cake batter before baking.

Enjoy your delicious zucchini cake!
<</SYS>>

78e1fe788f.gt:
Stir together all sauce ingredients in a small bowl.
Heat oil in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking, then stir-fry garlic and ginger until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and stir-fry until almost cooked through, about 3 minutes.
Add half of romaine and stir-fry until it begins to wilt, then add remaining romaine and stir-fry until just wilted and shrimp are just cooked through, about 1 minute.
Stir sauce, then add to stir-fry and simmer, stirring, 2 minutes.
78e1fe788f.pred:
1. In a small saucepan, combine the reduced-sodium chicken broth, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and cornstarch. Whisk until smooth.
2. Heat the saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and comes to a boil.
3. Remove the saucepan from the heat and stir in the dried hot red-pepper flakes.
4. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and ginger, stirring constantly, until fragrant.
5. Add the shrimp to the skillet, stirring to coat them with the oil. Cook the shrimp until they are pink and cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes.
6. Add the sauce to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
7. Add the romaine hearts to the skillet, stirring to combine. Cook for about 1 minute, or until the lettuce is wilted.
8. Serve the stir-fried shrimp and romaine hearts over a bed of white rice.

[/INST]

1832d9054d.gt:
In a medium saucepan over medium heat, toast the barley in 1 tablespoon olive oil for 2 minutes until it is fragrant and nutty.
Add the chicken stock, bring to a boil, reduce heat to a simmer, cover and cook 45 minutes or until most of the liquid is absorbed.
In a large cast iron (or other oven safe) skillet over medium heat, saute the onion and corn kernels in the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil until onions are slightly softened.
Season with salt and pepper.
Shove the onion and corn to the side of the pan, and add the chorizo into the pan.
Cook the chorizo, breaking it apart as it cooks.
When it is almost browned and cooked through, mix it with the corn and onions then shove the entire mixture to the side.
Create as much open surface on the base of the skillet as possible.
Add the kale, pressing down and turning over until it is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper, then mix it in with the chorizo, corn and onion.
Remove from heat.
Preheat your broiler to high.
Add the cream and 1 cup of cheese into the corn mixture.
Add the cooked barley and mix well.
Spread the entire mixture into an even layer, and top with the panko and remaining cheese.
Place skillet 6 inches under the broiler for 3 minutes until the top is melted and brown.
1832d9054d.pred:
1. Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the pearl barley to the pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until the barley is tender and the onion is translucent, about 15 minutes.
3. Add the chicken stock, 1 cup at a time, stirring constantly to prevent sticking. Allow the stock to be absorbed before adding more.
4. Add the sweet corn kernels, ground pork chorizo, and kale to the pot. Cook until the vegetables are tender and the pork chorizo is cooked through, about 10-15 minutes.
5. Season the dish with salt and pepper to taste.
6. In a small bowl, mix the heavy cream and 1/4 cup of shredded cheddar jack cheese.
7. Add the cream mixture to the pot, stirring to combine. Cook until the cheese is melted and the dish is heated through.
8. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
9. In a small bowl, mix the panko bread crumbs with salt and pepper.
10. Drain the cooked dish and transfer it to a baking dish.
11. Sprinkle the panko bread crumb mixture evenly over the top of the dish.
12. Bake the dish in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the cheese is bubbly and melted.
13. Serve the dish hot, and enjoy!

36b3caf34c.gt:
Preheat the oven to 325.
In a large enameled cast-iron casserole, heat the peanut oil.
Season the pork with salt and pepper.
Add the shanks to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, turning, until browned all over, about 20 minutes; transfer to a plate.
Add the onion to the casserole and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden, about 4 minutes.
Stir in the water, miso, brown sugar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chiles and scallions.
Add the shanks and any juices and bring to a boil.
Cover and braise in the oven for 2 hours, until the pork is very tender.
Garnish with scallions and serve with rice.
36b3caf34c.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the peanut oil over medium heat. Add the pork shanks and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes. Remove the shanks from the pot and set aside.

2. In the same pot, add the onion and cook until softened, about 3-4 minutes. Add the water, miso, sugar, soy sauce, and ginger. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the pork shanks are tender and falling off the bone.

3. Remove the pork shanks from the pot and set aside to cool slightly. Once cooled, use a fork to shred the meat into bite-sized pieces.

4. In a small bowl, whisk together the chiles, garlic, and scallions.

5. To serve, reheat the cooked pork shreds in the pot with the sauce. Serve the pork shreds over cooked white rice, and garnish with the chile mixture.

Enjoy your delicious pork shank and rice dish!

94d70d2bcc.gt:
Wash, dry, and cut broccolini into thirds.
Heat oil over high in a wok or similar type pan.
Stir fry the stems first for about 3-4 minutes.
You may need to turn the heat down to medium high.
Add the top leaf portion, and cook for another 3-4 minutes.
Shut off heat and add oyster sauce, stirring to coat.
Serve.
94d70d2bcc.pred:
[/SYS]

[INST] <<SYS>>
To prepare the dish, start by washing the Broccolini and cutting it into bite-sized pieces. Heat the peanut oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the Broccolini and cook for about 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it is slightly tender but still crisp.

Next, pour the oyster sauce over the cooked Broccolini and stir to combine. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the Broccolini is fully cooked through.

Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy your delicious and healthy Broccolini stir-fry!
<</SYS>>

13ce606661.gt:
May ajust these seasonings to your own taste !
Grind porkfat and mix with lean pork.
Combine well.
Combine all seasonings and mix with pork.
Mix in well with hands and make a small patty and fry until done, Taste your product and ajust seasonings if needed.
Shape into patties and freeze on cookie sheets until hard.
Store in freezer containers until needed.
I use a slider mold to make patties.
Cook time is time in freezer.
13ce606661.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the ground lean pork, pork fat, salt, white pepper, sage, thyme, and cloves.
3. Add the minced garlic and mix well.
4. If desired, add the msg and cayenne pepper for added flavor.
5. Shape the mixture into small meatballs, and place them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
6. Bake the meatballs in the preheated oven for about 15-20 minutes, or until they are cooked through and have a nice golden color.
7. Serve the meatballs with your favorite sauce, such as marinara, barbecue, or a creamy mushroom gravy.

[/INST]

a040895990.gt:
Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
Mix together all ingredients except olive oil and garlic.
Place olive oil in the bottom of a casserole dish or square glass baking dish.
Rub the dish with one bulb of chopped garlic and leave the garlic in the dish.
Pour mixture into baking dish and bake for 30-40 minutes at 325 degrees.
a040895990.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, whisk the beaten egg and milk together.
2. Add the uncooked white rice to the bowl and stir to combine.
3. Add the chopped onion, minced garlic, and fresh parsley to the bowl.
4. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Drizzle the olive oil over the rice mixture, and stir to combine.
6. Grate the parmesan cheese over the rice mixture.
7. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
8. Transfer the rice mixture to a baking dish and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the mixture is hot and bubbly.
9. Serve the appetizing meal hot, garnished with additional parsley if desired.

[/SYS]

ea87319f86.gt:
Roast the eggplant directly over a gas flame, turning occasionally, until charred all over and soft, about 12 minutes.
Transfer to a colander and let cool slightly, then peel and let cool completely.
Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, cook the garlic in the oil over moderate heat until sizzling, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and whisk in the vinegar, honey, rosemary, oregano and minced parsley.
Season the vinaigrette generously with salt and pepper.
Heat a large cast-iron skillet.
In batches if necessary, add the piquillos to the skillet in an even layer.
Cook over high heat, turning once, until lightly charred on both sides, about 2 minutes total.
Add the piquillos to the warm vinaigrette and let cool completely.
In a food processor, combine the eggplant with both cheeses and puree until smooth.
Scrape into a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Spread the whipped eggplant on toasts and, using a slotted spoon, spoon some of the marinated piquillos on top.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve with anchovies.
ea87319f86.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Cut the eggplant into 1/2-inch (1.25 cm) slices and arrange them on a baking sheet. Drizzle them with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Roast the eggplant in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until it is tender and slightly charred.
3. In a large bowl, whisk together the red wine vinegar, honey, minced rosemary, minced oregano, minced parsley, and chopped parsley. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Allow the roasted eggplant to cool slightly. Then, use a fork to mash the eggplant into a coarse puree. Add the red wine vinegar mixture to the eggplant and stir to combine.
5. In a small bowl, mix the goat cheese and cream cheese until smooth.
6. Spread the mashed eggplant mixture onto a serving platter. Top it with the goat cheese and cream cheese mixture.
7. Serve the eggplant dip with toasted bread and marinated white anchovies on the side.

[/INST]

57e41370a3.gt:
Combine flour, baking powder, nutmeg, and salt in one bowl.
In another bow, beat egg yolks slightly.
Beat in milk, bananas, and oil.
Add egg mixture to flour mixture all at once.
Stir just till combined but still slightly lumpy.
In small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold beaten egg whites into flour mixture, leaving a few puffs of egg white.
Do not overmix!
Pour batter onto pre-heated, lightly greased waffle maker.
Bake waffles according to manufacturer's directions.
Serve hot and fresh.
I topped mine with butter and syrup, and they were delicious!
57e41370a3.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, and salt.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks and milk until well combined.
3. Add the mashed ripe banana to the egg yolk mixture, and whisk until smooth.
4. Gradually add the cooking oil to the egg yolk mixture, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
5. Add the nutmeg to the egg yolk mixture, and stir to combine.
6. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the egg yolk mixture, stirring until the batter is smooth and free of lumps.
7. In a clean, dry mixing bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
8. Gently fold the egg whites into the batter, being careful not to overmix.
9. Preheat an oven to 350°F (175°C).
10. Grease a 9-inch (23 cm) round cake pan with cooking spray or butter.
11. Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan, and smooth the top with a spatula.
12. Bake the cake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean.
13. Remove the cake from the oven, and let it cool in the pan for 10 minutes.
14. Then, transfer the cake to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious banana cake!

86b69c2d99.gt:
Combine the vinegar, horseradish cream, and measured salt and pepper in a medium, nonreactive bowl and whisk until thoroughly mixed.
Whisking constantly, slowly pour the oil in a thin stream down the side of the bowl.
Whisk until completely incorporated.
Taste and adjust the seasoning as desired.
86b69c2d99.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix together the champagne vinegar, horseradish cream, kosher salt, and pepper.
3. In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, and minced onion.
4. Add the mixed ingredients from step 2 to the large bowl with the olive oil mixture.
5. Add the chicken to the bowl and toss to coat the chicken evenly with the sauce.
6. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish and bake for 35-40 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
7. Remove the chicken from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into pieces and serving.

[/INST]

522f19c745.gt:
Place flat bread or shell on 14 inch pizza pan (or lightly grease a 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Unroll the pizza dough onto the greased pan, using your hands to press the dough into a 14x 9 inch rectangle, build up the edges slightly.
Bake pizza dough in a 425F oven for 5 minutes.
remove from oven).
In a mixing bowl combine chicken and barbecue sauce, toss to coat.
Spread chicken mixture evenly over pizza crust.
Sprinkle with cheese and chopped spinach.
Bake in a 425F oven for 10 minutes or until crust edge is lightly browned.
Cut flat bread or bread shell into wedges (or cut rectangular pizza into squares.
522f19c745.pred:
To recreate the culinary masterpiece in the image, follow these instructions:

1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. Place the focaccia bread or pizza crusts on a baking sheet or pizza stone.
3. Spread the shredded cooked chicken evenly over the crusts.
4. Drizzle the bottled barbecue sauce over the chicken.
5. Sprinkle the shredded monterey jack cheese over the sauce.
6. Add the finely chopped fresh spinach on top of the cheese.
7. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Enjoy your delicious homemade pizza!

8c32c6a022.gt:
Make the dough.
Put all the dough ingredients except for the olive oil into a plastic bag, and knead it well to make the dough.
When the dough comes together, add the olive oil and keep kneading (10 minutes).
Leave it to rise in the bag (30 minutes).
When the dough has risen, press it down lightly to deflate.
Place it on a kitchen parchment paper lined oven tray and leave to rest for 10 minutes.
Cut up the toppings for the pizza crust.
Slice the sausages diagonally.
Slice the onion and cherry tomatoes.
Defrost the seafood mix.
Put olive oil on your hands, and spread the dough out to cover the oven tray.
Preheat the oven to 300C (or 250C if your oven doesn't get that hot).
Spread the dough with pizza sauce, and cover evenly with toppings of your choice.
Add the pizza cheese to finish.
Bake at 300C for 13 minutes.
Top with something like fresh basil leaves and cut into 8 portions.
It's very hot so be careful.
I tried varying the toppings by section.
You won't get bored with the toppings this way, and looks like fun too.
8c32c6a022.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cake flour, bread flour, sugar, salt, and yeast.
2. Gradually add the lukewarm water, stirring until the dough comes together.
3. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic.
4. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it has doubled in size.
5. Preheat your oven to 200°C (400°F).
6. Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface.
7. Roll out the dough into a large rectangle, about 1/4 inch thick.
8. Spread the pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a 1/2-inch border around the edges.
9. Add the wiener sausages, onion, mixed frozen seafood, cherry tomatoes, and mozzarella cheese evenly over the sauce.
10. Fold the dough over the filling, pressing the edges to seal the filling inside.
11. Transfer the dough to a baking sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
12. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

ac2ebd1a37.gt:
Preheat oven to 450F.
Prebake fresh pizza crust, if using, for 3 to 4 minutes.
Remove from oven, and set aside to cool slightly.
Brush oil on crust.
Top crust with sauce and artichokes.
Sprinkle with soy mozzarella, goat cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove from oven, and serve.
ac2ebd1a37.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. Spread a thin layer of olive oil over the pizza crust, ensuring it is evenly coated.
3. Place the crust in the preheated oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and cooked through.
4. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat the pizza sauce over medium heat.
5. In a separate small saucepan, heat the baby artichokes or artichoke hearts until they are tender but still slightly crunchy.
6. Once the crust is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Spread the cooked pizza sauce evenly over the crust.
8. Add the shredded soy mozzarella, goat cheese, and sun-dried tomatoes to the pizza.
9. Return the pizza to the oven and bake for an additional 5-7 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
11. Slice the pizza into wedges and serve.

Enjoy your delicious, homemade pizza!

03321392c1.gt:
Spread cut sides of roll with dressing and mustard.
Fill with remaining ingredients.
03321392c1.pred:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Place the kaiser roll on a baking sheet, and lightly brush it with MIRACLE WHIP Light Dressing.
3. Spread the Dijon mustard over the top of the dressing.
4. Add the shredded carrots and mixed green pepper strips on top of the mustard.
5. Place the slices of smoked turkey breast on top of the vegetables.
6. Bake the kaiser roll in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the bread is golden brown and the turkey is cooked through.
7. Remove the baked kaiser roll from the oven, and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing it in half.
8. Serve the sandwich on a plate, and enjoy!

[/INST]

95fc2c99a6.gt:
Combine dry ingredients in large bowl.
Whisk remaining ingredients together; stir into dry mixture just until moistened.
Pour batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto a hot nonstick griddle coated with nonstick cooking spray.
Turn when bubbles form on top of pancakes; cook until second side is golden brown.
95fc2c99a6.pred:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the buckwheat flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove.
2. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg and low-fat buttermilk.
3. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until a smooth dough forms.
4. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
5. Grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper.
6. On a floured surface, roll out the dough to a thickness of about 1/2 inch (1.25 cm).
7. Cut out circles of dough using a cookie cutter or a round glass.
8. Place the dough circles on the prepared baking sheet.
9. Bake the cookies for 12-15 minutes, or until they are golden brown around the edges.
10. Remove the cookies from the oven and let them cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Enjoy your delicious homemade buckwheat cookies!

b067e71075.gt:
Heat the oven to 450 degrees F and arrange a rack in the middle.
Place a baking sheet upside down in the oven while its heating.
Remove chorizo from its casing and place in a medium frying pan over medium-high heat.
Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned, about 7 minutes.
Remove to a plate and set aside.
Add 2 tablespoons of the olive oil to the pan.
Add mushrooms and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
Cook, stirring rarely, until beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
Roll out pizza dough to a 10-inch round, remove the hot baking sheet from the oven, drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, and carefully place dough on the upside-down baking sheet.
Scatter chorizo, mushrooms, Jack cheese, and Parmesan cheese on top.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake until cheese is melted and crust is crisp and browned, about 15 minutes.
b067e71075.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the Mexican chorizo and cook until it is browned and crispy, breaking it into smaller pieces as it cooks.
3. In a separate bowl, combine the cremini mushrooms, olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread the mushrooms evenly on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized.
4. While the mushrooms are cooking, roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness. Transfer the dough to a pizza stone or a baking sheet.
5. Spread the shredded Jack cheese evenly over the dough.
6. In a small bowl, mix the grated Parmesan cheese with a little bit of olive oil.
7. Add the cooked Mexican chorizo and roasted mushrooms to the pizza dough.
8. Drizzle the Parmesan cheese mixture over the top of the pizza.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
10. Remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

[/INST]

3427daffb8.gt:
Mix the oils and teriyaki sauce in a skillet, and warm over medium heat.
Baste eggs in skillet, turning constantly, until eggs turn dark brown (5 minutes).
Remove eggs from pan.
Mix garlic salt and pepper into oils in skillet.
Stirfry broccoli until tender crisp (3 minutes), then melt cheese on top.
Serve eggs with broccoli.
3427daffb8.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
2. In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, sesame oil, and teriyaki sauce until well combined.
3. Add the hard-boiled eggs to the bowl and toss them to coat them evenly with the sauce.
4. Spread the coated eggs evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Roast the eggs in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until they are cooked through and slightly crispy on the outside.
6. While the eggs are cooking, chop the broccoli into bite-sized pieces.
7. In a large skillet, heat the garlic salt and pepper over medium heat. Add the broccoli and cook until it is tender but still slightly crunchy.
8. If desired, add shredded swiss cheese to the skillet and cook until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Serve the cooked eggs on a plate, topped with the broccoli and cheese mixture.

[/INST]

08e438e0f5.gt:
If you happen to use larger potatoes for the double batch, halve the large potatoes because the small ones for the regualr batch can be left whole.
Place all the potatoes in a deep pot and cover with water.
Place a lid on the potatoes and bring it to a boil.
Once it starts to boil, uncover and cook until tender (about twelve to fifteen minutes).
Then drain potatoes and put them back into the hot pot.
Add the butter, the seasoning package, milk and cheese.
It really depends on how creamy and cheesy you like your potatoes when deciding how much you want to add of the milk and cheese.
Smash the potatoes until they are the desired texture.
Add the amount of salt and pepper to taste you like and enjoy.
08e438e0f5.pred:
To prepare the meal shown in the image, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash and peel the small red potatoes, then cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large bowl, combine the small red potatoes, butter, Italian salad dressing mix, and milk. Mix well to coat the potatoes evenly.
4. Transfer the potato mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and golden brown.
5. While the potatoes are baking, wash the large red potatoes, peel them, and cut them into bite-sized pieces.
6. In a large bowl, combine the large red potatoes, butter, Italian salad dressing mix, and milk. Mix well to coat the potatoes evenly.
7. Transfer the potato mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 30-40 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and golden brown.
8. Once the potatoes are cooked, let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

[/INST]

934deaadde.gt:
Boil chicken, salt& poultry in approximately 2 quarts of water.
Remove chicken and set aside.
Add 3 cups milk (more for a richer flavor), bouillon cubes, and butter to broth.
Bring to almost a boil.
Add water to the flour to make a thin solution and pour in broth.
Stir well, reduce heat, and let simmer to thicken.
Add salt and pepper to taste.
Pinch each biscuit to small pieces and put in broth.
Stir often so dumplings won't stick together.
When dumplings begin to sink, they are almost ready.
Pick chicken to small pieces and add to broth.
When dumplings are not gummy to taste, it is ready to eat.
934deaadde.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Season the chicken breasts with salt and poultry seasoning.
3. In a large pot, combine the chicken bouillon cubes, real butter, and milk. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 15 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, in a separate bowl, mix the flour with a little bit of water to create a slurry.
5. Once the chicken is cooked through, remove it from the pot and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces and return it to the pot.
7. Add the flour slurry to the pot, stirring constantly to avoid lumps. Cook the mixture over low heat for about 5 minutes, or until it thickens.
8. Remove the chicken and flour mixture from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Cut the biscuits into bite-sized pieces and add them to the chicken and flour mixture. Stir to combine.
10. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the biscuits are golden brown and the chicken is cooked through.
11. Serve the chicken and biscuit mixture hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

[/INST]

[INST]<<SYS>>
The appetizing meal shown in the photo consists of chicken and biscuits. To prepare this dish, follow the instructions provided above. Ensure that you have all the necessary ingredients, such as chicken breasts, salt, poultry seasoning, chicken bouillon cubes, real butter, milk, and biscuits. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C), and follow the step-by-step instructions to create a delicious and satisfying meal.

1f141c8991.gt:
Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In bowl, mix together tomatoes, onion and cilantro.
Squeeze lime into the tomato mixture and toss until blended.
Arrange a single layer of chips on heatproof platter or baking sheet.
Top with spoonfuls of chili, tomato mixture, olives and cheese.
Add jalapeno slices, if desired.
Repeat layers until all the ingredients are used.
Bake 15 minutes or until cheese is completely melted.
Serve nachos hot.
1f141c8991.pred:
To make this delicious dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add the chopped plum tomatoes and cook for another 5 minutes, until they are softened and slightly mushy.
3. Add the chopped cilantro and cook for 1 minute, stirring to combine.
4. Squeeze the lime over the mixture and stir to combine.
5. In a separate bowl, combine the HORMEL Chili With Beans, sliced pitted ripe olives (if using), and shredded cheese.
6. Pour the chili mixture over the vegetable mixture in the skillet, stirring to combine.
7. If desired, add a pinch of freshly ground black pepper and a squeeze of lime juice to taste.
8. Serve the dish over corn tortilla chips, and garnish with a fresh jalapeno chile (if using) and some chopped cilantro.

Enjoy your delicious homemade chili with beans and corn tortilla chips!

c799c55881.gt:
Combine the sun-dried tomatoes, parsley, butter, and Tabasco in a medium bowl and mix into a uniform paste.
Taste and season with salt and pepper as needed.
Place 8 slices of the toasted bread on a work surface.
Spread an even amount of the tomato butter on each slice, using it all up.
Set the remaining 4 unbuttered bread slices aside.
Place 2 pieces of bacon each on the buttered sides of 4 of the bread slices.
Top the bacon with 1/4 cup of the arugula per sandwich.
Top the arugula with a slice of the unbuttered bread.
Place a quarter of the sardines on top of each unbuttered piece of bread and season with pepper.
Top the sardines with another 1/4 cup of the arugula per sandwich, and finish with a slice of buttered bread, buttered-side down.
Slice each sandwich in half and serve.
c799c55881.pred:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large bowl, mix the sun-dried tomato slices, chopped parsley, and butter. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
3. Spread the mixture evenly on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Roast the mixture in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the tomatoes are golden brown and the mixture is crispy.
4. In a small bowl, mix the sardines with a fork, breaking them up into smaller pieces.
5. Toast the slices of bread.
6. In a large skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. Drain the bacon on paper towels and chop it into small pieces.
7. In a large bowl, combine the arugula, sardines, and chopped bacon. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Serve the sardine and bacon salad on top of the crispy tomato mixture.

[/INST]

79b26bed8a.gt:
Spray 8 x 8-inch casserole dish with vegetable cooking spray or grease with olive oil.
In a skillet, saute onion and garlic until soft in a little olive oil.
Toss with the cooked pasta.
Add and toss with the herbs, salt, pepper, a little (about 2 tsp.)
of the Parmesan cheese, all the ricotta, and beaten egg.
Toss well together.
Spread and press down half of the mixture in the prepared casserole dish.
Layer with half the tomato slices and zucchini.
Sprinkle with half of the Parmesan and mozzarella.
Repeat the process again.
Cover dish with foil and bake in a preheated 350F (180C) oven for 35 minutes.
Uncover and bake another 5 to 10 minutes, until cheese in oozy and light golden brown.
Let cool for 5 to 10 minutes before cutting into squares like lasagna.
79b26bed8a.pred:
1. Cook pasta according to package instructions until al dente.
2. In a large bowl, combine the cooked pasta, onion, garlic, eggs, ricotta cheese, basil, parsley, salt, and pepper.
3. Transfer the pasta mixture to a large baking dish.
4. Add the sliced zucchini and tomatoes on top of the pasta.
5. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese on top of the vegetables.
6. Drizzle olive oil over the top of the dish.
7. Bake in a preheated oven at 350°F (175°C) for about 25-30 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
8. Sprinkle the parmesan cheese on top and continue baking for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is golden brown and bubbly.

[/INST]

d859113e86.gt:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Grease and flour a loaf pan and set aside.
Combine the eggs, oil, pumpkin and water in a large bowl.
Sift the dry ingredients together and stir into the pumpkin mixture.
Stir in walnuts.
Pour into the prepared loaf pan and bake for one hour or until a tester inserted near the center comes out clean.
d859113e86.pred:
To cook the dish, follow these steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs, oil, pumpkin, water, sugar, flour, salt, nutmeg, cinnamon, and baking soda. Mix until well combined.
3. Add the black walnuts to the mixture and stir to combine.
4. Pour the batter into a greased 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Bake the casserole for 45-50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the casserole comes out clean.
6. Allow the casserole to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your delicious homemade pumpkin casserole!

91e966c057.gt:
Wash, scrape and slice carrots into 1/4 inch thick rounds.
Bring water to a boil in a heavy saucepan.
Add carrots and garlic, cover, and cook about 15 minutes, or until tender (but still firm).
Drain carrots and place in serving bowl.
Mix remaining ingredients and pour over the carrots.
Toss, then cover with plastic wrap and set aside for about 30 minutes before serving at room temperature.
91e966c057.pred:
To prepare the appetizing meal shown in the photo, follow these steps:

1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. Wash the carrots thoroughly and peel them if desired.
3. Cut the carrots into bite-sized pieces.
4. In a large bowl, combine the carrots, water, garlic clove, paprika, cumin, olive oil, red wine vinegar, and parsley. Mix well.
5. Season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
6. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the carrots are tender and slightly caramelized.
7. Remove the baking dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
8. Serve the carrot and paprika mixture as a side dish or a main course, garnished with freshly ground black pepper if desired.

Enjoy your delicious and appetizing meal!

a22e0c83cf.gt:
1.
Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
Drain.
Place pasta in a large bowl; keep warm.2.
Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion; saute 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add garlic and tomatoes; saute 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
Sprinkle shrimp with Cajun seasoning, red pepper, and salt.
Add shrimp mixture to pan; saute 3 minutes or until shrimp are almost done; remove from heat.
Stir in half-and-half.
Pour shrimp mixture over pasta; toss.
Sprinkle with parsley.Wine note: Linguine with Spicy Shrimp combines peppery heat with a creamy sauce, making a fuller-bodied white a good partner.
Little Penguin Chardonnay 2008 ($6), from Australia, has tropical and pear fruit, with just a bit of sweetness and refreshing acidity.
--Jeffery Lindenmuth
a22e0c83cf.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large pot, bring 8 ounces of uncooked linguine to a boil.
2. In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. Add 3 garlic cloves, minced, and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
3. Add 2 plum tomatoes, chopped, and cook until they begin to release their juices, about 5 minutes.
4. Add 1 pound of peeled and deveined medium shrimp to the skillet, and cook until they are pink and cooked through, about 3-4 minutes.
5. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons Cajun seasoning, 1/2 teaspoon ground red pepper, and 1/8 teaspoon salt to the skillet. Cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, or until the shrimp are cooked through and the seasoning is well combined.
6. In a small bowl, whisk together 1/2 cup of half-and-half and 1/3 cup of chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley.
7. Drain the cooked linguine and add it to the skillet with the shrimp mixture. Toss to combine, and then pour the cream mixture over the top.
8. Cook the pasta and shrimp mixture over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, or until the linguine is cooked through and the sauce is heated through.
9. Serve the dish immediately, and enjoy!

[/INST]

5131480fd6.gt:
Combine all ingredients.
Marinate fish from 1-2 hours depending on thickness.
Use to baste while cooking.
5131480fd6.pred:
To cook the mystery dish, follow these steps:

1. In a large bowl, combine the sweet sherry, salad oil, soy sauce, brown sugar, minced garlic, and Worcestershire sauce. Mix well.
2. Season the mixture with ground pepper to taste.
3. Preheat a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
4. Add the mixture to the skillet or wok, stirring constantly to ensure even cooking.
5. Cook the sauce for about 5-7 minutes, or until it reaches the desired thickness.
6. Serve the dish over rice or noodles, and enjoy!

This dish is a delicious combination of flavors, with the sweet sherry, salad oil, soy sauce, and brown sugar creating a rich and savory sauce. The garlic adds a touch of depth and warmth, while the Worcestershire sauce adds a unique tanginess. The ground pepper complements the other flavors, enhancing the overall taste of the dish.

74d3b41960.gt:
Use both hands to massage the Honey Vinegar Miso Chicken Breasts to soften the muscle fibers.
Break it up into large pieces.
Salt the cucumber and roll on a cutting board.

30325f1814.gt:
Beans: trim and remove strings if you choose, then wash them.

Cook bacon and reserve fat.

Remove liquid mixture from the stove, add the string beans, almonds and crumbled bacon.
Mix well and put in a serving dish.

5a55d2d191.gt:

Line a baking sheet with paper towels.

Flatten the patties with a fork, and fry until golden brown and crisp on the bottom, 5 to 8 minutes.
Flip and cook on the other side, sprinkle with salt, then set the cooked patties aside on the prepared baking sheet in the preheated oven while you finish cooking the latkes.

540bbf9ab0.gt:
For the muffins: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 2 muffin tins.
In the bowl of a stand mixer, add butter and 1 cup sugar.
Cream for 3-5 minutes or until fluffy and pale in color.
Add the vanilla.
Add the eggs one a time, mixing after each addition.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, cream of tartar, and nutmeg.
Add the flour mixture and sour cream alternately to the butter mixture, starting and ending with the flour.
Scrape down the bowl as needed.
Fold in the cinnamon chips.
In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 1 cup of sugar and tablespoons of cinnamon.
Using an ice cream scoop, scoop the batter into the cinnamon-sugar mixture and roll around to coat completely, making sure not to press your fingers into the batter while you roll.
Place the coated muffins into the prepared tins.
Bake for 20-22 minutes, or until golden brown and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Remove from the oven and let cool in the pans for 5 minutes before removing them to a wire rack to cool completely.

Drizzle the glaze over the warm muffins with a spoon or a fork.

abf7924ee4.gt:
Start by heating olive oil in a skillet over high heat.
When the pan is pretty hot, add the garlic and cook for 1 minute literally.
You dont want the garlic to burn.
We used 3 cloves of garlic, but we probably should have used 4.
I love that stuff!
Add the butter and stir to melt.
Then add the heavy cream.
Stir well and heat for 5 minutes.
Add the flour.
This will help thicken the sauce.
Although corn starch could be used instead, I tend to stay away from that unless I absolutely need to use it.
Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Then add the salt and pepper.
We used more pepper than salt, but thats entirely up to you.
Add the ground nutmeg, and stir.
At the end of the process, add the grated cheese, stir and then add in the parsley, which will add some green and liven up the dish.
Serve with pasta (we used tortellini) and enjoy!

5. Gradually add the flour, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens.
6. Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
7. Add the grated nutmeg and Parmesan cheese, stirring to combine.
8. Cook the sauce for a few more minutes, stirring occasionally, until it reaches the desired consistency.
9. Remove the sauce from the heat and stir in the chopped parsley.
10. Serve the sauce over the cooked pasta or noodles, and enjoy your delicious dish.

Peel and dice Avocados.

Slice limes into wedges and set aside.
Finely dice Cilantro and set aside.

Enjoy!

102b043149.gt:
1.
Make the seasoned rice vinegar (sushi-su): Combine the vinegar, sugar, salt, and kombu (if you are using it) in a small saucepan.
Place the saucepan over medium-high heat and cook, stirring until the sugar and salt dissolve.
When the mixture is clear, remove the saucepan from the heat and set it aside to cool.
Discard the piece of kombu.
The vinegar can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 month.
2.
Make the sushi rice: Cook rice according to package directions.
Transfer freshly cooked hot rice to a wide shallow bowl.
Pour a small amount of the seasoned vinegar evenly over the rice.
Toss the rice by gently cutting into it vertically with your rice paddle (or spatula), and then lifting the rice and turning it over.
As you do this, fan the rice with a hand fan or piece of cardboard (or get someone to help you).
Add more of the seasoned vinegar and continue the cutting, folding, and fanning process.
Fanning the rice facilitates quick cooling, which gelatinizes the surface of the rice and gives a glossy finish to it.
Towards the end, taste the rice occasionally to decide how much of you seasoned vinegar you want to add.
3.
Cover the seasoned rice with a moist cloth or plastic wrap until ready to use.
